Google Analytics/ Data CollectionShould be responsible for developing and implementing digital tagging using Google tag manager for capturing data to track digital analytics and marketing efforts, to determine brand and campaign effectiveness.Implement appropriate analytics measurement codes and features on websites to support the measurement plans as outlined by stakeholders.Work with interactive marketing teams (paid media, social media, organic search engine optimization) for tracking in their areas and merging of their data with web analytics, as needed.A good understanding of Google ecosystem and can perform tagging across all Google platforms including marketing platforms.Strong knowledge in tracking methods, data layer manipulation, and the transformation and usage of custom JavaScript to Google Tag ManagerWork with program managers/customer service team for timely implementation of changes in tagging due to site changesTroubleshoot tagging and data layer issues, utilizing staging environments for testing and deploying solutions.Seek out and learn new web analytics technology and techniques that can be applied to the scope of work.Document processes & best practices for training purposes.Complete user acceptance tests and auditing for function continuity pre/post website updates.Conduct periodic audits of analytics tags, performing clean-up of any existing tags and coordinating with various business teams to remove tags after the deployment period has expired.Develop reports to support operational monitoring of analytics functionality.
Power BI/TableauStrong experience with Power BI - Experienced in all aspects of Power BI, including establishing gateways, use of embedding, DAX queries.Developing visual reports, KPI scorecards, and dashboards using Power BI desktop/Tableau desktop.Connecting data sources, importing data, and transforming data for Business intelligence.Extensive experience in developing, maintaining and managing Tableau driven dashboards & analytics and working knowledge of Tableau administration/architecture.Ability to design and deploy Graphic visualizations with Drill Down and Drop-down menu option and Parameterized using Tableau.Capable of implementing row-level security on data along with an understanding of application security layer models in Power BI.Created reports, publish dashboards, data source and schedules on Tableau server.Extensive knowledge in various reporting objects like Facts, Attributes, Hierarchies, filters, Calculated fields, Sets, Groups, Parameters etc., in Tableau.Should be able to develop tabular and multidimensional models that are compatible with data warehouse standards.Work with data engineers to tackle technical challenges associated with building fast and interactive visualizations on large datasetsVery good communication skills must be able to discuss the requirements effectively with the client teams, and with internal teams.

Profile 3 to 5 years minimum of experience.Experience on Google Analytics, Data Engineering with with PowerBI / Tableau

title: Data Analyst: Revenue Projects and Analytics - Barcelona - Fixed Term Contract
description:
At Fitch, we have an open culture where employees are able to exchange ideas and perspectives, throughout the organization, irrespective of their seniority. Your voice will be heard allowing you to have a real impact. We embrace diversity and appreciate authenticity encouraging an environment where employees can be their true selves. Our inclusive and progressive approach helps us to keep a balanced perspective. Fitch is also committed to supporting its employees by advancing conversations around diversity, equity and inclusion.
Fitch’s Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) have been established by employees who have joined together as a workplace community based on similar backgrounds or life experiences. Fitch’s ERGs are available to connect employees with others within the organization to offer professional and personal support.
With our expertise, we are not only creating data and information, but also producing timely insights from every angle to influence decision making in this ever changing and highly competitive market. We have a relentless hunger to innovate and unlock the power of human insights and to drive value for our customers. There has never been a better time to make an impact and we invite you to join us on this journey.
Department OverviewBRM’s global Revenue Projects and Pricing Analytics Team is responsible for enhancing and reconfiguring internal processes, data analysis, & reporting related to revenues and pricing, in order to increase data quality, and implement a data-driven approach of analysing revenue opportunities and pricing to support decision making.
Job DescriptionThis position is for a Data Analyst who has is able to work with, understand and analyse large amount of financial data.
ResponsibilitiesAssessing quality of data in order to reconcile, and/or clean data.Organising data into usable formats.Working with reporting teams and project managers to set-up data infrastructure for certain data types.Generating information and insights from data sets and identifying trends and patterns.Creating visualisations of data and preparing reports for executive and project teams.Communicating regularly and effectively with project stakeholders.Supporting the programme manager in the overall successful delivery of projects. 
Qualifications And ExperienceHighly proficient in excel and other data analysis / database tools.Proficient in Word, PowerPoint.Strong people management skills. 
Nice To HaveExperience of working with Salesforce. 
Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Wholly owned by the Hearst Corporation, we are comprised of three main businesses: Fitch Ratings | Fitch Solutions | Fitch Learning.
Fitch is committed to providing global securities markets with objective, timely, independent and forward-looking credit opinions. To protect Fitch’s credibility and reputation, our employees must take every precaution to avoid conflicts of interests or any appearance of a conflict of interest. Should you be successful in the recruitment process at Fitch Ratings you will be asked to declare any securities holdings and other potential conflicts prior to commencing employment. If you, or your immediate family, have any holdings that may conflict with your work responsibilities, you may be asked to divest yourself of them before beginning work.
Fitch is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Data Product Analyst
description:
Description

Wallbox is a global company, dedicated to changing the way the world uses energy. We do this by creating smart charging systems that combine innovative technology with outstanding design and manage the communication between vehicle, grid, building, and charger.

Founded in 2015, with headquarters in Barcelona and selling already in over 80+ countries, our mission is to facilitate the adoption of electric vehicles today to make more sustainable use of energy tomorrow. Our talent has no borders - we welcome over 900 Wallboxers from over 45 nationalities in Europe, Asia, and the Americas!

We’re now the first Spanish unicorn listed on the NYSE (WBX) and have been recently named amongst LinkedIn’s top 3 Spanish startups.

In day-to-day life, you will see our core values shining through our Wallboxers. The passion and dedication towards our mission will hit you the moment you walk through our doors - and there’s no feeling like it.

Our journey is not plain sailing - it requires proactive, flexible and top performing individuals who are committed to the world of sustainable mobility. But one thing is for sure - it's going to be a fun ride!

The question is: are you ready to change the world with us?

You Will
Be responsible for improving the in-App experience of our usersEngage with internal stakeholders to gain an understanding of the problems that need to be solved and gather requirements for analytical tasksModel and evaluate user and device behaviour in order to identify potential value of planned projectsDevelop and evaluate A/B test experiments or other analyses to measure and report the performance of released featuresEnable data driven product development through analysis of device, in-app, and external dataExtract, load and reconcile large data sets from multiple system platforms and sources.Utilize SQL or other advanced analytic tools to perform data extract and query functions..Build post-measure dashboards that will serve as a feature monitoring tool for diverse stakeholdersBe involved throughout the complete product lifecycle in order to guarantee a data-driven process

Requirements

Must have:
Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, Engineering or other fields with a strong mathematical-statistical background2+ years experience in working in a data driven analytics environment including an understanding of how to engage and influence decision makersExceptional analytical skills, lateral thinking and experience in solving highly challenging problemsBe fluent with one or more common data-related programming languages (Python or R)Very good knowledge of SQL and experience in working with large data sets Fluent in business English 

Nice to have
Experience in working with predictive modelsExperience in working with Data Visualisation tools (e.g.Tableau, Qlikview)Experience in working with Product Analytics tool (e.g. Mixpanel) Experience in Energy, Mobility or Automotive industry will be good to have

Benefits
Half-day Fridays! First class private health insurance after your first month at Wallbox Online group training sessions twice a week & other out of office activitiesUse one of our EVs for a weekend and/or a week (car sharing) and test our products in your home (beta testing) to become a valuable source of feedbackFree online language classes (Spanish & English) twice a weekFlexible compensation valid for restaurants & food delivery apps, transportation, childcare, and learning & development. Hundreds of discounts in different brands & services with our Wallbox Circle benefits platformCar discounts & special advantages if you choose an EV!Smartpoint for all your online orders & services at our officesFree coffee & soft drinks to fuel those tough Monday morningsVariety of breakfast and lunch dishes, everyday, at a discounted price at our canteenLearn and grow in a company of over 45 nationalities and counting! No suits! Unless it's Carnival or Halloween 

Please submit your CV in English
At Wallbox, we’re committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We strive to be a more equal opportunity workplace.

title: CX Strategy Data Analyst Intern (They/She/He)
description:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, you’ll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives… all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Your Work-life Opportunity

Reporting to Sr. CX Project Manager, you will be part of a small multicultural A-team of super-achievers with a huge impact in the company, aiming to deconstruct, synthesize, and deploy initiatives to drive best-in-class customer experience. Ownership and Responsibilities will be given to you from Day one.

You will be thrown at different tasks and problems that are identified as key areas for improvement that affect customer happiness. The learning curve will be steep as this role entails understanding all the touchpoints (and pain points) of the whole customer journey and being able to identify root causes and solutions to improve them.

The team is by nature cross-functional, so most of the time and energy is spent collaborating with multiple departments from Operations and Customer Service to Finance, Strategy, Growth and Tech.

Are you looking for a challenging experience in one of the fastest-growing Startups in Europe? Do you want to contribute to building a world-class Customer Experience?

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will

Be a key asset for CX strategic decision making:
Support CX team on internal consulting projects with the goal of gaining insights, identifying root causes and coming up with brand new ideas for strategies and solutions to deliver a world-class experience to Glovo customersSupport senior management and leadership team in strategic decision making by providing key intelligenceTrack and report customer experience KPIs & performance
Master Glovo Data
Provide support on all data related queries by conducting exploratory analysis via SQL (occasionally python), including verifying data quality, analyzing data, isolating and diagnosing the problem and resolving the issueTranslate data insights into quantifiable business opportunities and actionable proposalsDesign, publish and maintain dashboards and visualization tools to facilitate reporting
Collaborate & Foster CX Mindset
Actively collaborate with your colleagues and learn from each other in a supportive environment that allows you to grow, develop and make a differenceDrive Customer focused actions and a CX mindset within all teams of Glovo (extremely cross-functional role)Proactively contribute with experience blindspots, constantly have an eye open for the real experience and continuously drive Glovo end to end Customer Journey to the next levelActively collaborate with your colleagues and learn from each other in a supportive environment that allows you to grow, develop and make a difference 
You Have
Availability for 6 months full-time internshipStudying or just graduated from a bachelor or master degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Business Management, Economics, Statistics, or other disciplines with demonstrated technical exposurePrevious internship/trainee experience in business analyst, engineering or other technical positions, start-ups, consulting, investment banking, VC, PE are highly preferredStrong SQL skills - able to extract, manipulate, transform and analyze large volumes of data by building complex queries with a high level of accuracy; Looker, PowerBI, Tableau and Python skills are highly preferredA strong grasp of statistical concepts, especially those related to experiment design and analysisStrong analytical mindset to deliver effective & pragmatic solutionsExcellent attention to detail - you are methodical and thorough in your analyses (problem statement, data discovery to result in communication)Excellent communication, visualization & storytelling with data skills to both scientific and business audiencesFluent in English, any additional language is a plusGlobal mentality and international experiencesProblem solver and a structured and sharp mindTeam player and proactive can-do attitudeResponsible and able to prepare quality reliable outputsWilling to take responsibility from day 1An empathetic, inclusive and curious attitude
We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!

Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Monthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products and zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders! Flexible time off (take the time you need) and hybrid working model (own your time) Online therapy and wellbeing benefit Discounted gym memberships Paid internship 
What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quickly Good Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openlyStay Humble: Self-aware and open to learningCare: Uplift people and the planetGlownership: Act as proud ownersHigh Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

title: Data Scientist - Insurance / Financial Services Background
description:
Our opportunity 

Group Audit is responsible for performing audits over the whole of Zurich's operations globally. We are looking for a Data Scientist in EMEA to join our audit hub in Barcelona being part of our global Internal Audit organization. You will contribute to the Group Audit global team in terms of professional skills, technical knowledge, energy and motivation.

Our mandate is to provide independent and objective assurance to the Zurich Boards of Directors and Audit Committees as well as to the Group CEO and Senior Management. To deliver this mandate, Group Audit works as a fully virtually integrated team, with a one-global-team mindset across the 19 countries where our teams are located.

You will play a key role in implementing our data science and analytics strategy and embed our data science function in our Group Internal Audit lifecycle. You will implement tools and strategies to translate raw data into valuable business insights to help Group Audit to enhance the focus of the Group Audit Annual Audit Plan and shape the individual audits around the identified risks, as well support data analytics approach on individual audits in various countries.

As part of your work you will participate in global audits and Group Audit wide initiatives and interact with leaders and team members from other countries. In Zurich Group audit you will be part of a professional Internal Audit department rated as one of the top 10% in our peer group.

 Your role 

 As a Data Scientist, your main responsibilities will involve: 

 Deliver data analytics and science strategy and projects on data ingestion, validation, mining, engineering work streams, modeling, visualization, and communication of deliverables  Manage resources and deliverables to meet agreed outcomes and timeliness on the Global Themed audits and the Global Maturity Assessments and any defined global tasks  Support synthesizing distinctive analytical and risk insights into compelling ideas and messages communicated to both internal and external stakeholders, in collaboration with Audit Teams and Audit Functional Leads  Test and validate hypotheses to generate distinctive analytical and risk insights that can deliver improved Annual Audit Plan and actionable business insights and audit exceptions across the Audit lifecycle  Guide and support auditors to perform analytics works on multiple key business processes  Assess, capture, and translate complex business and data requirements from a broad range of sources and functions into a structured analytics use case and testing audit hypothesis  Scan a broad spectrum of internal/external, structured/unstructured data sources to define the optimal data set for testing the hypotheses  Partner and collaborate across the organization to connect data sources to build the data set, including assurance functions  Support preparation of internal/external, structured/unstructured data sets to troubleshoot data-related problems and authorize maintenance or modifications of data in RADAR to discover ways of enhancing them (new technologies, new techniques, upgrades etc.)  Utilize a hypothesis-driven problem-solving approach to design, construct, and rapidly test/iterate exploratory analyses that will reveal insight and opportunities for Group Audit  Create robust documentation of solutions and underlying design decisions and operating procedures  Fostering the daily use of data systems and implement efficient and secure procedures for data handling in adherence to legal and company standards  Support in design of Group Audit data architecture and demand side governance model, alignment of data dictionary across Group Audit systems, advance digitalisation of Group Audit  Formulate techniques for quality data collection to ensure adequacy, accuracy and legitimacy of data, and where possible automation  Provide training support as directed by the Data Scientist Lead for the Data Science Specialists and Group Audit Community and actively contribute to the Global Competency network for data science. 

Your Skills And Experience

 As a Data Scientist your skills and qualifications will ideally include: 

 BSc/BA in Math, Statistics, Data Management, Econometric, Computer Science, Actuarial or related quantitative field from an accredited college or university  Job holder should have 3+ years’ experience in digital analytics/statistics, econometrics, decision science projects, or related activities  Knowledge of Internal Audit processes and Insurance industry experience is a plus  Organization, analytical mindset and problem solving skills  Exhibits high professional and ethical behavior  Good communications skills, with good verbal and written English with ability to explain technical concepts and analytics-driven findings to business stakeholders  Ability to work customer focused, collaborative, flexible, persistent and results-oriented  Ability to work without close supervision and to take decisions autonomously, subject to verification  Cope with varying workloads, pressures, and priorities.  Proficiency with sophisticated analytics tools and programming languages (e.g., SAS, SPSS, R, Python, SQL) and visualization platforms such as Tableau, Qlikview, PowerBI, IDEA, ACL, SPOTFIRE etc. 

Additional Information

 As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes: 

 Option to work remotely within Spain even up to 80% - you choose  Flexible working hours  Wide range of internal and external trainings  Free English, German and Spanish classes depending on the needs  Ticket restaurant  Life Insurance  Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company  Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you  Special banking and insurance conditions  Exclusive Employees discounts 

 Primary work location is Barcelona  . Please apply with your CV in English.

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

title: Data Analyst
description:
¿De qué va la empresa en la que trabajarás? 

Somos Slashmobility, una empresa de soluciones móviles corporativas, la cual desde hace 10 años viene centrado su misión en acelerar la digitalización tecnológica de la sociedad, como si esto no fuera suficiente, en este tiempo ha sido el lugar donde más de 70 personas han hecho realidad más de 1000 proyectos para 150 clientes con presencia nacional e internacional.

¿Y qué nos hace especiales? 

Nos basamos en cuatro valores fundamentales:
Innovación, ofreciendo soluciones innovadoras de una manera profesional y rentable con un valor diferencial: el conocimiento experto en toda la cadena de valor; Compromiso ya que llevamos como propios los objetivos de la organización y superamos cualquier obstáculo para lograrlos; Proactividad, proveyendo y realizando acciones para mejorar sus servicios y calidad; Trabajo en equipo, contando con un equipo motivado y multidisciplinar que trabaja en perfecta coordinación para lograr los objetivos comunes.

Te contamos más: 

Si eres el perfil que se siente conforme con solo hacer funciones básicas, la innovación no te agrada o “si funciona es suficiente”, y consideras que solo aprenderás sin aportar, pues aquí hacemos las cosas diferentes. Buscamos un Data Analyst. Tendrás la oportunidad de realizar proyectos con un alcance impresionante, donde tu serás parte del avance de la sociedad

Requisitos:

Nos gustaría que tuvieras: 
Capacidad de comunicación verbal y escrita en inglés a nivel C1Capacidad para interactuar con gestores de productos y partes interesadas del negocio para definir los requisitos del proyecto y atender las necesidades de datos del cliente.Experiencia en modelado estadístico, aprendizaje automático, análisis de datos no estructurados en entornos corporativos, académicos entornos de investigación y/o proyectos personales.Experiencia como analista de datos o puestos estrechamente relacionados con la experiencia práctica de trabajar en proyectos basados en datos proyectos basados en datosDominio de SQL y bases de datos relacionalesConocimiento competente de los lenguajes de programación Python (alternativamente R) utilizados para el Aprendizaje Automático y Cálculos estadísticos y sus bibliotecas más importantesCómodo trabajando con comandos y scripts de shell tipo Unix.Familiaridad con la pila de servicios de datos y análisis de Google Cloud (sobre todo BigQuery)Experiencia en el aseguramiento de la calidad de los datos.Familiarizado con GIT, Linux, CI/CD pipelines

Serias el perfil ideal si:
Experiencia trabajando con apps móviles y Firebase (Muy bueno tenerla)Familiaridad con la pila de servicios de datos y análisis de AWS (S3, Athena, EC2, ECS, Lambda, Sagemaker)Diseñar e implementar procesos ETL (Extraer / Transformar / Cargar).Conocimiento de LaTeXExperiencia trabajando con grandes conjuntos de datos, modelado, estadísticas, pruebas A/B y multivariantesExperiencia en el desarrollo, prueba y producción de algoritmos predictivos mediante el uso de soluciones desoluciones de aprendizaje automático, y modelos estadísticos

Se espera que: 
Comunicar eficazmente los resultados de la analítica a las partes interesadas y a los clientes, para públicos técnicos y no técnicos. En particular, crear informes exhaustivos y presentaciones convincentes, explicando claramente la explicar con claridad la imagen que los datos ofrecen para un problema empresarial concreto con el fin de:Apoyar las operaciones en la toma de decisiones, RCA (análisis de causa raíz), y las iniciativas estratégicas a través del análisis de datos de diferentes tipos, y el modelado estadísticoCrear visualizaciones de datos y cuadros de mandoInvestigar incidentes y circunstancias específicas del negocio desde una perspectiva de datosDiseñar e implementar soluciones ETL para mejorar los procesos de recopilación de datos, así como automatizar procedimientos de análisisEvaluar la fiabilidad de las fuentes de datos y las técnicas de recopilación de datos y colaborar con los ingenieros de software para mejorar los métodos de recopilación de datosProponer soluciones innovadoras y actualizaciones con el fin de identificar formas de mejorar los procedimientos actuales e infraestructuraEntender los modelos de Machine Learning para valorar y evaluar su rendimientoColaborar con el diseño y la realización de pruebas A/BDedicar tiempo a la actualización en temas relacionados con la Ciencia de Datos y sus herramientas y bibliotecas comunes

title: Data Analyst (People team)
description:
About usWe're Holaluz and we were born to change the world!


You and the planet are what move us to be who we are and to do what we do. In this video, Carlota Pi, one of the three founders of Holaluz, tells you more about it.


Our desire to do things differently has brought us to lead the transformation of the energy sector. Because:


 We only sell 100% renewable electricity. Thanks to leveraging the use of technology, we offer you personalized products and rates that allow you to save money. We put you at the centre of all our decisions. 
There's more of us wanting to change things. At Holaluz we want to turn every square meter of the roofs into inexhaustible sources of renewable energy for more than 40 million people and at no cost to you.


So that no matter where you live, whether or not you have your own roof,... you can be part of the change just by joining Holaluz's 100% green energy.


All the energy we need is up there. It is ours, it is clean and it is inexhaustible.


Can you help us connect people to 100% green energy💡💚 ?

What will you do? You'll play a valuable role in delivering actionable and high impact insights that continuously drive Holaluz towards achieving its business goals.  As a People Data Analyst you'll be capable of answering any people-related question quickly, accurately, and with the business in mind; ensuring that what's happening in the team is always connected to its impact on business results.  You will be able to identify main Analytics needs from the People Team. You will generate actionable insights to address the main needs of the People Team. You will also be able to properly communicate your findings to all relevant stakeholders. You will manage all reporting and automation needs from the People Team. Maintain operational accuracy on the People team to ensure high-quality methods to gather and manage datasets from multiple sources, transforming or cleaning data as necessary. Monitor and regularly upgrade the people analytics platforms to address current and emerging business needs. Ensure that any data activities are in alignment with data privacy standards. As part of the extended Data Analytics Team you will also contribute to the overall Analytics Roadmap: identifying potential projects, sharing your knowledge and expertise, defining best practices, etc. 
And because #SayThingsAsTheyAre is one of our values, we want to be transparent in explaining to you the expectations of the first 90 days in Holaluz.





In 30 days you will... Do the onboarding in the company. Participate in the first dynamics of the People and Data Analytics teams. Monitor KPIs, databases and data requests to assess needs and start planning the best approach. Use peers' feedback to inform necessary improvements and adjustments to Data. Help the People team and its stakeholders use data efficiently. Do the first team rituals and dynamics with your People and Data Analytics teams. Proactively get to know your colleagues. Get familiar with overall Data Analytics Roadmap and strategy. In 60 days you will... Suggest initiatives and start building a Roadmap of People Analytics Projects  Enable the Talent and People Operations members to become data-savvy. Understand, question and contribute to the People objectives and the metrics used to measure them. Find your workspace and workflows with the other Data roles within the team and will have been part of the first decisions. Start to create and implement, together with the Data Analytics team, common methodology and tools for project management, data governance, modelling, and hypothesis testing. Empower and spread the Data culture within the organisation.  Acquire a deeper understanding of our main objectives and challenges to overcome. In 90 days you will... Have a deep understanding of your role and how to generate the greatest possible impact within Holaluz. Be enabling people data and analytics initiatives with an impact on all People and Holaluz team. Be a reference for all things People Analytics related. Be an active agent in both the Data Analytics and the People team, so that the strategy is aligned and reinforcing one another. Have achieved measurable improvements in the deliverables of the team.  
How will you do it?One of our values is #KeepRowing, meaning that teamwork and team alignment is essential to be able to move forward and meet our shared objectives.


At Holaluz we have built a robust and constantly iterating organisational system, which allows us to adapt to the constant changes demanded by the sector and to achieve the purpose we pursue, using various methodologies. At Holaluz, meetings and decisions are made collaboratively, feedback flows 🤟 between the different teams and support between people is promoted.

Who will you do it with?Your day to day will be shared with the People team and, hand in hand, with the Data Analytics team. #AlwaysPeopleFirst and #HaveFun are also very important values in Holaluz, and to have a good time it is important to have a good team. We are a team of more than XX people with an unbeatable atmosphere... Don't you believe us? Let us introduce you to some of your colleagues 😁

Where will you do it?Another way of #KeepRowing is rowing all together in perfect synchronisation and towards a common goal, and what a better place to do it than in our offices in Barcelona, just 200 metres from the sea 🌊. This exceptional location next to the beach is perfect for a break with a dip and to put into practice another of our #HaveFun values


But since 2021 the number of "Holaluz offices" has multiplied by more than 500, everyone has their own little Holaluz, with their sea views (or not), their coffee or tea machine, their open space for lunch, their meeting rooms (now with a little more availability), and also their routines and organisation. We are committed to individuality and flexibility by putting people at the core of our decisions, that's why our offices are open for those who need or want to work in them. We are working on flexible seating in the office and providing individual lockers for everyone, as well as adapting all the meeting rooms so that we can make better video-conferencing and continue to work as comfortably as possible from home or from the office. Our people are the most valuable asset, so in the office we must comply with the following agreements:


 It's essential to wear a mask when moving around in the office. Not when we're sitting in our workplace (respecting distances) but when we're moving around (toilets, going to the kitchen, showers or meeting rooms). We now use the elbow bump to greet each other. The cleaning team comes daily to the office but to reinforce this we have cleaning kits in all the meeting rooms and other spaces. On a weekly basis, we have a health team available to carry out Covid tests on people who come to the office. And of course: safety distance, temperature taking, hand washing, flexible seating and restricted external visits. 
Requirements:

What do we need? We'll value experience as a Data analyst, bonus points if your experience comes from partnering with the People function.  Experience managing data projects, including automation and dashboarding.  Knowledge on SQL, basic Python, and being familiar with tools such as ATS and HRIS.  Good understanding of agile mindset and experience pushing the maximum business value with it. 
Benefits:

What do we offer?Another of the values that characterise us at Holaluz is #EsPosible ("It's Possible"). Therefore, we offer a series of measures so that you can develop yourself 360º and achieve everything you set out to do, both personally and professionally. In line with this, we believe that the most powerful energy comes from people, so #AlwaysPeopleFirst is part of our DNA, therefore, you will have the opportunity to:



 Join a company where people come first, with an unbeatable working environment and great talent where we truly live our values - all that while being a goal-oriented and results-driven company that applies agile methodologies and a proven scaling philosophy to everything we do Unlimited professional development in an exciting company and a team fostering and facing together constant challenges: You will join Europe's first B Corp Certified electric utility (companies that innovate to maximise their positive impact on employees, the community they serve and the environment) and the world number 1 electric company in ESG World Rating according to Sustainalytics Have flexible working hours and the possibility of working remotely on a regular basis, as a result of our pro-responsibility and autonomy mentality, and our commitment to the self-management of the team's time. Enjoy a working environment where also the 'details' fit your needs. We have our own library, organic fruit, reduced subscription to Andjoy - which includes yoga and crossfit classes in the office (mens sana in corpore sano) -, and competitive wifi rates with Unique Get a competitive share-based compensation plan Be eligible for a reduced price for private health insurance (Adeslas) Enter a baby-friendly company. Nursery to help integrate life and work for new parents. "Casals" (summer camps in summer but also in other holidays) those weeks of the year when combining children's holidays and work becomes a little more complicated. We offer preferential rates for kindergarten, transportation and food with Cobee (our flexible retribution system) Take free English and Catalan lessons at the office Competitive sustainable mobility rate with eCooltra for Holaluz (electric bikes and scooters, so you can get to the office quickly and economically, using individual and ecological transport) 





We celebrate diversity in the world and we want our team to reflect this in an inclusive way. At Holaluz, we are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of ethnicity, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression. Additionally, we strive to empower women in the workplace.



Desired Skills and Experience
analyticsdatapeople

title: Data Analyst PM
description:
En Sogeti somos expertos en soluciones de Digital Assurance & Testing y Soluciones Microsoft, trabajamos para grandes corporaciones en proyectos IT de gran envergadura.
Nuestro proyecto se va a desarrollar en cliente del sector Industrial.
Sobre tu rol
El puesto implica un rol importante de recogida y documentación de requerimientos para la infraestructura de Data SW siendo el Focal Point de las data issues y sus escalaciones.
¿Qué harás?
Para poder desempeñar esta función se ha de interaccionar con los equipos de Software Developer, con los de Data Generation (R&D) y con solicitantes de información, ya sean los equipos de Customer Assurance y los/las Ingenieros/as de Producto.
También realizarás investigación y validación de datos junto a los equipos de Product Engineering, R&D y SWQA.
Project management dentro de los proyectos de SW y Data.
Vamos a necesitar que tengas experiencia en:
Data Analyst: SQL y programación.Gestión de proyectos.Comunicación.Desarrollo de Software y Big Data y Analitycs.
Por qué nosotros?Somos innovadores. Nos gusta trabajar en equipo y escuchar las ideas de tod@s los que forman parte del #equipoSogeti. La tecnología y la innovación son parte de nuestro ADN. Algunos de nuestros valores principales son el espíritu emprendedor, el espíritu de equipo, la confianza o la honestidad y ello nos permite alcanzar todas las metas que nos propongamos haciendo un gran trabajo para nuestros clientes o partners.
Formación y plan de desarrolloDesarrollo profesional a través de un portal propio con diferentes itinerarios en los que puedes ir formándote y especializarte. Además de otras plataformas y contenidos en los que podrás aprender con nosotros. Asimismo, promovemos certificaciones en herramientas muy diversas del mundo del Testing y Microsoft.
¿Qué te ofrecemos?
Un ambiente en el que fomentamos ese espíritu innovador y emprendedor, en el que también tenemos tiempo para divertirnos con el resto de compañer@s a través de eventos internos (teambuildings, cafés, actividades deportivas, sorteos,..). Además, la colaboración es la clave de la manera en la que trabajamos por lo que también reconocemos los logros individuales de cada una de las personas que forman parte del #equipoSogeti.Pero también…una serie de beneficios sociales como:- Póliza seguro de vida y accidentes.- Tickets guardería.- Tickets restaurante.  Diversidad
Apoyamos positivamente las solicitudes de candidat@s idóneos/adecuados y debidamente cualificados, independientemente de su sexo, raza, discapacidad, edad, orientación sexual, identidad de género, religión o creencias, estado civil o embarazo y maternidad. Estamos comprometidos a contratar, desarrollar y retener a las mejores personas para brindar soluciones innovadoras para nuestros clientes. Fomentamos una cultura inclusiva que permite que todos alcancen su máximo potencial y disfruten de una carrera satisfactoria con nosotros. Nuestro paquete de beneficios flexibles y nuestras políticas permiten a nuestros empleados equilibrar sus necesidades individuales, familiares y laborales.
 Ubicación: Sant Cugat / Trabajo remoto es posible

title: Data Analyst - Remote Friendly
description:
Data Analyst

Location: Spain - Remote Friendly

Ebury is a FinTech success story, positioned among the fastest-growing international companies in its sector. Headquartered in London, we have more than 1,000 staff covering over 50 nationalities (and counting!) working across more than 27 offices worldwide and serving more than 45,000 clients every day.

Ebury’s strategic growth plan wouldn’t be possible without our award-winning Data and Analytics team and we are seeking a Data Analyst to join us!

Our Data Mission Is To Develop And Maintain Ebury’s Data Platform And Serve It To The Whole Company, Where Data Engineers, Analytics Engineers And Data Analysts Work Collaboratively To

Build ETLs and data pipelines to serve data in our platformSQL based modelling to build these data feeds into our core BI modelsDevelop department and project specific data models and serve these to teams across the company to drive decision makingAutomate end solutions so we can all spend time on high-value analysis rather than running data extracts

Some of the projects we are currently working on include: building data pipelines to connect to our Treasury Management System and modelling our cash flows and balances in the data warehouse to serve a reconciliation solution against our Transactional platform, building a central data repository to cover EEA regulatory requirements, serving the Front Office incentives model in an automated dashboard, and many many more!

As Part Of The Team You Will

Work closely with the rest of the Data Analysts and Analytics Engineers, Data Engineering, Product and business leadsBe responsible for modelling data in our collaborative data platform to build valuable operational and business insights for our stakeholdersManage end-to-end analytics solutions across all areas of the business from requirements gathering, designing key metrics, building optimised data models and presenting end results to senior managementMaintain and build dashboards and visualisations on the data platform using our BI tools

What We’re Looking For

2+ years of experience in Data/Business AnalyticsAdvanced SQL skills - must be able to read and write complex SQL queriesExperience with our modern data stack tools (a plus!) We use dbt, Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, DataStudio), LookerStrong problem solving and analytical skills with excellent attention to detailThe ability to manage, organise and present data in a clear, concise and actionable formatComfortable working in a fast-paced and demanding work environmentTrack record of working autonomously with time management skillsFluency in English (Spanish, a plus)Financial Services and Capital Markets Experience (FX, Payments, Money Markets, Treasury Management, etc) is desirable but not mandatory

What Ebury Offers You

Competitive salary conditionsSupport to progress your career in the Data & Analytics worldWork in a collaborative environment and contribute to a new data infrastructure built on a modern data stackFlexible workplace environment - remote, in-person or hybrid you choose23 days of annual leave and all the Madrid public holidays to use when you pleaseMonthly team-building eventsAttend conferences and training sessionsOn site English & Chinese classes with native teachersAccess to wellbeing and mental health support sessions

title: REMOTE DATA SCIENTIST – Build from scratch the best data structure ever
description:
Burn your resume. It doesn’t say anything about you. We first want to know if you can overcome the challenge we give you, and then who you are. Because we don’t recruit a number, but a person; and knowledge can be acquired, not your spirit.
1. Your challenge: as our first data scientist and from our huge database,Find the insights that will propel us into becoming the next leaders in Europe.
2. Our company, in hypergrowth.
The lead generation market is young, as is our company. But our growth is strong: we are twice as big as in 2021. And we don’t lack ambition: we will be European leaders in 5 years.
So your potential for growth within our company is limitless. You won’t have time to get bored: everything moves fast as lightning. And if you kill it, you’ll see in a few days the direct impact you have!
2. The person we need: a senior data scientist, working remotely (or in Barcelona)
1/ You will be our first data scientist. You will create our strategy and data structure from scratch, as well as to educate us. So you need to be experienced, with the caution, logical rigor and skepticism you only acquire through experience.
2/ We won’t micromanage you. Take things into your own hands, be curious, and creative. That’s what you’ll need to find the insights we’ll use both for our long-term strategy, and our day-to-day decision making
3/ You have some experience in quality control, A/B testing and the creation of metrics / data visualization. You’ll be part of Katya’s department, and will also have to dig deep into our back-end technology. But your mission will go as far as you can take it, so we hope you’re excited.
4/ Non-negotiable requirements : strong experience as a data scientist; strong back-end skills (Sql, Python, BI-systems) to be autonomous; perfect english.

4. What we offer: a true career opportunity instead of a number on your face.
Benefits: private health insurance; state-of-the-art Apple equipment; flexible salary; and if you come to Barcelona, a big, bright office with an even cooler kitchen; a ping-pong table, and regular non-work gatherings.
Your future: We’re not a startup, but we’re growing fast.
So we offer you the opportunity to grow faster in 2 years than in 6 in a big company. But we also give you the care and security that startups can't promise: you won't be a number on our screen, but a human being.
Because we’re still only 40 but ambitious, everyone is absolutely essential. So we recruit the best and expect the best. And that’s why we make sure our environment provides everything you need to feel good, relaxed, and excel in your job.
After that, you are the only one responsible for your success. We don’t micromanage. What matters is not the way but the result. At the end of the day, the numbers need to go up while respecting our standards towards our clients, such as:
Complete transparencyExcellence, no matter whatAnd long-term vision
This is why we’re proud of our work.
READY TO APPLY?Then click on “Candidate”.
And instead of asking for a resume,You will just have to answer honestly 4 short and no-nonsense questions (no traps).
Please note that if you do not answer all the questions, your application will be ignored. It’s the only way we can recruit on the basis of skills, attitude and personality, without being overwhelmed by hundreds of useless and uninteresting resumes that don’t say anything about who you really are.

title: Data Analyst
location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
description:
Somos una de las cadenas de alimentación y supermercados más importantes del mundo y creadores del Descuento. Nuestra historia se remonta a 1945, cuando los hermanos Theo y Karl Albrecht se encargaron del negocio de ultramarinos que su familia regentaba desde 1913 en Essen (Alemania). Desde nuestros inicios, siempre hemos tenido en cuenta lo importante que es conocer al cliente y darle lo que necesita al mejor precio. En España abrimos el primer supermercado en 2002 y ya tenemos más de 340 establecimientos
Nos importa el bienestar de las personas: nuestros clientes, nuestro equipo y nuestro entorno. En nuestra compañía, en pleno crecimiento, siempre hay oportunidades laborales para diferentes perfiles profesionales y oportunidades de desarrollo y crecimiento profesional.
Durante estos 100 años, hemos establecido con nuestros clientes una relación de confianza y hemos cubierto sus necesidades diarias. Llevamos el principio de sencillez en nuestro ADN, es nuestra ventaja competitiva y esto nos lleva al éxito como compañía y nos hace sentir orgullosos/as de seguir generando empleo en España. El camino no siempre es fácil, pero cada paso suma. Sabemos que el éxito llega del trabajo en equipo y estamos orgullosos/as de avanzar juntos/as.
Si tienes una mentalidad fuerte, eres tenaz, avanzas con firmeza, cuentas con cualidades para generar una experiencia positiva en las personas que acuden a comprar a nuestras tiendas y quieres alcanzar tus objetivos con un buen equipo... ¡Te invitamos a dar lo mejor de ti y a formar parte de este emocionante camino!
Sencillamente ALDI. Nuestra fuerza son las personas.
Actualmente nos encontramos en búsqueda de un/a Analista de Datos para incorporarse en Agosto en el equipo de Research & Analytics en Sant Cugat del Vallès.
Tus funciones serían:Análisis de datos con SQLAutomatización de tareas y creación de procesos ETL con SQL y R.Visualización de datos con PowerBIToma de requerimientos y creación de soluciones end to end con foco en las necesidades del negocio.
Los requisitos para encajar en la vacante son:Mínimo 1 año de experiencia en proyectos de análisis de datos y BI.Experiencia en tomas de requerimientos y diseño de soluciones.Conocimientos de SQL (join, unión, funciones analíticas...).Conocimientos de modelos de datos (claves primarias, foráneas, particiones, índices…).Estadística descriptiva (medias, varianzas, percentiles, ANOVA…).Conocimientos de programación en R.Conocimientos de ofimática (Microsoft Office, especialmente Excel y Word).Proactividad y motivación.Atención al detalle y foco en la calidad de las entregas sin olvidar la calidad del proceso.Capacidad de trabajo en equipo.Mentalidad analítica, rigurosidad y foco en el detalle.
Conocimientos deseables para encajar en la vacante:Conocimientos avanzados de modelización de datos (normalización, diferencias entre datawarehouse, datalake, datamart, modelos en estrella y copo de nieve, capacidad para mejorar el rendimiento de queries, etc).Conocimiento de herramientas de visualización como PowerBi o Tableau.Conocimientos de Python además de R.Experiencia en proyectos de analítica avanzada (modelos de clustering, clasificación, forecasting…).
Lo que ALDI ofrece:Contrato indefinido.Posibilidad de formar parte de una multinacional en expansión.Posibilidades reales de crecimiento dentro de la empresa.Buen ambiente de trabajo.Formación continua.Clases de Inglés.Flexibilidad horaria.Ubicación en nuestras oficinas de Sant Cugat del Vallés.

title: Senior Data Analyst - BI Team
description:
The vente-privee group has consolidated its various European brands, together made up of 6000 employees, under one unified conglomerate: Veepee. This coalescence marks a new chapter in its European history.
With Privalia, vente-exclusive, Designer & Friends, Zlotewyprzedaze, Eboutic and vente-privee, Veepee achieved a 3.7 billion Euro turnover as of 2018. Present in 14 countries now, Veepee is taking a leading role in the European digital commerce landscape.
Our 6000 employees have chosen a job at Veepee to spice up their daily lives! Our teams implement new technologies to fuel our strategies, offering our customers the best possible experience.
Are you eager to learn? Veepee offers you a variety of trades to develop your career, enabling you to renew your skills constantly. Tech, logistics, sales, marketing, sales production: join us on an exciting, digital-centered journey.
About the team
The Brazil Tribe is responsible for the Privalia platform in Brazil. In order to give a closer perspective in BI for Brazil, the Tribe is creating a specific, independent and self-managed BI team for that market, supported by our global Data team when needed.
As Senior Data Analyst within vpTech - Tech department in Barcelona, you will be directly in contact with the front product teams and the business. Your mission will be to monitor and analyze the performance of our products & business in order to improve our user experience.
The right candidate for this role requires to be highly analytical, passionate about numbers, organized and highly detail-oriented whilst demonstrating a curious and proactive attitude. Strong team spirit and enthusiasm to share and learn best practices with co-workers are also a must.
Responsibilities:
Perform complex analysis related to precise business questions and deliver actionable insightsProvide business and tech with meaningful dashboards or other automated toolsAnalyze AB tests performances: definition of KPIs with business stakeholders, monitoring of the tests and analysis of the resultsBuild and automate data pipelines to enable faster and easier analysisDesign, develop and maintain automated processes that help businesses improve manual workflowCommunicate and share results with all kinds of stakeholders.
Requirements:
At least 3 years of experience in a similar jobStrong verbal and written Spanish and English language skills, Portuguese is a plusStrong knowledge of SQL and databasesFamiliarity with Pentaho Kettle or another ETL toolAffinity for online customer behavior and CRM strategySkills in data visualization and dashboard creationExperience with Microstrategy or similar tools
What we offer: Dynamic and creative environment within international teams;The variety of self-education courses on our e-learning platform;The participation in meetups and conferences locally and internationally;3 days of remote work per week; Open for other remote options outside Barcelona;Brand new offices in Marina Factory (Hospitalet de Llobregat)
Belonging to Veepee, <vpTech/> is one of the biggest tech communities in Europe with more than 800 IT collaborators.
From Warsaw to Barcelona, through Lyon, Nantes, Tel Aviv, Brussels, Nice, Amsterdam, and Paris, all our projects are developed in a functional environment with a wide skills variety where you’ll be sure to find your place, no matter the technology you want to work with.
If you love to try things why don’t you jump on this new adventure?
Need more info > https://careers.veepee.com/en/careers/

title: Sales Operations Data Analyst Intern
description:
Who We Are

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. With offices around the world, our incredible team of 2,600 Criteos collaborates to create an open & inclusive environment. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and be impactful. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted & impactful advertising.

Criteo is looking for a Sales Operations Data Analyst Intern to join our EMEA Sales Operations Team. The ideal candidate will be highly data driven, process-oriented, as well as an exceptional team player.

The intern will report directly to the Emerging Markets Sales Operations Senior Business Partner to provide support in all Sales Operations functions across channels and Countries with main focus on evaluating sales and account management performance, improving efficiency through automation and best practices sharing and leading discussions on process improvements and strategy.

The role will be focused on the Emerging Markets region (Russia, Eastern Europe, Turkey & MEA).

Key Responsibilites

Support Emerging Markets quarterly planning, target setting and achievement tracking processes, ensuring data accuracy input in all processes.Support weekly and monthly business performance review, challenge the Teams and track progress on associated prioritiesSupport accurate data input and adoption of Sales Solutions (primarily Salesforce, Linkedin) and associated Sales Effectiveness Processes within the region.Ensure data integrity of Salesforce and other Sales Solutions.Support new business territory sizing and support new business strategy & action plan

Who We Are Looking For

You are Fluent in EnglishYou have previous experience in problem solving end to endAdvanced Analytical & Excel skillsIdeally, you have good technical skills or a keen interest: SQL, programming languages, ...You are interested in analysis and statisticsDemonstrated track record of cross-functional facilitation and partnering in a matrix organisationAbility to maintain positive relationships to accomplish organisational goals in a multicultural environmentExpertise in developing and implementing streamlined processesAbility to work autonomously with a keen attention to details and a high sense of prioritisation

Please note that this is a six months internship based in Barcelona, Spain.

#WTTJ

At Criteo, we are committed to creating an environment where all Criteos feel a sense of belonging. We nourish our diversity by listening to all cultures within Criteo - and there are many. We are proud to be a global team and conscious that it takes people with different perspectives, thoughts and cultures to succeed.

Criteo collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Criteo's recruitment related activities. Consequently, Criteo may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to the different Criteo entities across the world. By clicking the "Apply" button you expressly give your consent.

title: Data Migration Analyst
location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
description:
Tareas a realizar:

Responsable para el diseño de soluciones de limpieza de datos y procesos de extracción, transformación y cargas en proyectos de transición a S/4HANA.

Trabajar con el negocio para analizar los sistemas origen de datos y plantear las soluciones de migración.

Definir el modelo de datos para las cargas.

Ejecución de la transformación y carga de datos.

Análisis de los problemas de datos identificados en las pruebas de migración.

Soporte al negocio en la validación de la migración de datos.

Reportar al Data Migration Lead del estado de la migración de los objetos dentro de su área de responsabilidad.

Más de 5 años de experiencia en la implantación de proyectos SAP.

Experiencia en el role de responsable funcional de migración de datos.

Experiencia en la utilización de herramientas como SAP ADM, LTMC (Data MIgration Cockpit) o SAP Data Services.

Capacidad de análisis de datos.

Buen nivel de comunicación.

Buen nivel de inglés a nivel conversación

title: Data Analyst
description:
This position has responsibility for creating, maintaining, and issuing reports and analytics to measure and support business performance in key areas and agreed service levels.The ideal candidate will be required to develop analytical reports using tools such as MS power BI and Cornerstone On Demand.
This position requires: Very high level of accuracy, attention to detail, responsibility and reliability. A natural affinity to numbers and calculations would also be necessary.

What you will be doing:Design, develop and enhance reports & dashboards as required by the customer in Power BI with the use of DAXDevelop leading visualization solutions for our customersProvide good DAX, data modelling and basic Power Query Editor capabilityDeliver required project inputs according to time, quality and budget requirementsEnsure progress is accurately communicated and expectations of various stakeholders are managed effectively.Support business development activity by maintaining and developing demo sites for new customersEfficiently handle large sets of data and be able to confidently process them into required formatsActively participate in continuous development and innovation by contributing ideas for new feature and functionalitySupport definition of performance indicators and measures in accordance with customer Learning Systems.Support quality improvement initiatives as defined, measure performance against quality metrics and correlate training data with business performance.Support creation and data gathering for Governance presentations.Support with the creation of performance metrics reporting for programs and projects in term of:Accuracy and data integrityQuality, Correctness, Description and documentationData Analysis, Deduction and initiation of corrective actions from a performance perspective
What we are looking for:University level education or equivalent4 years of experience as Data analysisKnowledge in interaction management, process management, project management and rhetorical and presentation skillsExtensive knowledge and experience with reporting, statistical models and Data AnalyticsExtensive knowledge and experience with MS Office applications (esp. excellent MS-Excel skills)Advanced level of English languagePreferably advanced knowledge and experience with MS Excel Macros and VBA (Visual Basic for Applications)

About us: https://vps.vtxco.com/

title: Performance Marketing Data Analyst
description:
Are you an ambitious Performance Marketing Data Analyst looking for your next step in your career? Are you a creative problem solver with strong business acumen? Are you comfortable working with people and data to shape key business questions and make data-led decisions? If so, get in touch, we may have the role for you! With new challenges and growth ahead, this is an exciting time for the albelli Photobox group and a fantastic opportunity to be part of the team that will contribute to it.albelli and Photobox Group have merged to create a leading player in the online European Photo Product and Gifting market. Together we now serve a pan-European customer base of over 7 million customers, supported by our 1,150 colleagues across the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, France, Spain, Germany, Norway and Sweden. We are focussed on inspiring our customers to easily make beautiful photo products and bring their special moments to life.
Purpose
The purpose of the Performance Marketing Data Analyst role is to partner with our colleagues in Marketing (our Commercial Brand managers and Marketing Channel managers) and apply data-centric approaches to help them make better decisions, faster.Our stakeholders look to us to help them shape their questions into data-driven hypotheses, apply rigorous statistical techniques to dis/prove hypotheses, and to put the conclusions in context, making strong and compelling recommendations that create business value.Our data environment centres around Snowflake and Looker, and individuals use SQL, R, and Python daily to run queries and conduct analyses.
Responsibilities
Leading business stakeholders in identifying, refining, and prioritising key business questions.Defining analysis plans and conduct analysis to generate insights and answer business questions and hypotheses.Managing analytics projects end-to-end, ensuring that analysis generates insights, and insights become compelling recommendations.Communicating effectively with a wide variety of teams and seniorities across the organisation. Manage and influence stakeholders so that insights and recommendations are adopted by the business and drive value.Designing and building the tools and processes to enables stakeholders to assess performance quickly and easilyContinuously optimising internal processes for greater efficiency through scale and automation.The types of business questions you will work on include those relating to: Marketing strategy, Marketing investment, performance, and effectiveness, Media mix optimisation, Campaign performance, Predictive modelling / forecasting, and more.
Requirements You have strong business acumen and strategic thinking, understand ecommerce business models, and understand the details of ecommerce marketing channels.You have the proven ability to formulate business critical questions for maximum impact, and to leverage data to solve ambiguous problems and generate significant business value.You are able to network remotely, build relationships and operate effectively within a de-centralised community based across different geographical locations.You have strong project management skills, the ability to prioritise across multiple projects and stakeholders, and can drive projects to completion.You hold a degree in a technical field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Finance, Engineering, Physics, Economics, from a top university.You are proactive and autonomous, inquisitive, and collaborative. You ask probing questions, challenge the status quo, generate creative solutions, and have a bias for action.You have excellent collaboration and influencing skills, can balance, and are a compelling communicator of insights and recommendations.You have 5+ years of relevant work experience (e.g. analytics, consulting, etc), ideally in an international environment.You are an expert in the analyst’s tool of the trade, such as Excel, Powerpoint, SQL, R, Python, Looker, etc.You are fluent in English.
 We offer
A fast-growing e-commerce environmentAn international company hosting over 50 nationalitiesBudget for personal growth and development, including external training, courses, and conferences23 days of annual leave with a healthy work-life balanceA flexible hybrid work set up with a minimum of 2 days per month in the office and everything you need for a proper work from home setupAn informal, fun, proactive, and inclusive culture with a social atmosphere (Friday drinks, parties, sports, etc.) to be resumed properly post COVID-19!A central location in one of Europe’s most vibrant cities, Barcelona!
We are working in a hybrid environment and this role is based in our Barcelona office, situated in a WeWork by Plaça de les Glòries Catalanes, a hub for technology and innovation. Within walking distance of public transport, the beach and shopping centres, the office has great facilities (coffee, tea, showers, bike parking, social events and more) with a modern working atmosphere. There are approx. 15 people in the office, who work across all areas of the business, with a focus on analytics, marketing, and technology.

title: Product Data Scientist
description:
Preply is a global language learning marketplace, connecting 50,000+ tutors with millions of learners from all over the world. Since the company launched in 2012, students have signed up to more than 15 million lessons.

Backed by some of the world’s leading investors, Preply is on a mission to shape the future of effective learning. Fueled by a belief that live engagement with a teacher is still the most effective way to learn a new skill, Preply is building a personalized learning space that will enable individual learners to reach their goals in the fastest way possible.

Powered by a tenfold increase in revenues over the last three years, Preply is now leading the online language tutoring segment globally and has 400+ employees of over 50 nationalities based across Barcelona, Kyiv and the US. Preply is driven by a culture of experimentation and data-driven learnings, focused on building best-in-class consumer and enterprise solutions.

The Role

Preply is looking for a highly analytical person to join a team of talented data scientists who work at constantly improving our products and user experience.

As part of this role, you’ll study and understand user behavior, design AB Tests for our experimentation platform, analyze the results and provide insights and recommendations to our stakeholders.

You’d be embedded in cross-functional teams and work closely with product managers, tech leads, designers, etc. to provide our tutors and learners with the best product experience.

As a Product Data Scientist, You Will
Master the dynamics of tutors/learners interaction and the economics of Preply’s marketplace;Own App data end-to-end, from acquisition tracking to attribution, unit economics, product tracking, engagement, and feature usage;Produce thorough data analytics of customer behavior and product usage, effectively communicating them to technical and non-technical audiences;Quantify the impact of new product features and initiatives in order to identify growth opportunities and help prioritize our roadmap;Design, execute and evaluate experiments on a global scale;Contribute to the development of analytics libraries and frameworks;Collaborate with the Data Strategy team to define standards and best practices as well as sharing knowledge and capabilities across the team;Participate in the definition of tracking events, engagement metrics and key performance indicators;Work with the Data Engineering team to model data in our Data Warehouse and productionize your data pipelines;Work closely with our BI experts to develop effective data visualizations, reports and dashboards.
What We Are Looking For
Experience as a Data Scientist or Senior Data Analyst;Good understanding of data analysis concepts such as conversion, LTV/CAC, Cohort analysis, Retention, etc.;Experience in App analytics, tracking and attribution;Experience with A/B testing frameworks;Previous experience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C);Knowledge of quantitative fields (statistics, mathematics, etc.);Strong coding skills in one or more analytics languages (SQL, Python, etc.);Strong curiosity, problem solving and problem finding skills;Creative mindset and proactive attitude towards the creation and evaluation of new hypotheses;Good written and verbal communication skills. B1 English is a must.
Nice To Have
Knowledge of Looker, Amplitude, Databricks or other BI tools;Knowledge of coordination tools (Airflow, Luigi, Jenkins, etc.);Knowledge of version controlling tools (GitHub, GitLab, etc.).
What We Offer
An opportunity for personal and professional growthAn environment free of bureaucracy and corporate constraintsAn open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse cultureA monthly allowance for self-development on Preply.comA competitive financial package with equity, generous leave allowance and health insuranceA flexible set-up with the possibility of relocation to Barcelona or remote work within a similar time-zone. 
Our values
Human: We embrace diversity by fostering inclusive environments where people feel respected and safe to express their opinions.Hungry: We make bold, data-informed decisions to deliver high-impact solutions for our customers.Humble: We experiment continuously by staying open to being challenged, learning from failures and making data-informed decisions.Hackers: We learn by doing, focus on things that matter and move with incredible speed to create simple, creative, and scalable solutions.Curious: We thrive on facing challenges, diving deep to identify root causes and uncovering insights to continuously improve. Learners Obsessed: We put our learners at the core of everything we do to improve the effectiveness of their language learning with us.
Diversity, Equity, And Inclusion

Preply.com is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people of diverse backgrounds can thrive. We believe that the presence of different opinions and viewpoints is a key ingredient for our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company. That means that Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Craft

Data, Analytics & Strategy

Job Description

We are looking for a talented and creative Data Scientist interested in pushing the boundaries of online games analytics, with a proven ability to apply your skills, be it technical, behavioural or economic, practically in order to generate business value.

Your role within our Kingdom

If you want to improve the experience of King’s 300 million+ players across our network of games, and help us to further understand, model, predict, segment, monetise and retain those customers, then this may be the right opportunity for you. You will be part of the community of 80+ business intelligence & analytics experts at King, while working on a daily basis in smaller teams of 6- 8 people, including other data scientists, focused on particular games, our network or specific business areas.

You Will
Identify potential business opportunities within your area and scope/design approaches to capture those opportunitiesTranslate business needs to technical requirements and AB- tests, and work with development teams to ensure correct implementation, specifically including correctly tracking the right information to allow easy, precise analysis of the impactDevelop an analysis strategy and perform analysis of complex scenarios and AB- tests, both systematically and on a one- off basis.Carefully check, debug, and problem solve issues to ensure you deliver accurate and clear analysis and reports, quickly, even when confronted by subtle data complicationsProvide an analytics perspective to discussions and prioritisation within your team, so that the overall team selects the right ideas to work onBe the pro- active owner of the entire data chain for your game(s)
Skills To Create Thrills

You have a passion for quantitative analysis and the ability to draw business insights that will add real value to King. You will need to demonstrate the ability to learn quickly and work in a fast paced and collaborative environment whilst communicating effectively with teams and individuals across King - such as Game Developers, Business Performance Managers and Marketeers.

Skills

While we certainly don’t expect you to have all of these skills from day one, we do expect you to learn and develop in each of the following five areas
Business Insight: The ability to deeply understand the problems and issues our games and business wants to solve and therefore define for yourself the right data or analysis or interpretation to lead to the right recommendations and decisionsSQL: The ability to write complex SQL queries to analyse our databases with 300+ million players, and work effectively with both Hive and relational database systems.Analytical coding: Using tools such as R, Python (and also Excel) for analytical purposesStats: Understanding the appropriate statistical or machine learning techniques to use in different circumstances.Communication: Designing good ways of communicating, visualising or reporting your results/analysis so they are clear and unambiguous
There is plenty of scope at King for you to learn from your colleagues in those areas where you have less experience, and to share your own skills where you are stronger. We have several Data Science openings and are open for candidates with different experience levels.

Specific experience that might be helpful, but is not required, include: experience in the games industry or similarly sophisticated customer- facing digital businesses; experience in “big data” systems such as Hadoop, Hive; experience in behavioural psychology/economics; robust understanding of more advanced statistical techniques suitable for analysis of highly skewed populations; experience in predictive analytics, segmentation, and related areas; experience in experimental design; software engineering skills in Java and other languages (beyond R, Python which we use most frequently); skills with standard reporting tools such as QlikView/Tableau/etc.

Personal Attributes 
Smart – intellectual dexterityHigh integrityLow egoPragmatic problem- solver - someone who looks for solutions rather than worrying about problems
About King

King is the game developer behind the world- famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as mobile game hits including Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch and Pet Rescue. Candy Crush is the top- grossing franchise in US app stores, a position it has held for the last two years, and King’s games are being played by 245 million monthly active users as of Q3 2021. King, which is part of the Activision Blizzard group since its acquisition in 2016, employs nearly 2,000 people in game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in San Francisco, New York, and Malta.

A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes

Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.

Making the World Playful

Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It’s what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid- core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players - and we’re not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!

Applications need to be in English.

Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Data Scientist
description:
eDreams ODIGEO is one of the world's largest online travel companies and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.
