title: Data Scientist
description: We are looking for a proactive research engineer to be integrated and support the Bettair R&D team. The candidate curious, proactive and always ready to look at a problem from a different angle and think outside the box. In this role you will: Work with predictive models, custom made algorithms and anomaly detectors.Deal with timeseries of environmental and geographic information systems.Implement ready to deploy software packages with tests and documentation.Analyze performance of algorithms in staging and in production.Work with real-time data processing pipelines on production environments.Requirements:Degree in computer science / telecommunications / physics or similar.Strong background in probability and statistics.Experience with Machine Learning, timeseries processing and predictive modelling.Experience on the whole data science pipeline, from ETL to feature engineering and modelling.Proficiency in python.Scientific python: Pandas, Sklearn, Scipy, Pytorch, etc.High level of English, both oral and written.Familiarity with:Linux Environments.Data flow management.Productivity software (git / jira-like )Beneficial to have:Master or PhD in computer science / telecommunications / physics or similar.Good programming skills (object oriented, efficient programming, etc.).Visualization and communication skills.Experience with GIS in python is a plus (work with vector or raster data handling libraries s.a. geopandas and rasterio)Experience working with no-SQL databases is a plus.Basic knowledge of IT infrastructure.Basic knowledge of Electronics.Other programming languages (Java, JavaScript, C++).Expected income between €25k-€45k, according to the profile of the candidate plus other benefits.We offer: Working in a deep-tech company in an international environment.Be involved in a fast-growing company at initial stages, thus, having high professional growth potential.Competitive salary.Flexible working hours.Possibility for remote working days.Working together with a young, talented and motivated team.Bettair Cities is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability or age.

title: Data Scientist, Software Development-ESP
description:
Description

Data Scientist

(Cloud Software Development / Hybrid Work)

Join an experienced team with cutting-edge technology, a start-up mindset, multinational stability, and limitless possibilities for growth.

WHAT IS CLOUDBLUE?

As the world’s largest cloud platform provider, CloudBlue orchestrates B2B ecosystems by enabling management of traditional and digital products and subscriptions.

CloudBlue is the only cloud commerce engine with a proven hyper-scale digital platform, powering service provider marketplaces totaling more than 30 million seats globally.

At CloudBlue, you’ll join a dynamic, multicultural company led by forward-thinkers. We have a fast paced and agile environment offering start-up energy with the freedom to be creative and make a difference while enjoying the security of a large company backed by multi-billion parent company, Ingram Micro.

Our values contribute to making our company one of the best places to work.

We Take Pride In

Our Trust in our Team

We leverage every voice and collaborate at every level. We hire talented, accountable individuals and encourage high levels of responsibility.

Our Creative Engine

You will never stop learning and enjoy the challenge of finding innovative solutions to empower our customers to achieve greatness.

Our Strive for Excellence

We’re aspirational in our leadership and we take pride and ownership in delivering the best.

Our Passion & Energy

We run fast, manage ambiguity, courageously take risks, and are resilient in our pursuit of ambitious goals.

At CloudBlue, we constantly innovate and follow a customer-first approach, which requires flexibility and adaptability. We work hard, laugh together, and support each other as we pursue massive opportunities in the cloud market.

Come join us and help lead the XaaS revolution.

WHY WORK AT CLOUDBLUE?
START-UP MINDSET WITH THE STABILITY AND SECURITY OF HAVING A MULTINATIONAL BACKING: You get the best of both worlds: the exciting challenges, flexibility, and agility of a start-up combined with strong financial stability, security, and career development.TOP CLASS, HIGHLY EXPERIENCED TEAMS: You will work with a team of smart people who write high-quality code, senior specialists who know the technology inside out, and team leaders who have extensive experience, several with more than 20 years in the software industry.PROFESSIONAL AND PERSONAL GROWTH WITHOUT LIMITS: There will be no limit to your growth, either as an individual contributor or as a leader.WE HAVE MICROSERVICES ARCHITECTURE AND CUTTING-EDGE TECHNOLOGY: We are a platform based on microservices architecture, and we use innovative technology, and for sure technology can always be improved, and we are open to this.ESSENTIAL PART OF GO-TO-MARKET FOR ALL FEATURES: At CloudBlue you will not only be implementing the features, but you will also be an essential part of maintaining and evolving them, doing things like testing (automated), supportability, and even customer care in some cases.CONSTANT COMMUNICATION AND COLLABORATION: At CloudBlue, everyone has a voice and a vote. We value your opinion and encourage you to speak up and share your ideas and thoughts.WE ARE MULTICULTURAL AND LEARN FROM EACH OTHER: We are a dynamic multicultural organization from different countries, including Argentina, Colombia, Italy, Russia, and more, but we work as one.FLEXIBILITY & HYBRID WORK MODEL: You decide how to organize your work and manage your time. We provide a hybrid work model consisting of 2 days from the office and 3 days at home.
WHAT TECHNOLOGIES, TASKS AND METHODOLOGIES WILL YOU WORK WITH?
You will be required to help with our visualization projects using PowerBI.We expect you to have strong technical skills in no-SQL solutions, ETL, Python, R, TensorFlow, Keras and Spark.Knowledge of MLOps Experience in Kubeflow will be a plus.
WHAT WILL MAKE YOU SUCCESSFUL IN THIS ROLE?
We are looking for an expert with a Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science/Engineering or Mathematics and more than 2 years of related work experience with data.Good knowledge of statistics, algebra, Machine Learning, and Data Mining Techniques.Goal-oriented with high standards for quality, performance, and exceptional attention to detail.Ability to exhibit flexibility, initiative and innovation when dealing autonomously with ambiguous and fast-paced situations.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.It would be a plus if you have a Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or other quantitative fields, or Basic understanding of Cloud platforms.
WHAT WILL YOUR MISSION BE?
Design and develop a variety of complex statistical and machine learning techniques.Provide appropriate recommendations for action and changes to improve model performance. Help with the interpretation of results – for both causal inferences and predictive effectiveness.Design and implement pipelines to cleanse and integrate data in an efficient and reusable manner.Help create the vision for future analytical studies that use advanced analytics technologies. 
Other Benefits Of Working At Cloudblue
Ticket Restaurant meal allowance.Private health insurance.The office is at the Diagonal 00 building in the Fòrum area. A brand-new office with spacious areas for working, meeting or relaxing, tons of sunlight, a cafeteria, and a kitchen, plus table tennis, arcade games and PlayStation.New and complete set up for you: laptop, 2 screens, ergonomic chair, and everything you need to make your workspace as comfortable as possible.Drinks, large kitchen, fruit, CSR, and team building activities, and parties in summer and Christmas.Yearly salary review based on performance.Bonus: When goals are reached, you will be rewarded through our annual global bonus scheme, based on your professional level. Career growth: You will find national and international opportunities to grow within the company, both at Ingram Micro and CloudBlue.

title: Data Scientist/Engineer (NLP/NLU)
description:
About us
Rollio is an AI assistant for CRM (Customer Relationship Management) software. CRMs like Salesforce, MS Dynamics and SAP are at the heart of almost every business in every sector from finance to charities; but the graphical interfaces of most traditional CRMs are old-fashioned or overwhelming. At Rollio we believe in a future where users can interact with their business software through voice and natural language. Our AI virtual assistant uses Natural Language Parsing (NLP)/NLU to interpret user commands, proactively suggests actions to them, parse data to populate & update records, and generally helps them do their job faster.
We are a venture-backed startup, based in New York with our core developer hub in Barcelona Spain. Currently we are a team of 8 in total so you’ll be joining at an early, exciting stage.
Rollio - CRM AI Sales Tool:
We have a culture of:Communication. We are a distributed team in different timezones so we’ve thought a lot about how we communicate. We write technical white papers before starting work on a major feature to ensure there is agreement on the intended outcomes and to foresee implementation issues. We use Slack and group calls to stay in-sync but we respect ‘Maker Work’ and each other’s productivity.Quality. We review each other’s code and are constantly pushing ourselves to improve.Curiosity. We love to try new languages and frameworks. We read and discuss articles.
Our stack:Frontend: React + React Native with TypescriptBackend: Node.js ****Express with TypescriptNLP: Custom-built Python + RasaVoice: Watson Speech-to-Text (STT)
ResponsibilitiesOver the past 2 years we have custom-built our own NLP API which powers our mobile app. The users have conversations with Rollio and it's the job of the NLP API to understand what they're saying. We want someone who will:Collaborate with the rest of the team by writing unit-tested, maintainable code and carrying out code reviewsBe empathetic to the experience of our users and how 'real people' say things (which is not always how you would expect!)Have an experimental and methodical mindset to developing new features. When writing a white paper before starting the feature, how will you run experiments to prove that your approach is the best? Once we deploy a new feature, how will you test to know that it's working? How will you gather data to improve performance over time?Help us explore new ways of ingesting data from email, phonecalls and web-scraping to populate users' CRM records
Desired experience3+ years professional experience with PythonKnowledge of NLP/NLUE concepts and willingness to learn a lot very quickly if you don't have an NLP backgroundExperience working with RasaExperience of delivering production-ready APIs using cloud services and containers (AWS, CI/CD, Docker)Good written and spoken EnglishBonus pointsExperience with statistical analysis, creating dashboards, ETL, Machine Learning, Deep Neural NetworksExperience building voice interfaces

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Company Description

Dynatrace provides software intelligence to simplify cloud complexity and accelerate digital transformation. With automatic and intelligent observability at scale, our all-in-one platform delivers precise answers about the performance and security of applications, the underlying infrastructure, and the experience of all users to enable organizations to innovate faster, collaborate more efficiently, and deliver more value with dramatically less effort. That’s why many of the world’s largest organizations trust Dynatrace®️ to modernize and automate cloud operations, release better software faster, and deliver unrivalled digital experiences. Dynatracers come from different countries and cultures all over the world, speaking various languages. English is the one that connects us (55+ nationalities).

Job Description

A day in the life of a Data Analyst within Digital Business  

The leadership team asks you to provide a detailed impact analysis report about a newly started Dynatrace product improvement initiative to derive strategic decisions for further investments. 

After discussing the specific requirements and overall expectations, you are the end-to-end owner from inception to completion to deliver the requested insights. You connect with product, data science, data engineering, business and finance teams to understand which product-, financial-, customer-, and other data we have available, and determine the data gaps you need to close to reach the objective. Your natural curiosity leads you to ask the right questions and dig beyond the surface to find answers to more than the obvious.

You will dive right into our source systems, analyze raw data at a SQL level, uncover data inconsistencies, and create preliminary advanced Excel reports with visualizations, before you productize your findings in PowerBI, either yourself or with the help of an internal expert. If needed, you start an investigation to determine root causes for data inconsistencies and initiate and lead projects to clean up data and suggest processes to avoid future inconsistencies. 

All along you are constantly managing stakeholders and presenting your findings and drive towards delivering a powerful and insightful automated report creating business value.

Does this resonate with you, and are you up for this rewarding challenge to support our data-driven mission? Then we have the right role for you in Barcelona.

Your role in the team 
Deliver insightful data-driven reporting projects leveraging Excel and PowerBI  Work with product and solution leadership to develop actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis  Prepare ad hoc reports and analysis in response to stakeholder requests  Uncover data gaps, drive process improvement projects to eliminate data inconsistencies, and define dataset requirements for our data engineering team  Propose Go-to-market initiatives and independently discover valuable insights based on the available raw data Extract and join data from disparate sources using SQL and data analysis techniques to discover business and product insights  

Qualifications

Your profile 
Degree in IT, statistics, economics, or related field  3+ years of experience analyzing data and building complex reports  Advanced Excel and SQL skills  Advanced experience with data visualization tools such as PowerBI  Experience presenting to management Experience in an international environment, working with stakeholders across departments a plus  High degree of analytical thinking and problem solving  Detail-oriented and capable of delivering a high level of accuracy  High level of proficiency in English (C2) Experience in R, Python, or other tools for advanced data analysis a plus  Experience working in a software company a plus 

You will love this job if 
you live and breathe data  you love to change and constantly challenge the status-quo  you are looking to have real business impact  an international environment is attractive to you  you are looking for a unique, start-up like culture in an established and publicly traded software company  you are a looking for a non-hierarchical and outcome-oriented company culture  

Additional Information

Why join Dynatrace 
We are a one-product software company with a flat hierarchy. International working environment with English as our corporate language. We believe in an outstanding employee experience, a culture of innovation and autonomy, along with an entrepreneurial mindset as the basis for an exceptional product that provides real value. 

In addition, if you are not living in the country you are applying for, we offer you a relocation allowance, support with your visa, work permit, accommodation, language courses, and a dedicated buddy program.

Seeing is believing. Check out our Dynatrace Barcelona Lab. 
Please review the Dynatrace privacy policy here: https://www.dynatrace.com/company/trust-center/policies/recruitment-privacy-notice

title: Senior Reporting Data Analyst
description:
Our opportunity 

The Reporting Data Analyst reports to the Head of Reporting & Analytics which is part of Operations. In this role is responsible to build and maintain reports and analytics products leveraging a broad set of customer, user, and business data. These products are consumed by our customers and partners and a variety of stakeholders across the LiveWell business.

As a Senior expert you will collaboratively support and coach junior colleagues without formal leadership responsibilities.

 Your role 

 As a Senior Reporting Data Analyst your main responsibilities will involve: 

 Create enterprise-wide viewpoints on data and insights  Frame, problem solve and develop analyses to support strategic executive decisions  Work on a consistent approach to measuring metrics/KPI across the business  Maintain existing report and analytics products using existing tool chain (SAP HANA data platform, various external data sources, SQL, Power BI)  Create new data analysis and insights leveraging SAP Data Intelligence, Python, visualization through Power BI and data stories  Collaborate with IT colleagues on functional aspects related to the data platforms, data sourcing and transformation (ETL) to build data foundation.  Work with a multi-disciplinary team including Product, Operations, IT to optimize and automate reporting and analytics products.  Collaborate with data engineers and data scientist on AI/ML opportunities to drive, automate and mature the LiveWell business  Implement and maintain master data management approaches, principles and processes. 

Your Skills And Experience

 As a Senior Reporting Data Analyst your skills and qualifications will ideally include: 

 6+ years of relevant experience in data, reporting and analytics roles with proven track record of delivering impactful results.  Background in digital products and Health / Wellbeing is a plus  Customer-first attitude and willingness to go the extra mile in meeting customer needs  Ability to present complex information in a simple and engaging way, whilst making insightful recommendations.  Self-starter mindset to proactively identify opportunities and tackle them.  Clear passion for Health and Wellbeing services that improve people's lives, longevity, and health  Understanding of the evolving landscape and future needs within Health and Wellbeing services and digitalization.  Encourages creativity and entrepreneurship and sizes opportunities to innovate and create value 

Additional Information

 As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes: 

 Option to work remotely within Spain even up to 100% - you choose  Flexible working hours  Wide range of internal and external trainings  Free English, German and Spanish classes depending on the needs  Ticket restaurant  Life Insurance  Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company  Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you  Special banking and insurance conditions  Exclusive Employees discounts 

 Primary work location is Barcelona, Poblenou  . Please apply with your CV in English.

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

title: Master Data Analyst
description:
It’s an exciting time at Quaker Houghton as we invest in our global master data management architecture. The successful candidate will be working within our global corporate IT structure and will be responsible for providing global oversight and support of our global master data assets including taking the lead on implementing continuous improvement measures and developing our data into a core strategic asset.

Tasks

This is a technical analyst/developer role, with development work consisting of new development in addition to maintaining and enhancing existing master data

applications and data integration. The master data analyst candidate should have a good understanding of current master data tools and data warehousing tools and can support the implementation and ongoing maintenance of these tools.
Reporting to the Global Master Data Manager, the analyst will be responsible for the day-to-day support of our enterprise master data management platform including daily activity, developing ongoing enhancements, error trapping and remediation and acting as a subject expert of our master data to aid business users as and when required.The role is global and so will require relationships to be built that span many countries, functions and cultures with the occasional consideration of time zones when key meetings are required.As the scope of MDM evolves, the successful candidate will be required to build and define technical requirements for master data design to then implement new solutions.Following standard software development lifecycle processes, the candidate will be responsible for the ongoing improvement of ETL processes for all inbound and outbound system interfaces.To support ongoing data quality metrics, the candidate will create reports within our MDM tool based on approved data governance standards to then be used by our global data stewards.The candidate will support the business with ad-hoc data requests utilising SQL server including supporting internal and external audit obligations.The candidate will deliver cleansed and transformed master data information to downstream data warehouse and business intelligence applications through the creation and maintenance of our golden records, data mappings, data attributes, hierarchies and data relationships.Help ensure master data integrity in key systems by performing MDM tool administration in support of best practice system configuration.
Requirements
3+ years of deep hands-on technical experience with a master data management vendor product such as Informatica, Microsoft MDS, Semarchy, Stibo Systems, etc.5+ years overall master data management experience.2+ years of data warehouse system and architecture design experience.2+ years working in partnership with data warehouse and business intelligence teamsExpert-level master data and related ETL management. Solid foundational knowledge in data warehouse, business intelligence, and other Microsoft BI stack technologies.Ability to lead large projectsExperience with conceptual, logical and physical data modeling
In joining an IT team that is seeing continuous growth, this role offers real progression opportunities for the right candidate who likes to take the initiative and has the ambition to grow themselves and the business in ways that maximizes our collective successes.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Indaru is growing. We are looking for a motivated and talented Data Scientist to join our team, for someone who has the passion to learn and explore the endless possibilities of Machine Learning applied to marketing. Your job will impact how millions of people are being reached by campaigns.
We are a Digital Consulting firm that provides independent, data and fact-based advice to brands to improve their marketing activities. Our team is comprised of very talented individuals, who are passionate about Digital Marketing and ML. As part of a team of Data Scientist, you’ll help customers to further understand, model, predict, segment, and measure the impact of their marketing campaigns. 
Key responsibilities :+ Proactively develop machine learning models applied to marketing (MMM, Forecasting...)+ Extract insights and data-driven recommendations for our customers+ Build and optimize data collection and ELT processes to extract data from Google Ads, Facebook, Google Analytics, Youtube or Amazon+ Design and mantain dashboards in DataStudio etc.+ You will be working directly with customers presenting your findings
The type of person we're looking for :+ A team player+ Experience using Python Data Science toolkit (pandas, scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Keras, PySpark, etc.) and working with large amounts of data (~GB, TB)+ Knowledge of cloud-based big data platforms such as Google Cloud, AWS, Azure+ Ability to write complex SQL queries to analyse our databases+ Self-disciplined soft skills such as: resourceful, autonomy, detail-oriented+ Dynamic personality; you'll be joining a young & open-minded team+ Good command of English (C1)+ Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or related technical discipline
We offer:+ The position will be based in Barcelona, but the working location and the hours are flexible+ Full-time position+ Competitive salary+ No traditional job description but rather projects & mandates based on people skills, knowledge and ambition+ Developing our talent's potential is a core focus+ The possibility to apply your skills to cutting-edge challenges
You know someone that might be interested? Please share this offer.

title: PRICING DATA ANALYST
description:
Buscamos un/a

Pricing Data Analyst para que se incorpore con contrato indefinido a nuestro equipo de Pricing.

En Mango inspiramos y unimos mediante nuestra pasión por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos en 118 países y nuestra presencia online se extiende a más de 80 países. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades y en un 80% por mujeres.

Tu misión será llevar a cabo análisis sobre el desempeño comercial de la compañía, con especial foco en la actividad promocional (mark down).

¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES?
Incorporación inmediata con contrato indefinidoHorario Flexible (entrada de 8h a 9h30 y salida de 17h a 18h30), jornada intensiva los viernes (de 8h a 9h hasta las 14h / 15h) y mayoría de vigilias de festivosPosibilidad de TeletrabajoDescuento del 25% en todas nuestras líneas además de un Market de muestrario para renovar tu armario dos veces al añoServicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de central. La empresa subvenciona parte del menú diario, así como los artículos de cafeteríaRetribución flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro médico, formación, descuento comedor, guarderías etc.Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el VallésOportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo y cursos específicos en función de tus necesidadesWorkshops, meetups, comunidades de prácticas, team buildings y company meetings sobre transformación digital, moda y actividades de nuestros equiposServicio médico propio, servicio de fisioterapia una vez a la semana, sala de fitness y vestuarios en nuestras oficinas centralesFormarás parte de una empresa líder en el sector de la moda, dinámica, en plena innovación, con gran concienciación y realizando acciones hacia la sostenibilidad con un ambiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso

You got it?

We like you!

title: Senior Data Analyst, Vendor Analytics – Digital Markets
description:
About Gartner Digital Markets

Gartner Digital Markets is a business unit within Gartner. Our mission is to help small businesses make the right technology choices and find the tools they need to grow, optimize, and become more effective at what they do. The business is comprised of three top brands—Capterra, Software Advice, and GetApp. For candidates interested in taking their next career step in the technology space, Gartner Digital Markets offers the fast pace and excitement of working for a startup, the stability and resources of a large, established organization, and the opportunity to be on the front lines of innovation in an industry that is always growing and transforming.

What We’re Looking For

As a member of the Central Analytics Organization, you will have the opportunity to help support the Vendor and Review Analytics Team at Gartner Digital Markets (GDM). You will collaborate cross-functionally with the Sales, Reviews, Vendor Products and Experience, and Vendor Marketing Teams to help drive those groups towards accomplishing their goals. You will build strong relationships with your stakeholders across the organization. You will identify new areas to apply analytics to increase software vendor engagement with GDM. You will develop a deep understanding of our auction model and the economics of supply and demand for software leads to help drive software lead prices. You will analyze vendor behavior and identify opportunities to increase vendor satisfaction and retention. You will help improve the volume and quality of leads for software vendors. You will support the business development and customer success teams through improved prioritization of vendor outreach and improved access to critical data.

What You’ll Be Doing
Use analytics to support Gartner Digital Market’s mission to be the leading resource for software buyers and sellers.Design, develop, execute and manage analytics projects, recurring reports and dashboards for key internal customers across GDM’s sales, client service, vendor marketing and reviews teams.Synthesize qualitative and quantitative data from multiple sources to support analytics goals and business partner objectives.Produce ad hoc and project-based analysis to support key business initiatives. Quantify the impact of major business initiatives and communicate findings to key stakeholders.Support the planning and forecasting process as needed to accurately predict the performance of key metrics.Provide data-driven recommendations and guidance to drive business performance.
What You’ll Bring To The Team
 Degree (preferably from a top-tier university) in business, economics, statistics, mathematics or another quantitative field preferred.Minimum of 3+ years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, data science or similar role. Experience working with cloud-based or traditional relational database management systems.Experience with business intelligence and data visualization systems (Tableau, Power BI).Experience in high data volume environments (preferably in internet, software or technology industries).Proficient with SQL or similar database scripting languages.Proficient with Python.Proficient with Google (Sheets, Docs, Slides) and Microsoft suite of business applications (Excel, Word, Powerpoint, etc.)Experience working with web analytics tools a plus (Google Analytics, Omniture). 
Who You Are
Data driven and analytical by nature with demonstrable passion for data and analytics.Self-sufficient and driven to acquire the skills necessary to accomplish complex tasks.Strong interpersonal skills with ability to build relationships and effectively collaborate with partners.Excellent organizational and time management skills with ability to juggle multiple priorities.Comfortable working independently to achieve successful results with minimal guidance.Strong verbal and written communication skills with ability to clearly present complicated analysis.Resourceful and resilient with the ability to take a creative approach to problem solving. 
Check out our video to learn about who we are, and what we do:

youtube.com/watch?v=oSO_h5VZ9a0

What You´ll Find
Limitless growth and learning opportunities.A collaborative and positive culture - join a diverse team of professionals that are as smart and driven as you.A chance to make an impact - your work will contribute directly to our strategy.Frequent social activities such as movie night, laser tag, bowling, escape room, summer beach party, hiking & bbq, and more!Hybrid, virtual-first, environment with flexibility, remote work, Friday afternoons free, and more.New offices close to Glòries and the beach in the fantastic, “innovation and tech” 22@ district of sunny Barcelona.Fresh fruit, snacks, selection of teas, fair trade organic coffee and a fridge full of beer for our Beer O’Clock on Friday afternoons.
What You´ll Receive
Competitive compensation.23 days annual holiday, and additional days off for your birthday, 24th & 31st of December.Private Medical and Dental Care.Life and Disability Insurance.Public Transport Subsidy.Ticket Restaurant Card.Childcare Vouchers (Ticket Guarderia).IncentiFit - annual reimbursement for health-and-wellness-related activities.Pension Scheme.Tuition Reimbursement.Employee Stock Purchase Plan.Employee Assistance Program.Gartner Gives Charity Match.Relocation Assistance - a specialist to help you with all the appointments and paperwork.
What Are We
Action Oriented - Deliver fast, get great results. We embrace the vision, roadmap to success and the action it takes to make it happen. Intellectually Curious - Seek to learn, love to teach. We’re humble and embrace respectful, radical candor with a mindset of ongoing professional and personal development.Collaborative - One team, shared mission. We welcome feedback and understand the value of working together to accomplish more than what is possible individually.
Web:gartner.com/en/digital-markets

Careers: jobs.gartner.com/teams/digital-markets

Please Note
 Applications must be submitted in English. A valid EU visa/passport is required for this position.
#digitalmarkets

Who are we?

Gartner delivers actionable, objective insight to executives and their teams. Our expert guidance and tools enable faster, smarter decisions and stronger performance on an organization’s most critical priorities. We’ve grown exponentially since our founding in 1979 and we're proud to have nearly 16,000 associates globally that support our 14,000+ clients in more than 100 countries.

What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our teams are composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations. We believe that a variety of experiences makes us stronger—as individuals, as communities and as an organization. That’s why we're recognized worldwide as a great place to work year after year. We've been recognized by Fortune as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies, named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index and a Best Place to Work for Disability Inclusion by the Disability Equality Index. Looking for a place to turn your big ideas into reality? Join #LifeAtGartner

What We Offer

Our people are our most valuable asset, so we invest in them from Day 1. When you join our team, you’ll have access to a vast array of benefits to help you live your life well. These resources are designed to support your physical, financial and emotional well-being. We encourage continued personal and professional growth through ongoing learning and development opportunities. Our employee resource groups, charity match and volunteer programs keep you connected to your internal Gartner community and causes that matter to you.

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at 203-964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
The vente-privee group has consolidated its various European brands, together made up of 6000 employees, under one unified conglomerate: Veepee. This coalescence marks a new chapter in its European history.
With Privalia, vente-exclusive, Designer & Friends, Zlotewyprzedaze, Eboutic and vente-privee, Veepee achieved a 3.7 billion Euro turnover as of 2018. Present in 14 countries now, Veepee is taking a leading role in the European digital commerce landscape.
Our 6000 employees have chosen a job at Veepee to spice up their daily lives! Our teams implement new technologies to fuel our strategies, offering our customers the best possible experience.
Are you eager to learn? Veepee offers you a variety of trades to develop your career, enabling you to renew your skills constantly. Tech, logistics, sales, marketing, sales production: join us on an exciting, digital-centered journey.
About the role
As a Data Analyst, you will join our central data Insights team, which is directly in contact with the front product teams and the marketing. Your mission will be to monitor and analyze the performance of our products & business in order to improve our user experience. 
The kind of person we are looking for: - Analytical, passionate about numbers, organized and highly detail-oriented; - Curious and proactive; - Strong team spirit and enthusiasm to share and learn best practices with co-workers.
Responsibilities:
Perform complex analysis related to precise business questions and deliver actionable insights;Provide business and tech with meaningful dashboards or other automated tools;Analyze AB tests performances: definition of KPIs with business stakeholders, monitoring of the tests and analysis of the results;Build and automate data pipelines to enable faster and easier analysis;Communicate and share results with all kinds of stakeholders
Requirements:
Fluent in English and Spanish; French would be a plus;Proficiency with SQL;At least 3 years of experience in a similar job;Interest for technologies like BigQuery or DBT;Affinity for online customer behaviour and CRM strategy;Skills in data visualization and dashboard creation;Experience with Microstrategy or similar tools is a plus;Bonus: some experience with Python, or more generally programming;
What we offer:
The dynamic and creative environment within international teams; The variety of self-education courses on our e-learning platform;The participation in meetups and conferences locally and internationally;3 days of remote work per week;Medical Insurance; Office location: NN Rambla Marina Factory

Belonging to Veepee, <vpTech/> is one of the biggest tech communities in Europe with more than 800 IT collaborators.
From Warsaw to Barcelona, through Lyon, Nantes, Tel Aviv, Brussels, Nice, Amsterdam, and Paris, all our projects are developed in a functional environment with a wide skills variety where you’ll be sure to find your place, no matter the technology you want to work with.
If you love to try things why don’t you jump on this new adventure?
Need more info > https://careers.veepee.com/en/careers/

description:

title: Principal Applied & Data Scientist
description:
Are you an experienced Data Science leader excited about web technology, and the confluence of consumer experiences and AI?  Does the opportunity to drive best in class modeling, measurement and experimentation for critical user experiences like Search, News, Browser or Shopping sound inspiring to you?  If so, this Principal Data & Applied Scientist leadership role may be a perfect fit for you! 

 

We are the Web Consumer Experiences & Technology team at Microsoft, working on large scale search, browse and content technologies across Bing, MSN and the Edge browser. As a team, we are passionate about building highly engaging & accessible products for all our users, and are actively looking for scientists who can not only turbo-charge our current algorithms platform, but relentlessly drive state-of-the-art ML & data science solutions to production. 

 

We are a diverse & customer-obsessed team of Software Engineers, Data Scientists & Product Managers with an ambitious vision for what our technology platform can do for consumers, we would love to hear your ideas too! Check out the responsibilities below!

Responsibilities

Responsibilities

As a Principal Data & Applied Scientist, your daily routine will involve: 
Determine problems to solve based on rigorous data analysis and complex customer requirements. Formulate problems mathematically/algorithmically.Build models, algorithms, and mechanisms in large scale production systems using A/B experimentation and using state-of-the-art research techniques.Collaborate with a global team of world-class researchers, scientists & engineers to solve very challenging problems.Act as a role model for clean algorithmic design, principled thinking, and good engineering practices Live, breathe and demonstrate Microsoft's shared commitment to diversity and inclusion
Qualifications

Qualifications

Required Qualifications For This Principal Role
Extensive experience in Data Engineering, Data Science, Analytics and/or Statistics Proficiency using one or more programming or scripting language like Python, R, SQL work with data Experience performing data analysis and applying statistics working with tools like Excel, R, MATLAB, AMPL, or SAS 
Preferred Qualifications
Familiarity with distributed data processing/analysis and modeling paradigm, such as Map-Reduce and MPI is a plus. Experience with Deep Learning frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow also a plus. Advanced data visualization experience 
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description:
New challenge in a International company|Career progression


About Our Client

Global brand and customer experience agency that harnesses creativity, technology, and culture to create connected brands. But what does that mean? It means we're a creative agency that is built on the promise of collaboration and human connection. Creating connected brands isn't just what we do - it's what we're known for and who we are. We empower our clients to excel at the intersection of "brand" and "customer experience," starting with simple goals: Create work that becomes part of people's lives; promote value for our clients; and, in the best of cases, help the world.

Job Description

Business Consultant: Understanding customers, their business and the goals they want to achieve to advise them and to develop an appropriate online strategy according to their expectations, in order to guarantee the achievement of their objectives.Act as an analytics owner for the accounts to ensure that all tactical and strategic objectives are supported by the timely and accurate delivery of reporting and performance measurement.Conceptualize and create Power BI and Data Studio dashboards to define success metrics, create approaches to track the data, quantify and evaluate the data, then develop a common language for all clients/team members to understand these KPIs.Analyze multi-channel marketing data and paid campaigns to evaluate the performance and provide segmented analyses of the funnel from impressions to paying users.Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for the digital services/products and how it can be improvedEnable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources (social and digital listening) and compiling it into a simplified and actionable formatCustomer orientation: Leading meetings with clients and build strong partnership.Leadership: Participating in the execution of projects by performing the following tasks: project focus, control of the progress degree, customer expectations' management, managing and resolving conflicts and deviations, managing suppliers and controlling projects' profitability.Project management: Preparing work plans for the projects, coordinating the teams, following up on the global calendar and their progress degree.

The Successful Applicant

Minimum 2 or 4 years of professional experience in a marketing data analytics or similar role, ideally working on e-business projectsProficient in marketing insights and data analysis, including defining KPI strategy and growth opportunities, time series analysis, data visualizationSolid understanding of Paid media: Google Analytics, Social Paid Platforms, Google Ads, Google Tag Manager and Semrush.Desired knowledge in performance marketing channels and marketing attributionPower BI and Data Studio experience is required.Brandwatch experience is highly valuedStrong understanding of how databases work, types of data, types of relationsKnowledge of all Pack Office programsAbility to work in agile work environmentExcellent verbal and written skills in Spanish and English (minimum C1)Ability to manage expectations of client and internal teamAbility to think strategically (outside-the-box) and provide creative solutionsQualified candidates must be legally authorized to be employed in Europe.Global business overview and knowledgeAttention to detail and accuracyA profile with confident and approachableA problem solver, ability to think on your feet and solve problems quickly, as they ariseGreat at prioritizing tasks and very organizedA willingness and adaptability to support different teams globally on a wide range of activitiesProactive approach to work - bringing ideas and questions to the team

What's On Offer

Full time job with permanent contractHybrid work model: 2 days in the OfficeFlexible schedule and digital work cultureFlexible working conditions and Smart PrinciplesFriday intensive working day24 days annual leaveSummer intensive workdaysFull pc equipment will be providedOffice location: BarcelonaLifeWorks our lifestyle benefits and employee assistance platform aimed at helping you feel supported mentally, financially, physically and emotionallyOur annual Well-being Program filled with different activities and resources helping you to feel happy, healthy and supported in and out of the workplace.A mobile app that will give you the possibility to book your desk in the office.Team-building activities related with Design, digital trends and toolsGympass discount membership, with an annual Gympass subscription you will have access to thousands of gyms and studiosWPP International Trainings and VMLY&R masterclassesReal world experience in the BX,CX,UX on-going projects with top brands and clientsExposure to the most recent trends of e-Business, Design, Media & CommunicationsBe part of a dynamic hard-working team and let us to take care of you at the same timeOnboarding to help you settle in quickly, ensuring you are part of the VMLY&R team from day one.
