title: Data Scientist – Marketing & Network Analytics
description:
Craft

Data, Analytics & Strategy

Job Description

We are looking for a talented and creative Data Scientist interested in pushing the boundaries of in- game and marketing analytics. You will help network team to push the boundaries of online gaming analytics both on the marketing side (getting more players into the game) and in partnership with game teams (increasing player engagement)

Your role within our Kingdom

If you want to improve the experience of King’s 300 million+ players across our network of games, and help us to further understand, model, predict, segment, monetise and retain those customers, then this may be the right opportunity for you. You will be part of the community of 80+ business intelligence & analytics experts at King, while working on a daily basis in smaller teams of 6- 8 people, including other data scientists, focused on particular games, our network or specific business areas.

You Will
Identify potential business opportunities within your area and scope/design approaches to capture those opportunitiesTranslate business needs to technical requirements and AB- tests, and work with development teams to ensure correct implementation, specifically including correctly tracking the right information to allow easy, precise analysis of the impactDevelop an analysis strategy and perform analysis of complex scenarios and AB- tests, both systematically and on a one- off basis.Carefully check, debug, and problem solve issues to ensure you deliver accurate and clear analysis and reports, quickly, even when confronted by subtle data complicationsProvide an analytics perspective to discussions and prioritisation within your team, so that the overall team selects the right ideas to work onBe the pro- active owner of the entire data chain for your game(s)
Skills To Create Thrills

You have a passion for quantitative analysis and the ability to draw business insights that will add real value to King. You will need to demonstrate the ability to learn quickly and work in a fast paced and collaborative environment whilst communicating effectively with teams and individuals across King - such as Game Developers, Business Performance Managers and Marketeers.

Skills

While we certainly don’t expect you to have all of these skills from day one, we do expect you to learn and develop in each of the following five areas
Business Insight: The ability to deeply understand the problems and issues our games and business wants to solve and therefore define for yourself the right data or analysis or interpretation to lead to the right recommendations and decisionsSQL: The ability to write complex SQL queries to analyse our databases with 300+ million players, and work effectively with both Hive and relational database systems.Analytical coding: Using tools such as R, Python (and also Excel) for analytical purposesStats: Understanding the appropriate statistical or machine learning techniques to use in different circumstances.Communication: Designing good ways of communicating, visualising or reporting your results/analysis so they are clear and unambiguous
There is plenty of scope at King for you to learn from your colleagues in those areas where you have less experience, and to share your own skills where you are stronger.

Specific experience that might be helpful, but is not required, include: experience in the games industry or similarly sophisticated customer- facing digital businesses; experience in “big data” systems such as Hadoop, Hive; experience in behavioural psychology/economics; robust understanding of more advanced statistical techniques suitable for analysis of highly skewed populations; experience in predictive analytics, segmentation, and related areas; experience in experimental design; software engineering skills in Java and other languages (beyond R, Python which we use most frequently); skills with standard reporting tools such as QlikView/Tableau/etc.

Personal Attributes
High integrityLow egoPragmatic problem- solver
Our Kingdom

King Digital Entertainment is a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world. King is an independent unit of Activision Blizzard Inc. (Nasdaq: ATVI), which acquired the company in February 2016. We make games for millions of players worldwide, which can be played on our king.com and royalgames.com websites, Facebook, and mobile platforms such as the Apple App Store, the Google Play Store and the Amazon Appstore. King has game studios in Barcelona, Berlin, London, Malmö and Stockholm along with offices in New York and San Francisco.

Want to join our Kingdom?

Apply now! Join us in the thrill of making fun and delightful games for everyone.

The brilliant experience we give our players comes from the diversity and experience of our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes. That’s why we hire all sorts of talent.

About King

King is the game developer behind the world- famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as mobile game hits including Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch and Pet Rescue. Candy Crush is the top- grossing franchise in US app stores, a position it has held for the last two years, and King’s games are being played by 245 million monthly active users as of Q3 2021. King, which is part of the Activision Blizzard group since its acquisition in 2016, employs nearly 2,000 people in game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in San Francisco, New York, and Malta.

A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes

Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.

Making the World Playful

Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It’s what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid- core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players - and we’re not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!

Applications need to be in English.

Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Data Scientist
description:
Data Scientist – London – €40,000 – €55,000 plus benefits & bonus
A leading social gaming company are looking to expand their data science team due to growing demand in data science services, and are therefore seeking an experienced data scientist.
The successful candidate will have a strong background in Python and SQL coding, ideally coupled with experience in statistical/mathematical modelling. You will be exposed to machine learning projects and supported in developing this skill set, although prior experience in these areas isn’t a prerequisite.
Key Benefits
Salary up to €55,000 plus benefitsA leading social gaming companyA wide range of data science engagements, including machine learning, statistical/mathematical modelling and predictive analytics etc
Responsibilities 
Participate in “deep-dive” research projects, such as detailed product analysis, customer segmentation, lifetime value analysis etcProvide data insights for product management and marketing decision makingDesigning and implementing new data productsDevelop an analysis strategy and perform analysis of complex scenarios and AB-testsDesign and implement cutting-edge algorithms, building models and analysing large datasets
Key Skills 
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field required (Maths, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics etc.)Strong SQLExperience coding in Python (PyData stack) or other programming languagesExperience with any BI tool is a plusHighly analytical and structured thinking2+ years’ work experience; PhD is a plus!Demonstrable interest in Data Science, Big Data, Machine Learning and Predictive Analytics
Tech Stack
Analytics: Python (pandas, scikit-learn, pymc3, statsmodels, bokeh, mpl), SQL, Jupyter notebooksBig Data: AWS Redshift, Apache Spark, S3ETL: python, SQL, Spark, Scala, MongoDBData viz: D3.js, re:dash, Tableau, bokeh
Please apply below or contact Demetrious Vassiliou at dvassiliou@chisquare-analytics.com or call 07506115453 for a confidential chat.
By applying to this advert you agree to your personal details being held on file in relation to this and other future relevant opportunities.
KEY WORDS: Data Scientist / Data Science / Python / SQL / Statistics / Predictive Analytics / Machine Learning / AB Testing / Inference / Bayesian / T Test / Hypothesis Testing

title: Data Analyst
description:
April Plants
Join a fast-growing e-commerce Startup based in Barcelona. 
We were born with the ambition to transform and digitize the horticultural market. We aim to challenge the industry, creating a new digital ecosystem for more efficient and sustainable horticulture. 
We started in 2020 and within just 1 year we we have reached more than 7,000 customers. We've raised more than €300k from investors and we are looking to grow 10x again this year!
This is very ambitious, and we can't do it alone.Come join our rocket ship! 🚀
Main Responsibilities:• Co-Design and execute our Growth Strategy and Portfolio Optimization Plan to drive topline traction.• Working jointly with our Tech team, set up our customer journey attribution model and growth dashboards. Monitor and extract insights for continuous improvement. • Perform customer behavioral analysis to deliver actionable insights and drive growth. • Monitor and optimize main KPIs: conversion, retention, funnel optimization and user experience, sales, traffic, average basket. • Working jointly with our Marketing Manager, share insights on customer behavior to improve SEM/SEO performance. • Analysis and implementation of pricing strategy and promotions.
Requirements:• Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Math, Economics, Marketing or similar.• 3+ years of experience working in Web/Digital Analytics field.• Hands on experience with Google Analytics• Experience with data visualization software (Power BI or similar) • Experience with software analytics tools, particularly related to CRO. • Experience working with Content Management Systems, specifically Shopify• Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, in English and Spanish• Background in E-commerce Marketing highly valued
Valued Skills:• You are a team player. You understand the only way to have exponential growth is to work together as a team.• You are proactive and hands on• Quality in mind. You can easily detect whether a data result is good or bad in terms of quality and you understand that building in data means high focus in quality.• Curiosity, open to learn new things and share the ones your expertise.• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills• You have experience designing and implementing features in collaboration with product owners, reporting analysts/data analysts, and business partners within an Agile / Scrum methodology.• Sales mindset to improve website conversion rate
Why April Plants?• Join a talented and young team where all ideas count - our team comes from topBarcelona companies• Join a promising company in a growth phase, as a key member, where you put yourown limits.• Competitive compensation based on experience• Fast career growth and opportunities at a truly welcoming, multicultural company
Our values• Customer Obsession: We share the understanding that April Plants's sole purpose is to create value for customers and relentlessly deploy all creativity and energy to that end• Audacious Ambition: We dream big and embrace discomfort. We do work that has never been done before. This comes with challenges, frustrations, and failures along the way. We embrace them, we persevere and we invent, simplify, and are creative to overcome them• Good People: We are self-reflective and praise diversity of thought. We don't justify the end with the means and know where to draw the line. We have fun every day. We only can succeed as a team. We are in this together and strongly believe that as a team we are much greater than the sum of our parts. We enjoy our diversity, encourage different opinions, and respect each other as we come together to build, improve and grow• Tough Love: We truly care for everyone in the team and embrace honest and constructive feedback and radical transparency as ways to genuinely support each other
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status.
If you have read until here you should write to us. We want to know more about you!

title: Data & Applied Scientist II - WebXT
description:
The newly formed WebXT organization encompasses Bing, Edge Browser and Microsoft Content services used by nearly a billion users across the Globe. Data is staple to how we run the business in WebXT and there’s immense thirst from engineering, data science, business development and partners across Microsoft to have their data insight questions answered in a fast, accurate and easily digestible fashion. If you seek the opportunity to make direct business impact in major AI driven products in Microsoft, come and join the Bing Metrics and Insights team as a Data Scientist to drive user and engagement growth strategies with data.

We combine our data science expertise with business and engineering knowledge to provide insights to build better products for our customers.

So if you want to work on key growth initiatives for Bing and drive future growth, if analyzing petabytes of data to generate insights excites you and if you want to build great products and make business impact using statistical analysis, machine learning, experiments, data mining, data visualization, and more, then this role is for you!

As Bing is evolving and getting integrated across multiple Microsoft owned products like Windows, Edge, Office, Teams etc., there is a critical need for identifying actionable insights to drive product growth by analyzing cross product data across all Microsoft owned products.

We are looking for a strong data scientist who is hands-on, self-driven and able to work in a fast-paced and constantly evolving environment with direct product focus. This role also requires solid technical, leadership and communication skills. You will extract actionable insights from petabytes of data through data analysis and tell a story through data visualization that will drive enhancement and development of Bing.

Responsibilities
Hands on analysis on large volumes of telemetry data using various algorithms and tools including your ownDrive data driven ideation for Bing user and volume growth initiativesDrive impact analysis for features critical to agile course correction and business investmentsDefine and track key org level success metrics for impact and drive reliable process to track contribution from individual feature initiatives across the product lifecycle against set goalsArticulate insights, storyboard with data and visualization to communicate and influence leadership and other key decision makersHelp build data platform for the Bing org to support their metrics and analytical needs
Qualifications

Required Qualifications:
 Bachelor's or master’s degree in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, Statistics, or another quant-focused fieldRelevant years of professional experience working in Data Science and analyticsRelevant years of experience with metric design, exploratory data analysis, predictive analytics, machine learning for data mining, clustering, A/B testing and other areas of data science and statisticsRelevant years of experience working with large data sets or doing large scale quantitative analysisProficiency in SQL scripting requiredProficiency in using one or more programming or scripting language like Python, R, C# to work with data requiredStrong communication skills to articulate insights to senior management and feature teams to drive actions
Preferred Qualifications
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Kibana etc.,Familiarity with search engines and online servicesA willingness to learn, share, and improve
#WebXT #nextplay #data #datascience #analysis #datamodel #machinelearning

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

title: Trainee Actuary/Data Scientist
description:
¿Te interesaría trabajar en un ambiente estimulante y orientado a negocio? 

 ¡Únete al equipo de Pricing & Analytics de Sabadell Zurich! 

Sabadell Zurich es una entidad que nace de la alianza entre Banc Sabadell y Zurich para la distribución de seguros a través de los canales bancarios.

Siendo la unión entre un prestigioso banco reconocido por su contribución al desarrollo de las empresas y una compañía internacional experta en la protección y el cuidado de las personas, en Sabadell Zurich tenemos dos orígenes distintos, pero un solo propósito: ESTAR PARA CUIDAR.

 ¿Quiénes somos? 

Sabadell Zurich es una joint venture que nace en 2008 como fruto del acuerdo empresarial entre Banc Sabadell y Zurich para la gestión del negocio de Bancaseguros.

Está integrada por tres compañías distintas: BanSabadell Vida, BanSabadell Pensiones y BanSabadell Seguros Generales; la propiedad de las cuales está compartida al 50% entre ambos socios.

La plantilla de Sabadell Zurich está formada por alrededor de 300 personas, quienes, a nivel organizacional, se contabilizan como parte de la estructura de Grupo Zurich en España.

 Tus Responsabilidades 

Como Trainee Actuary/Data Scientist, la persona seleccionada se responsabilizará, bajo supervisión, de desarrollar soluciones analíticas para obtener conocimientos de los datos y apoyar las decisiones estratégicas. Al mismo tiempo, formará parte de un equipo analítico de gran experiencia que, basándose en la analítica avanzada, asesorará a las áreas y procesos de negocio más importantes de la compañía.

Para ello, sus principales funciones serán:
 Transformar y depurar los datos para proporcionar asesoramiento y conocimientos técnicos sobre los modelos actuariales y las cuestiones de riesgo.  Desarrollar cuadros de mando analíticos para ayudar en el seguimiento del rendimiento del negocio.  Iniciación en el desarrollo y la mejora de las herramientas de modelización predictiva de acuerdo con las mejores prácticas del mercado como
 Modelización de pricing,  Ingeniería inversa a partir de la información del mercado,  Modelos de elasticidad para renovaciones y modelos de descuento.  Técnicas de Machine Learning como métodos supervisados y no supervisados. 
 Pruebas y mantenimiento de modelos y herramientas actuales.  Aprender desde el punto de vista del negocio. Estar en contacto durante toda la vida de la póliza (producto, suscripción, renovación, siniestros, cancelación, fraude...)  Apoyo en la Investigación de nuevos enfoques como web scrapping, análisis de textos, procesamientos de imágenes, etc. 

 Tus habilidades y experiencias 

Esperamos que la persona que se incorpore en el equipo reúna las siguientes habilidades y experiencias:

 Formación universitaria relacionada con Física, Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería o Ciencias Actuariales.  Herramientas estadísticas y de programación como Python, R, SAS, SQL u otros lenguajes de programación estadística.  Inglés B2.  Experiencia en el proceso de transformación, limpieza y calidad de datos. 

 Adicionalmente, se valorará muy positivamente:
 Experiencia en el sector de seguros, banca, farmacéutica, venta masiva, mercado on-line y otros sectores afines.  Experiencia en entorno actuarial (Emblem, Radar y GLM).  Experiencia en herramientas de BI (PowerBI, Tableau, QlikView).  Experiencia con Plataformas en la nube (Azure, AWS, Google). 
 Capacidad analítica y desarrollo de nuevos enfoques.  Capacidad de síntesis e interpretación de resultados.  Capacidad de aprendizaje, comunicación y trabajo en equipo.  Proactividad e implicación, autonomía y orientación a la mejora continua. 

 Información Imprescindible 
 Se requiere poder realizar un convenio de colaboración con la Universidad y/o Escuela de Negocios de un mínimo de 6 meses con posibilidad de extensión.  Jornada parcial de 9 h a 14 h.  Agradeceríamos que antes de aplicar a esta vacante de prácticas, donde establecer un convenio de colaboración con la Universidad y/o Escuela de Negocios de un mínimo de 6 meses es imprescindible, dispusieras de la siguiente información al respecto:
 Confirmación de la posibilidad de llevar a cabo el convenio.  Duración del convenio (meses) teniendo en cuenta que la jornada es parcial, y posibilidad de extensión del mismo.  Fecha de inicio del convenio.  Modalidad: curriculares o extracurriculares.  Contacto de la persona de referencia con la que gestionaremos el convenio. 

 Información Adicional 

Por motivos del Covid-19 y hasta que la compañía considere que la situación sanitaria lo permite, las funciones se desarrollarán en modo de teletrabajo en combinación con trabajo presencial en las oficinas de Barcelona.

 Nosotros ya nos hemos puesto en marcha y estamos cambiando la forma de hacer seguros. ¡Para ello necesitamos gente con talento, ganas de aprender y pasión! ¿Te unes a nosotros? 

 “GRUPO ZURICH, 14 AÑOS CONSECUTIVOS COMO TOP EMPLOYER” 

 

Grupo Zurich tiene y aplica una política de igualdad de oportunidades de empleo. Nuestro objetivo es atraer y retener los mejores profesionales sin discriminar por discapacidad, raza, nacionalidad, religión, género, orientación sexual o edad.

title: Data Scientist (Experimentation)
description:
Company Description

We’re Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including marktplaats in the Netherlands, Mobile.de in Germany and Leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We’re all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

Job Description

Reporting to the Product Lead for Experimentation & Analytics Effectiveness, you’ will join a team of engineering and product managers and work to bring experimentation algorithms and causal inference methods into production at scale for use by decision-makers across Adevinta.

We are committed to using cutting-edge technology to build tools that help Analysts inform their decision-making and work more efficiently.

What You Will Do

Short-term
Help us improve the analytic capabilities of our Experimentation platformReview and challenge the AB testing methodology in useWork with our Product Manager and UX expert to evolve our platformTrain and educate teams across Adevinta
Long term
Drive automation on tasks that are time-consuming for our analysts Apply statistics to reduce time to get significant resultsApply techniques to support the most challenging cases (if.e. testing with small samples)
Qualifications
BA/BS degree in (or comparable experience) in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Physics.Solid industry experience in AB testing, Big Datastream, and batch processingGreat coding skills in Python, Scala is a plusTeam player with strong driver capabilitiesStrong communication skills and stakeholder management skills with any level of the organiszation
Additional Information

What you’ll get from us
Competitive compensation packageA unique position in an international and dynamic environmentOpportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisationThe chance to be a key player in a growing, highly skilled teamGreat colleagues and a healthy working environmentBenefits including private health insurance, stock purchase plan and bonusFlexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, choose your phone and computerCareer development, including individual training budget and language classesFlexible benefits programme (transport, restaurants, child-care, etc)Free daily breakfast 26 days of holiday
Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Flexibility: We believe that work is what you do, not where you do it. So we provide flexible hours and remote working options that give you the autonomy and scope to set your own agenda and working patterns. We empower our teams to decide which key moments they want to spend face to face, instead of mandating a fixed number of office days.

Covid-19: We’re reviewing the situation on a regular basis to ensure that we follow all local government guidelines and put the health of our people first. All interviews are currently taking place virtually.

If anything you’ve read above ticks your boxes, then why not apply now to find out more!

title: Business Data Analyst for Tax Engine
description:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

We are looking for a smart, passionate candidate to join our team. Tax Engine is part of the Global Tax Calculation Services team, a program comprised of analysts, tax professionals and software engineers that are responsible for providing end-to-end global indirect tax calculation solutions (sales and use taxes, value-added taxes, good and services taxes, and other consumption taxes) to Amazon and thousands of other merchants selling on Amazon marketplaces, as well as other e-commerce platforms.

The individual in this role will work within the Business Intelligence team providing support to analytical teams and tax engine business, through E2E BI solutions that will improve productivity and enhance efficiency in indirect tax calculations and processes. It will be directly involved in developing analytical data models in team’s owned business warehouse, generating new data metrics for tax engine operations, and delivering front-end reporting applications. In this role it will find a team-spirit environment and data-driven culture where autonomy and proactivity are celebrated and incentivized.

Key job responsibilities
 Developing and maintaining Data Warehouse analytical data models and processes Delivering analytical solutions through reporting applications (e.g. Tableau dashboards, Quicksight applications, automated reports) Applying governance and best practices for the back-end and front-end solutions in the Business Intelligence environment Developing and maintaining metrics and reporting for measuring processes efficiency Developing automated data quality processes Analyzing large data sets and presenting consolidated findings to senior management team, including an assessment of risks and opportunities.

Basic Qualifications
 4+ years of Business Intelligence experience (Datawarehousing, ETL processes, Data visualization) Strong SQL knowledge Experience in Dashboarding and reporting tools development (Tableau, Quicksight) Proficiency in English Strong analytical skills Experience interacting with global, cross-functional teams
Preferred Qualifications
 Ability to prioritize and meet deadlines while managing multiple stakeholder needs in a fast-paced environment Experienced in Python or any other programming language Working experience in any of the following areas: Robotics Process Automation (RPA), SharePoint development/migration projects, Machine Learning
Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.


Company - Amazon Spain Services, S.L.

Job ID: A1936579

title: Data Analyst (Marketing team)
description:
¿Quienes somos?

Somos Holaluz y nacimos para hacer del mundo un lugar mejor para todxs. ¿Quieres saber cómo? En este vídeo te lo cuenta Carlota Pi, una de las tres fundadoras de Holaluz.

Tú y el planeta sois lo que nos mueve a ser como somos y a hacer lo que hacemos. Uno de nuestros principales valores es #AlwaysPeopleFirst. Por eso, te proponemos seguir creciendo en un entorno donde el #HaveFun y el #KeepRowing son imprescindibles, pero en el que puedas también desarrollarte 360º.

Nuestra voluntad de hacer las cosas de un modo distinto, nos ha llevado a liderar la transformación del sector eléctrico y a ser la primera eléctrica en obtener el certificado BCorp. En Holaluz:
No vendemos únicamente electricidad 100% de origen renovable, ofrecemos una relación a largo plazo con nuestros clientes basada en la confianza.Gracias al uso de la tecnología, ofrecemos productos personalizados y tarifas que permiten ahorrar a las personas.Convertimos los tejados en energía 100% verde.

Llevamos una década revolucionando el sector de la energía eléctrica. De hecho, estamos transformando los metros cuadrados de los tejados de nuestras ciudades y pueblos en energía 100% verde para todxs. Y lo hemos llamado la Revolución de los Tejados.

Nuestra misión no es otra que conectar a todas las personas a la energía 100% verde y no pararemos hasta conseguirlo.💡💚

¿Te sumas?

Buscamos un perfil de Data Analyst con experiencia de 2-3 años en análisis de datos y generación de insights, automatización de procesos con python y muchas ganas de extraer todo el potencial a la Revolución de los Tejados.

¿Qué harás?
Generar insights a partir de análisis basados en múltiples fuentes de datos y comunicar los resultados al equipo de forma efectivaSeguimiento de métricas y su interpretación para ayudar al equipo a tomar decisiones de forma proactivaDefinir nuevos KPIs que nos ayuden a identificar oportunidades de negocio y puntos de mejora.Identificar las necesidades del equipo de Marketing y dar soporte a las necesidades que tengan relacionadas con datos Implementar modelos predictivos a partir de series temporalesAutomatizar procesos de extracción de datos con pythonCrear visualizaciones con PowerBI que ayuden a evaluar la efectividad de las acciones de Marketing

¿Cómo lo harás?

En 1 mes

Después del primer mes ya sabrás cómo está todo montado, te habrás empapado de nuestra cultura y visión, te habrás reunido con todos los equipos y sabrás qué es lo que hacen y qué necesitan.

Empezarás a proporcionar los primeros insights y conocerás las estructuras de las bases de datos de Holaluz. También conocerás a nuestros principales stakeholders y cómo ayudar al equipo de Marketing a ser más data-driven.

Te habrás ido a comer algún día con las personas del equipo, habrás asistido a alguna formación y hasta algún team building interno.

A los 3 meses

Seguro que ya habrás tomado muchas decisiones sobre cómo aportar valor en tu equipo y estarás trabajando codo a codo con tus compañeras, en otras palabras, habrás visto la LUZ.

Asistirás a reuniones con los stakeholders, entendiendo sus necesidades y trasladando los retos y tus aportaciones al equipo.

Tendrás el suficiente conocimiento como para proponer nuevas soluciones y estarás desarrollando proyectos end-to-end.

A los 6 meses

Tendrás (casi) todo bajo control y habrás contribuido en la madurez y crecimiento de tu equipo. Habrás aportado valor compartiendo conocimiento, y haciendo valer toda tu experiencia para mejorar el área de Marketing y de Data Analytics.

Serás independiente para definir e implementar procesos y proporcionar los datos necesarios a los stakeholders.

Además, habrás tenido varias reuniones con tu responsable para saber cómo te sientes en tus primeros meses con Holaluz.

¿Con quién lo harás?

Marta

Matemática, valenciana y gran aficionada al baloncesto. Es muy fan de hacer listas y darle un toque de humor a cualquier reunión. Marta no puede vivir sin una taza de café ni sus miles de dashboards y a pesar de todas las reuniones, siempre encuentra tiempo para ayudar a quien necesite más datos.

Èlia

Es la más joven del equipo pero desborda sabiduría. Èlia es una optimista incorregible con un don para encontrar el lado bueno de las cosas. A la catalana del equipo le encanta la escalada y siempre busca nuevos retos con unas ganas inagotables por aprender de otras áreas. El saber no ocupa lugar.

Almu

Nuestra última incorporación, desde la capital, parece seria pero dale unos días y serás víctima de su ironía. Almu se considera la “data baby” del equipo pero demuestra su potencial cada día que pasa. Es una crack de las presentaciones y nunca dice que no a unas birras afterwork.

Además, formarás parte del equipo de Marketing y del equipo de Data Analytics. We are a big family!

Requirements

Requirements
2 años de experiencia como Data Analyst. Experiencia en equipos de MarketingGrado en Data Science, Matemáticas, Estadística o similarExperiencia con alguna herramienta de visualización (PowerBI, Qlik, Tableau, etc)Forma de pensar analítica con una gran atención al detalleSaber comunicar aspectos técnicos a compañeros con un background diferenteSer una persona organizada y con capacidad de adaptarse al cambio

Benefits

¿Qué ofrecemos?

Ofrecemos una serie de medidas para que puedas desarrollarte 360º y conseguir todo aquello que te propongas, tanto a nivel personal como profesional. En consonancia con esto, pensamos que la energía más potente proviene de las personas, de manera que #AlwaysPeopleFirst forma parte de nuestro ADN, por ello, tendrás la oportunidad de:
Unirte a la primera eléctrica europea con Certificado B Corp (empresas que innovan para maximizar su impacto positivo en los empleados, la comunidad donde sirven y el medio ambiente).Empresa certificada como Baby Friendly Company. Nursery para ayudar a integrar la vida y el trabajo para los nuevos padres . “Casals” esas semanas del año en las que compaginar vacaciones de los niños y trabajo se hace un poco más complicado.Unirte a una empresa donde las personas son lo primero, con un entorno de trabajo inmejorable y gran talento en donde vivimos nuestros valores.Desarrollo profesional sin límites en una empresa apasionante y un equipo con desafíos constantes.Nuestra propia biblioteca, con contenido muy diverso.Ser parte de una empresa orientada a objetivos y orientada a resultados. Aplicamos metodologías ágiles y la filosofía de escalamiento a todo lo que hacemosClases de inglés y catalán en la oficina.Horario flexible y posibilidad de trabajo a distancia de forma habitual, como resultado de nuestra mentalidad pro responsabilidad y autonomía, y apostando por la autogestión del tiempo del equipo.Suscripción con cuota muy reducida en Andjoy, que incluye clases de yoga y crossfit en la oficina. Mens sana in corpore sano.Suscripción con cuota muy reducida de mutua médica.Sistema de retribución flexible en guardería, transporte, seguro de salud y comida con Cobee.Referral bonus, si traes a gente con tanto talento como tú.Fruta ecológica cada día.La oportunidad de contribuir al crecimiento de una empresa que quiere cambiar el mundo.Plan de retribución en acciones.Tarifa competitiva de movilidad sostenible con eCooltra. Son bicis y motos eléctricas, para poder llegar a la oficina de forma ágil y económica, en un transporte individual y ecológico.Tarifa competitiva de Wifi con Unique.

Celebramos la diversidad en el mundo y queremos que nuestro equipo refleje esto de manera inclusiva. En Holaluz, estamos comprometidos con la igualdad de oportunidades de empleo independientemente del grupo étnico, religión, sexo, origen nacional, orientación sexual, edad, estado civil, discapacidad, género, identidad o expresión de género. Además, nos esforzamos por empoderar a las mujeres en el lugar de trabajo.

¿Dónde lo harás?

Otra forma de #KeepRowing es remar todos juntos en perfecta sincronización y hacia un objetivo común, y qué mejor lugar para hacerlo que en nuestras oficinas de Barcelona a sólo 200 metros del mar 🌊. Esta excepcional ubicación al lado de la playa es perfecta para hacer un break con chapuzón y poder poner en práctica otro de nuestros valores #HaveFun.

title: Data Marketing Analyst
description:
Description

Wallbox is a global company, dedicated to changing the way the world uses energy. We do this by creating smart charging systems that combine innovative technology with outstanding design and manage the communication between vehicle, grid, building, and charger.

Founded in 2015, with headquarters in Barcelona and selling already in over 80+ countries, our mission is to facilitate the adoption of electric vehicles today to make more sustainable use of energy tomorrow. Our talent has no borders - we welcome over 700 Wallboxers from over 45 nationalities in Europe, Asia, and the Americas!

We’re now the first Spanish unicorn listed on the NYSE ($WBX) and have been recently named amongst LinkedIn’s top 3 Spanish startups.

In day-to-day life, you will see our core values shining through our Wallboxers. The passion and dedication towards our mission will hit you the moment you walk through our doors - and there’s no feeling like it.

Our journey is not plain sailing - it requires proactive, flexible and top performing individuals who are committed to the world of sustainable mobility. But one thing is for sure - it's going to be a fun ride!

The question is: are you ready to change the world with us?

About the role:

If you love data and SQL, want to work with a modern data stack (using technologies like Airflow, dbt, Snowflake, Looker or Tableau), believe the company should adopt experimentation on a daily basis or want to solve problems for the various areas of the company and make their lives easier, this is your opportunity!

As a Data Marketing Analyst at Wallbox, you are expected to be comfortable working to high standards as a professional data analyst, helping us to build and maintain a data platform that supports diverse use cases.

You will:
Design and build reports to measure performance of different marketing activities: demand generation programs, channel marketing programs, digital advertising, etc. Analyse results together with stakeholders and propose changes and tests based on findings, driving continuous improvement.Conceptualize, develop, and maintain dashboards and visualizations that inform both tactical and strategic decision-making. Must be familiar with Marketing KPIs: web traffic, conversion rates, unitary costs (CPV, CPC, CPA), ROI, funnel KPIs, etc.Perform cohort analysis of new customers and proactively propose improvements acquisition and retention tactics based on the findings of this research.Perform advanced analysis (regression, segmentation, cohort analysis, etc.) of marketing activities and investments, identifying patterns and trends that support decision making of ideal marketing mix for different segments.Enable self-service data exploration, making data standardized and easily accessible.Work with Data Engineers to identify and add new datasets to the data platform. Collaborate with them for roadmap definition.Be a steward of data quality, ensuring that metrics and KPIs are consistently reported across the catalog of dashboards and data productsHave a key role in building data culture within the companyDefine the direction, structure, processes, and standards for Data across the company (e.g. experimentation framework).Drive a culture of data-informed decision making as we scale.

Requirements

Must have:
6+ years of experience working as part of a data team; preferably as a data analyst or scientist.Preferably an advanced degree in a quantitative field such as math, physics, computer science, statistics, etc.Hands-on and strong working knowledge of SQL.High experience level with modern visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau or Qlik Sense.Solid statistical background.Strong experience in experimentation (especially A/B testing and cohort analysis)Experience with SaaS tools for different areas such as sales (Salesforce), CRM (Pardot, Hubspot), Digital Marketing (Google Adwords, Google Analytics, Facebook ads).Experience working with Data Scientists and Engineers.English is a must.

Nice to have:
Be fluent with one or more common data-related programming languages (Python or R).Experience with data modeling techniques (a plus).Experience with SaaS tools for different areas such as sales (Salesforce), accounting (ERPs like Netsuite), e-commerce (Magento), Customer Service (Salesforce Customer Service or Zendesk), growth (Google Adwords, Facebook ads).Experience with web analytics tools like Amplitude, MixPanel, Segment and/or Google Analytics.Experience with task orchestration tools (ex.Airflow, Luigi).Experience working with a modern data warehouse (Redshift, Snowflake, BigQuery, or similar).Basic knowledge of Git and command-line.Prior experience modelling data in LookML and dbt (data build tool).

Soft skills:
You are able to work-out effective solutions under uncertain or ambiguous circumstances.You’re always willing to learn something new and embrace a healthy debate.Quality in mind. You can easily detect whether a data result is good or bad in terms of quality and you understand that building good code with strong testing is key to growth and sustainability.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.You have experience designing and implementing features in collaboration with product owners, reporting analysts/data analysts, and business partners within an Agile / Scrum methodology.Excellent presentation and communication skills.

Benefits
Half-day Fridays! First class private health insurance after your first month at Wallbox Online group training sessions twice a week & other out of office activitiesUse one of our EVs for a weekend and/or a week (car sharing) and test our products in your home (beta testing) to become a valuable source of feedbackFree online language classes (Spanish & English) twice a weekFlexible compensation valid for restaurants & food delivery apps, transportation, childcare, and learning & development. Hundreds of discounts in different brands & services with our Wallbox Circle benefits platformCar discounts & special advantages if you choose an EV!Smartpoint for all your online orders & services at our officesFree coffee & soft drinks to fuel those tough Monday morningsVariety of breakfast and lunch dishes, everyday, at a discounted price at our canteenLearn and grow in a company of over 45 nationalities and counting! No suits! Unless it's Carnival or Halloween 

Please submit your CV in English
At Wallbox, we’re committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We strive to be a more equal opportunity workplace.

title: Senior Product Data Analyst - Experimentation
description:
Seamless travel platform. That is the vision of the Consumer Product team. While some best practices do exist, there is no clear and straightforward guide on how to build it. Therefore we conduct, evaluate and learn from online experiments across all Consumer Product domains.

We are looking for a motivated and experienced analyst who will work in collaboration with Product Managers, Designers, Engineers and Analysts to make sure we utilize the online experiments to the best.

What will you do? 

Work collaboratively with the Consumer Product teams on online experiments, mainly AB tests and fake door tests.Set the standards and best practices for online experimentsOwn the evaluation process of online experiments and provide visibility into the processLead the prioritization of AB tests to make sure we do the most impactful ones firstDesign and implement (semi-)automated solution for AB test evaluation with help of Data Intelligence team

What do we expect? 

4+ years of experience as a data analyst or business analystStrong analytical thinking, curiosity and proactive approach to problem solvingAdvanced SQL knowledge (we use PostgreSQL and BigQuery)AB testing knowledgeCommon Statistical methods knowledge (regression, classification, resampling, …)Experience in consumer facing funnels and metrics analysis, i.e. Conversion Rates, Attachment RatesExperience with Python/R for data analyticsAbility to work independentlyAdvanced level of English

Why it rocks to work for us? 

We deploy immediately after a job is completed, not after months of QA.Do, fail, learn – repeat! We understand that mistakes happen and we learn fast.We decide which cutting-edge technologies are appropriate for the task.We code at hackathons and other competitions.We support the local technological community.We visit and speak at conferences and technological events worldwide.We use our work time wisely with a friendly vacation policy and work schedule.We also like to party and hang out together.We work, play, relax, workout and even nap in our offices.We’re a great team of passionate and fun-loving people from across the globe who you’ll love working with.We look forward to you joining our team-buildings and parties!

We offer you 

 Besides a motivating salary, we offer quarterly bonuses dependent on the company's overall results and your own performance. The opportunity to join our Phantom Stock scheme (for positions from level 5 upwards). We also enjoy benefits, such as flexible working hours, 30 paid vacation days, sick days, private medical insurance, Andjoy scheme, annual subscription for Biking (Smou). Flight vouchers to celebrate your kiwi anniversaries. Occasional work from home and/or our Office located in the centric cozy neighborhood (Sant Antoni) in Cloudworks coworking space where you can enjoy Kiwi.com’s private office space, two common terraces with great views, discounts on lunch meal providers, common coworking activities (yoga, games, etc.), free refreshments and shower. Hardware from Apple or Microsoft based on your preferences. We offer unlimited contracts within a forward-thinking and ambitious company. Relocation package (including visa support). Dogs and parties are welcome in our offices.

Interested? Join us and hack the traditional ways of travel! 

Kiwi.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Throughout the recruitment process and for some time after it’s finished, we’re going to process your Personal Data. You can find all the necessary information in our Privacy Policy available at: https://jobs.kiwi.com/recruitment-privacy-policy/ .

title: Machine Learning Engineer/ Data Scientist
description:
Desde TX Group estamos buscando en la búsqueda de un Especialista en Machine Learning con Data Scientis para una empresa Japonesa líder en el sector utilidades, utilizando el movimiento del agua como fuente de energía dentro del sector Industrial, de automoción, Farmacéutico, etc. Creando un sistema alternativo renovable para estos sectores.
Actualmente son más de 800 personas que trabajan en esta empresa con un muy bajo índice de movimiento interno (salarios y beneficios altos, horarios flexibles, mentalidad business siglo XXI, modelo híbrido a escoger, headquarter en Barcelona y Alemania)
Responsabilidades● Asegurar la ejecución fluida de los proyectos desde el punto de vista técnico, desde la carga de datos del cliente hasta la generación de informes.● Desarrollar presentaciones sobre inteligencia artificial y aprendizaje automático y explicar cómo utilizar los algoritmos de Machine Learning y sus predicciones.● Escucha atentamente los comentarios de los clientes, sus necesidades, y ayuda a diseñar el producto interno.● Aprende nuevas tecnologías y las aplica para encontrar nuevos impulsores de valor para las obras hidráulicas y otras empresas de infraestructura.
Habilidades y experiencia requeridas● Experiencia con una amplia variedad de software de análisis/datos● Cierta comprensión de ML/AI (nivel conceptual) y el deseo de aprender más● Experiencia en análisis de datos, procesamiento y transformación de formatos de archivos● Antecedentes de ingeniería/ciencia/matemáticas o un campo relacionado
Si deseas entrar en el sector renovable en un proyecto puntero para una empresa internacional este es tu sitio.
Oficinas: Parque tecnológico de Sant CugatSalario: 50.000 a 70.000 euros bruto anualesContrato: IndefinidoModelo de trabajo: Híbrido

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description:
Madbox is a mobile gaming company, creating and publishing its own games worldwide. Since 2018 Madbox has gathered more than 300 million players, still growing. We are looking for top talents with mad skills, a mad passion and a mad ambition to join us.
After our success in the hypercasual segment, we are now developing casual games - currently in various stages of development - and are looking for a talented and resourceful BI Developer/Marketing Data Analyst who will be responsible for several key projects impacting the success of our titles.
What will you do ?Working closely with the head of data, the UA and the Monetisation teams to develop and own all SQL parts of our data pipelines as well as the BI Dashboards and Reports.Daily conversations with the Performance team to define the key metrics to be tracked.Manage and improve data pipelines using GCP BigQueryDesign and optimise the Data Models and their corresponding ETL processes.Resolution of data coherence issue and setup of Data QA checks to make sure that the data we have is always reliable.Data crunching and dashboards building, both on demand and at your own initiative.Perform marketing and financial KPIs analysis to help the teams optimise their strategy.
Madskills required 
Hard Skills :Very advanced level of SQL based on proven experience of at least 3 years (including procedural processes)Knowledge and experience with Business Intelligence tools (preferably Looker)Proven experience designing Data Models and translating business requirements into data structuresProven experience optimizing ETL processes based on known methodologiesKnowledge and experience designing and implementing DQA checksEducation in EngineeringKnowledge and experience in cloud platforms GCP/AWS and their BI servicesKnowledge of the KPIs used in SaaS and the advertising industry.You will be required to pass a technical test
Soft Skills:Autonomy and ability to take decisions and make projects move forward while keeping transparency and continuous updates to relevant stakeholdersHave an analytical mindset.Strong logic & business sense.Excellent communication skills: straight to the point, focused on constructive feedback, positive mindsetAn interest in video games or tech in general.Fluent communication with the rest of the team.Showing leadership in proposing innovative actions to perform to improve globally speaking.Being very sharp on the relevant place of each metric when providing a response to a question with no ambiguity.
What do we offer ? 
A competitive compensation, a transparent grid shared for each Madboxer to allow frequent evolutionsTeam profit sharing as it will always be a collective success, we share what we create all togetherPrivate medical cover, because your health should always come firstLunch coupons - joining Madbox means joining a group of foodiesRegular team events where you will discover where the "mad" of Madbox comes from !Remote policy : 3 days at the office, 2 days at home (every week you can choose the day you want to work remotely)
Our culture at Madbox :
Our culture is based on four pillars built by Madboxers for the Madboxers:
Explore together : we take risks together, we fail together and win together.Learn fast : create, test, assess, learn, share, repeat.Be thoughtfully candid : share what you have in mind like you would like others to share it with you.Shape (y)our journey : you are the owner of (y)our ambitious success, and the success of Madbox.
Our Recruiting Process
A first call with our RecruiterAn interview with our Head of DataHome AssignmentA review test interview with the Head of DataFinal interview with one of our co-founders (CTO)NB: Offers are usually sent within 48h after the last interview

title: Data Scientist
description:
Let’s Talk About You

Your profile 

You are a highly collaborative individual and enjoy solving problems that focus on adding business value. You have a sense of ownership and enjoy hands-on technical work. Our values resonate with yoursDegree educated in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or equivalent experience, with strong physics backgroundAbility to write clean, maintainable, and robust code in Python Hands-on experience with ML libraries e.g Scikit-learn, XGBoost, keras and least one data query language / database technologyWorking expierence and deep understanding in methods for non-uniformly sampled time-series analysis, deep learning, computer vision or (non)linear optimization (at least two fields)Preferable: familiarity with ML cloud technologies, preferably with AWS SageMakerFluency in English is essential (C2 Level), knowledge of German and other languages is a plus

Your Responsibilities

Design and build digital twin models of Siemens-Energy assets components for anomaly and faults detectionsDefine failures root causes and produce risk analysis with explainable probabilistic modelsCombine data from various and diverse sources into global optimization modelsTake advantage of Siemens Energy cloud environment to scale your modelsContribute to cross-functional problem-solving sessions with your team and deliver presentations to colleagues and clients

Your opportunities for personal growth

You will have the opportunity to work in a start-up like environment, with highly motivated team within a leading market company, and in an international environmentYou will be part of an international team, working alongside Project Managers, Data Engineers, Machine Learning Engineers, Software Engineers and 3D DesignersDuring your first project you will also work closely with collaborators from two of the biggest companies in data services and deep learning techYou will directly contribute on the establishment of the energy systems of tomorrow

Let’s Talk About Us

"Let’s make tomorrow different today" is our genuine commitment at Siemens Energy to all customers and employees on the way to a sustainable future.

As Siemens Energy we are the only company with a leading portfolio along the entire energy value chain – in both conventional and renewable energy – we are uniquely able to help both public- and private-sector customers benefit from these developments.

Your role will be inside one of our DigiHubs and based in Barcelona.

#DigiHubBarcelona leads all Siemens Energy DigiHubs worldwide from the showcasing and customer experience perspective in Digitalization and Energy Transition. We work with consultative sales methodologies and enable our sales colleagues in selling Digital Transformation and Energy Transition related solutions from a holistic customer centric approach.

#DigiHubBarcelona is one of the main Data Hubs for Siemens Energy, become part of our dynamic digitization team as a Data Scientist and join us in the world of digitalization and decarbonization. A new dimension of the service of our machines awaits you - the dimension of data. For us, digitization means increasing the value for our customers by development of innovative business models as well as digital products.

Check out this video to see what we do here!

MORE INSIGHTS

Be Energized. Be you.

Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity we generate power. We run on inclusion and compassion. Our combined creative energy is fueled by at least 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society. All of society.

Jobs & Careers: https://www.siemens-energy.com/global/en/company/jobs.html

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Senior Data Analyst - SAS - MicroStrategy - BI|Gran grupo internacional


About Our Client

Gran grupo internacional del sector asegurador y servicios financieros.

Job Description

Las principales funciones serán:
Análisis de datos de clientes para dar apoyo en el diseño del Plan de Marketing y las campañas anuales buscando maximizar el resultado.Analizar las acciones de marketing llevadas a cabo en el Plan anual para medir su eficacia e identificar puntos de mejora basados en los datos.Analizar el comportamiento de clientes para mejorar y optimizar su experiencia.Coordinación estrecha con los departamentos de Brand y Marketing online para la optimización de acciones y conversión de leads.Coordinación estrecha con los departamentos de producto para el diseño óptimo de los mismos según los datos cliente.Colaboración en proyectos transversales a nivel nacional e internacional.

The Successful Applicant

El perfil seleccionado deberá aportar:
Conocimiento nivel avanzado/experto de herramientas de BI y dashboards como: SAS, Microstrategy, Tableau, Power BI, etc.Deseable conocimiento y experiencia trabajando con Google o Adobe Analytics.Se valorará positivamente experiencia o conocimiento de R y/o Python.Experiencia en análisis avanzados con uso de BBDD extensas.Capacidad de síntesis, sensible a la calidad del dato y orientación al cliente.Alta capacidad analítica. Saber interpretar los datos para extraer insights relevantes de cara al negocio.Experiencia en identificar nuevas tendencias, segmentación y buyer persona, uso de herramientas y modelos para identificar insights del cliente, toma de decisiones desde los datos.

What's On Offer

Oportunidades de carrera y desarrollo profesional.Modelo de trabajo híbrido (oficina y teletrabajo).Incorporación inmediata.Contrato indefinido. Salario competitivo + Beneficios.

Contact: Federico Touceda

title: Product Data Analyst
description:
