title: Data Developer
description:
To give people the power to build community on our platforms, we need to make sure they have the best and most secure experiences possible. People in Central Analytics empower Facebook’s Global Operations organization to be self-sufficient in tactical decision-making and drive operations strategy through analytics, data infra, and reporting. Our key partners are embedded data teams, core functions on the business side, and Data Engineering/Data Science on the product side. We are responsible for providing accurate, reliable and accessible business metrics as well as contextualizing them in operational performance with research and advanced analysis. We are looking for a Data Developer who shares our passion for helping make Facebook a safe place for people and businesses to connect across the world. The right candidate will be comfortable in a fast-moving organization, excited to collaborate and focused on positively impacting the experience of a large scale global workforce and the entire Facebook Community. They possess strong data management and manipulation skills, data visualization skills, and the ability to build strong partnerships to drive impact across the organization.

Data Developer Responsibilities:

Build/maintain data infrastructure (data pipelines, aggregated data sets, reports, dashboards) to monitor the performance of our operations and drive business understandingPartner with Operations, Data Science, Data Engineering, Product and Engineering teams to solve problems and identify trends and opportunitiesApply quantitative skills to and incorporate qualitative insights to inform and influence strategy for Global OperationsBuild best practices to support the growing data development function within the team and mentor junior colleagues on application of data development gold standards

Minimum Qualifications:

B.A. or B.S. degree with a quantitative focus in Economics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Math, Statistics, Operations Research, or equivalent training4+ years of experience extracting and manipulating data to drive projectsProficiency in querying and manipulating complex raw datasets for analysis using SQL and at least one scripting language (PHP, Python, Perl, etc.)Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker)Professional experience with reporting systems, data pipeline architecture and data modelingExperience explaining technical concepts and analysis implications clearly to varied audiences and experience translating business objectives into actionable analyses

Preferred Qualifications:

Advanced degree with a quantitative focus (Economics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Math, Statistics)Experience thinking strategically, structurally solving product problems, and driving executionExperience with distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop)Experience developing data pipelines via SQL and Python-based ETL frameworkExperience releasing code into production

title: Staff Data Engineer, Data Platform, BI Connectors
description:
Who we are

About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About The Team

The Business Intelligence (BI) Connectors team supports the data platform infrastructure for importing and exporting data from external software-as-a-service products used by internal business teams (people operations, finance, marketing, and sales). This functionality is required to support critical data workflows within Stripe. The team is remote and distributed across Europe.

What you’ll do

You will be a key contributor to the next evolution of our platform: moving from a legacy ETL tool to Stripe’s powerful real time and batch processing infrastructure. As a Staff Engineer, you’ll be empowered to make decisions with a significant impact on Stripe and help guide our investments and strategy while making our systems reliable, secure, and a delight to use. There is much work to do to make Stripe engineers’ data capabilities even more reliable and usable than they are today. We’re close to the internal stakeholders using our systems and regularly get feedback to make their experiences better.

We’re looking for people with a strong background and demonstrated leadership in data platform technologies, ideally within the offline processing space. Staff Engineers at Stripe are empowered to operate autonomously and are counted on to help drive Stripe forward.

Responsibilities
Scope and lead large technical projects with meaningful impact for business teams within StripeBuild and maintain the infrastructure which powers the core of Stripe.Scrutinize and reason clearly about the technology and architecture choices we make in building these products. In many cases, you will be the decision maker.Directly contribute to architecture and write code. Serve as a role model for how well software should be written for Stripe as a whole.Arbitrate critical decisions correctly that fully consider software best practices, Stripe system realities, and numerous stakeholders’ preferences and concerns.Advise Stripe’s leadership team on key technical considerations related to importing and exporting data from external SaaS products with Stripe’s internal data platform.Work effectively cross functionally.Teach and mentor the next generation of technical leaders at Stripe 
Who you are

We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements
Have a strong technical background with 8+ years of experience with data platforms and API integrationsHave experience with Apache Airflow, Flink, Spark, AWS AppFlow Custom Connectors, or similar toolsHave served as the technical lead for a team of engineers and can demonstrate broad technical leadership.Listen well and internalize the best ideas from all over the organization while also setting a vision that others are excited to get behind.Work well cross-functionally and your co-workers at all levels and across all teams trust you. ## Preferred qualificationsHave been a Staff, Principal, or Distinguished Engineer at a top tier company.Have owned the technical roadmap for a business area.Are often cited as the inspiration for engineers that join your teams. Even senior engineers feel that they’re able to learn from you.

title: Data Engineer for Data Products - Digital Transformation & IT Pharma
description:
The team of Digital Transformation & IT – PHARMA is hiring Data Engineers for Data Products.

 This person in this position is responsible to build data pipelines that transform any kind of data into formats data scientists can use for analysis. This includes the design and delivery of comprehensive technical data platforms, providing reliable and consistent data to internal and external Bayer customers.

Therefore, the Data Engineer requires a deep understanding of how business works and how top-line and bottom-line are affected, capable to translate Business process to relevant data and consequently KPIs.   The data pipelines are built for global as well as local data sources and transformation and need to leverage the data capabilities that are defined for the data platform. 

Main tasks and responsibilities:
 Participate in and occasionally lead design sessions with Enterprise Data Stewards, Data Engineering teams, Data Scientists, Product Managers, business and IT stakeholders, that result in tangible documentation for data processing, storage and solution delivery.  Understand business capability needs and processes as they relate to IT solutions through partnering with Product Managers and business and functional IT stakeholders and apply this knowledge to influence the decision-making process driving business goals.  Support evaluation of new technologies, like Snowflake, Alteryx or AWS Native, or new languages, including performing POCs and presenting results to others, with a goal of providing optimal technical recommendations.  Implement data solutions according to design documentation using a variety of tools and programming languages, like Kafka and SQL, etc. and following team’s established processes and methodologies.  Facilitate and participate in code reviews, retrospectives, functional and integration testing, data validation and other team activities focused on improving quality of data and delivery.  Provide reliable estimates for large scale project, be able to translate business demand for global teams to enable scaled solutions.  Collaborate with Product Owners, other engineers and data stewards within the team and across data, technical platforms and product teams on executing and aligning roadmaps, delivery dates and integration efforts.  Deliver data products on the existing data platform which adhere to the defined data capabilities such as data cataloging, master data management, data lineage and which fulfill the data quality requirements. 
Required qualifications & competencies:  Bachelor’s degree in a Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent qualifications  5+ years’ experience participating in the build and support of Data Platforms and design principles.  Demonstrated experience leading data modeling and architecture design efforts, including designing both logical and physical models for datasets.  Proven experience in integrating data sources into a data platform and modeling large datasets in distributed databases such as Snowflake.  Proficiency in working with relational databases such as Postgres, Oracle, etc.  Experience with at least one NoSQL database can be beneficial.  Experience contributing to open source projects.  Strong interpersonal skills and desire to work in a highly collaborative environment.  Familiarity with the relevant industry trends.  Desired experience with: Pharmaceuticals, life sciences or related disciplines.  Cloud-native solutions, such as Glue, Step functions, etc.  Stream processing, e.g. Kafka, Spark Streaming, etc.  Knowledge of machine learning or other data science practices.  Proven effective communication skills, both written and verbal required in English language. 
I n the continuous evolution of IT, SCB has a vacancy for Data Engineer. Based on the experience and potential of final candidate, the VS grade will be determined.

 YOUR APPLICATION 

This is your opportunity to tackle the world’s biggest challenges with us: Maintaining our health, feeding growing populations and slowing the rate of climate change. You have a voice, ideas and perspectives and we want to hear them. Because our success begins with you. Be part of something big. Be Bayer.

Bayer welcomes applications from all individuals, regardless of race, national origin, gender, age, physical characteristics, social origin, disability, union membership, religion, family status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression or any unlawful criterion under applicable law. We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.

Location:

Spain : Cataluña : Barcelona

Division:

Enabling Functions

Reference Code:

400822

title: Data Engineer
description:
Buscamos un/a Data Engineer con visión transversal dentro de un departamento de Data, será la primer incorporación del equipo para desarrollarlo. 

Detalles del cliente

Grupo financiero referente en el ecosistema de servicios de inversión en pleno proceso de transformación digital como marco para su iniciativa data-driven. Participarás desde el principio en todo el ciclo de definición, implementación y mejora continua de la solución, con una visión transversal y global siempre alineada con la estrategia corporativa en lo referente a "data". Colaborarás con las distintas áreas del grupo y formarás parte de un equipo multidisciplinar. Liderarás muchas de las actividades demostrando tu capacidad para trabajar en equipo y entregar valor de forma continua, involucrando a los interesados durante todo el proceso con una clara orientación al Cliente.

Descripción de la oferta

Las principales funciones serán:

Definición del data pipeline.Recogida, análisis, exploración, limpieza y transformación los datos de diferentes fuentes así como su almacenamiento en los repositorios adecuados.Desarrollo y optimización de procesos ETL.Modelado para el análisis y explotación de la información mediante modelos dimensionales.Analizar y trabajar junto con los distintos departamentos los datos disponibles para descubrir insights, optimizaciones y nuevas necesidades del negocio.Acostumbrado/a a trabajar en entornos On Premise y Cloud.Gobernanza del dato, garantizar la calidad y fiabilidad. Trabajar en implementación de mejoras.Perfil del candidato

El perfil seleccionado deberá aportar:

Experiencia y conocimientos en desarrollo de ETL's, con el consumo de orígenes de datos de diversa naturaleza (APIs, Webhooks, datos no estructurados, etc.).Conocimiento de SCMs como repositorios para la gestión de código.Experiencia trabajando en entornos de Microsoft: Azure Data Factory, SQL Server Analysis Services y SQL Server Integration Services.Experiencia en herramientas de visualización: Power BI.Experiencia trabajando con arquitecturas híbridas (On Premise & Cloud).Se valorará experiencia con JIRA y Confluence para la gestión de tareas y documentación de proyectos y procesos.Se valorará conocimiento y experiencia previa en entornos financieros/Fintech.Perfil con alta capacidad de autonomía y decisión como principal responsable.Proactividad e iniciativa. Orientación al Cliente y a la entrega iterativa de valor dentro de un marco de mejora continua.Acostumbrado a trabajar dentro de equipos multidisciplinares.Oferta de empleo

Oportunidades de carrera y desarrollo profesional.Formar parte de proyecto en pleno desarrollo.Incorporación inmediata.Contrato indefinido. Modelo de trabajo: Híbrido (teletrabajo y oficina).Oficinas en Barcelona y Madrid.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Auto req ID: 267292BR

Job Description

Locations: Barcelona, Spain; Vitoria-Gasteiz, Spain

PepsiCo is using the power of data to transform the way our world famous portfolio of brands are sold every day. Our Data Science & Analytics group influences every aspect of how we sell and move our products. In just a short period of time, they’ve built new capabilities that have defined the data science roadmap across all of our brands. Members of our team solve complex problems facing our rapidly changing business and get to see their work come to life in the real world.

Join PepsiCo’s Data Management and Operations team which develops quality data collection processes, maintains the integrity of our data foundations and enables business leaders and data scientists across the company to have rapid access to the data they need for decision-making and innovation.

Role Summary

As a Data Engineer, you will be the key technical expert overseeing PepsiCo's data product build & operations and drive a strong vision for how data engineering can proactively create a positive impact on the business.

What Will You Be Doing More Specifically
Active contributor to code development in projects and services. Manage and scale data pipelines from internal and external data sources to support new product launches and drive data quality across data products. Build and own the automation and monitoring frameworks that captures metrics and operational KPIs for data pipeline quality and performance. Responsible for implementing best practices around systems integration, security, performance and data management. Empower the business by creating value through the increased adoption of data, data science and business intelligence landscape. Collaborate with internal clients (data science and product teams) to drive solutioning and POC discussions. Develop and optimize procedures to “productionalize” data science models. Define and manage SLA’s for data products and processes running in production. Prototype new approaches and build solutions at scale. Create and audit reusable packages or libraries.

Qualifications/Requirements

Minimum Qualifications: 
3+ years of hands on experience with software development, data engineering, or systems architecture: 3+ years of experience with Data Lake Infrastructure, Data Warehousing, and ETL/ELT pipelines. 3+ years of experience in SQL optimization and performance tuning, and development experience in programming languages like Python, PySpark, Scala etc.). 2+ years in cloud data engineering experience in at least one cloud (Azure, AWS, GCP). Experience in the following areas: Hands-on experience in developing Data Analytics Solutions in Cloud environments: designing, implementing, deploying, and monitoring in agile methodology by understanding CI/CD principles Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development and data mining. 

Preferred Qualifications: 
Experience on Azure Data Platform Experience in data modeling; understanding of Data Architecture Layers Multi-source management, enrichment; Data Cleansing Data-oriented mindset with an emphasis on compliance awareness (e.g.: PI, GDPR, HIPAA, etc.) 

Additional Qualifications: 
Analytical approach to problem-solving; excellent interpersonal and communication skills Ability to understand and translate business requirements into data and technical requirements. Strong change manager: comfortable with change, especially that which arises through company growth. High degree of organization and ability to manage multiple, competing projects and priorities simultaneously. 

What makes us different? 
Hybrid work model: combination of remote and collaborative office experience to enable innovationEntrepreneurial environment in leading international company Professional growth possibilities & learning opportunities Diverse team from over 25 countries Variety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeing Free Friday afternoon & during the month of August Relocation package & sponsorship to work in Spain if applicable 

About PepsiCo

We believe that culture should be at the cornerstone of everything we do at PepsiCo D+A. We operate with start-up mindset – agile, innovative and not afraid of failure. We want our team to come to work every day excited to explore new ways bring enjoyment, refreshment and fun to the world.

PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is the future of our organization – a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people.

So, if you’re ready to be a part of a playground for those who think big, we’d love to chat.
 We encourage the diversity of applicants across gender, age, ethnicity, nationality, sexual orientation, social background, religion or belief and disability

PepsiCo Data & Analytics Overview:

With data deeply embedded in our DNA, PepsiCo Data & Analytics transforms data into consumer delight. We build and organize business-ready data that allows PepsiCo’s leaders to solve their problems with the highest degree of confidence. Our platform of data products and services ensures data is activated at scale. This enables new revenue streams, deeper partner relationships, new consumer experiences, and innovation across the enterprise.

Relocation Eligible: Not Applicable

Job Type: Regular

title: Data Engineer
description:
En CleverData.ai seleccionamos a un Data Engineer para participar en proyectos de Analítica Avanzada que gestionamos desde la compañía.
¿Quienes somos? 
En CleverData llevamos a cabo proyectos reales de Analítica Avanzada utilizando las últimas técnicas de Machine Learning para ayudar a nuestros clientes en las áreas de Inteligencia de Cliente y Operaciones Eficientes. 
¿Qué harás? 
La transparencia, proximidad y excelencia son nuestros valores, por ello queremos explicarte qué harás en CleverData. Serás responsable de la definición, diseño e implantación de: El stack tecnológico adecuado y la estructura de datos para cada cliente y caso de uso. La recogida, análisis, exploración, limpieza y transformación los datos de diferentes fuentes así como su almacenamiento en los repositorios adecuados.Los procesos de ingesta, almacenamiento y explotación de la información (ETL). Preparar los datos en base a las necesidades definidas en los requerimientos de negocio de los clientes. Desarrollo APIs y aplicaciones que utilizan el potencial de los modelos predictivos. Mantenimiento de la calidad e integridad de los datos a lo largo del tiempo. ¿Qué ofrecemos? 
Incorporación en una compañía ágil, dinámica y especializada que utiliza las técnicas más modernas de Analítica Avanzada y Machine Learning desde hace más de 7 años.La posibilidad de participar en proyectos de Analítica Avanzada desde la definición del proyecto hasta su puesta en producción para ofrecer valor al cliente. Capacidad de influir en la estrategia de la compañía aportando tu visión y enriquecer nuestras soluciones con tu experiencia y tu punto de vista. En CleverData ofrecemos una serie de medidas para que puedas desarrollarte 360ª y conseguir todo aquello que te propongas, para ello tendrás la oportunidad de acceder a un paquete retributivo completo que incluye: Plan de carrera personalizado, para ello tendrás acceso a cursos de formación a cargo de la empresa y a certificaciones oficiales. Clases de inglés en remoto sin coste para ti.Sistema de retribución flexible en guardería, transporte, seguro de salud y dietas. Referal bonus, si traes a gente con tanto talento como tú. 
REQUISITOS MÍNIMOS:
Si te gusta trabajar con datos, recogerlos de fuentes abiertas, estructurarlos, trabajar en los modelos crear aplicaciones predictivas y desarrollar APIs,, nos encantará que formes parte de nuestro equipo.
¿Qué buscamos?
Perfil personal
2 años de experiencia en puesto similar.Capacidad de resolución de problemas complejosCapacidad de trabajo en equipo.Iniciativa y agilidad en la toma de decisiones.Flexibilidad y capacidad de negociaciónPerfil profesional
Experiencia con herramientas ETL como SSIS, Data Factory, Talend, Pentaho, ...Experiencia en diseño e implementación de soluciones basadas en la suite de Microsoft.Experiencia en BBDD SQL y NoSQL.Deseable conocimientos en el entorno AWS , Azure, Google CloudDeseable conocimientos ecosistema HadoopDeseable conocimientos en entorno Google (Tensorflow, Big Query) Programación en Python, librerías de análisis de datos (pandas, numpy, matplotib, seaborn) Desarrollo de APIs y aplicaciones web con Frameworks como Django y Flask. Deseable conocimientos en programación en Spark,Java, R, Pytorch Herramientas de gestión de versiones (Github o Bitbucket)Herramientas de visualización de datos (PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik, SAS Viya) Máster en Analytics, BigData, AI o similar

title: Behavioral Data Engineer
description:
NetquestNext time you go shopping, think about this: What if brands asked for your opinion on their products before they put them on the shelf? Wouldn't that be nice? At Netquest we give voice to the consumers enabling them to shape the products and services of tomorrow. How? We deliver consumers' genuine opinions and data to help companies create better products for you.
JOB DESCRIPTIONNetquest is looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join our Data & Analytics team. At Data Analytics, we are responsible for providing the company with the right data to make informed decisions. Specifically, the data engineering team owns the entire Business Intelligence data platform. Our current tech stack involves both open source tools like Apache Airflow, dbt or Apache Spark, and AWS services like Redshift, AWS EMR, AWS Batch or S3.
We are now expanding our horizons. Netquest wants to generate extra value by merging data from various and unique origins such as declarative, behavioral data and many more. And who better to carry it out? Us! We aim to revamp the existing data pipelines with state of the art architecture. With it, we will transform huge amounts of data to generate fruitful insights for our clients. We will be providing our customers with a full understanding of how users behave, with special attention to Ecommerce. We are ready to apply our knowledge to create Data Products, and we need a hand.
Are you looking for a new technical challenge? Come help us start on the right track! Your opinions will be heard and you will have an impact from the get go.

The main responsibilities of the Data Engineering team are:
Own the entire Business Intelligence data platform. Formed by the Tech Stack previously mentioned above.Collaborate with the Data Scientist and Analysts to solve the business needsDesign and revamp existing Clickstream Data Pipelines to create new Data Products for Netquest
Your main responsibilities will be:
Understand current and future needs of the clickstream dataTake ownership of current pipelines end-to-end to evolve and maintain themEvaluate current Data Architecture of certain pipelines, and propose solutions to improve themAutomate all production data pipelines with tools like Apache AirflowHelp implement Data Governance processes to keep a clean Data Lake / WarehouseHelp Data Scientists build MLOps projects

 SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONSYoure a great candidate if…
You have at least 2 to 5 years of experience as a Data Engineer working on AWSYou're an ace at data modeling, able to keep into account the needs of multiple users and can code SQL in your sleep, optimizing queries for performance and maintainabilityProficiency writing code in Python, Java or ScalaYou are knowledgeable with various ETL/ELT techniques and frameworksYou have experience designing data architecture for Big DataYou are able to work-out effective solutions under uncertain or ambiguous circumstancesYou're always willing to learn something new and embrace a healthy debate.
It's a bonus if you have:
Experience building Data Lakes on S3 with Apache Iceberg or Delta Lake.Experience building data pipelines with dbt.Experience with Redshift, AWS EMR, AWS Batch, AWS Kinesis Firehose.Some experience working with agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban/SAFe).

title: Data Engineer II, Data Platform
description:
Who we are: 
Want to make an impact? Join our pack and come work (and play!) with us.
We believe everyone deserves the unconditional love of a pet—and at Rover, our mission is to make it easier to experience that love. Founded in 2011, the Rover app and website connect dog and cat parents with loving pet sitters and dog walkers in neighborhoods across the US, Canada, and Europe. We empower our community of trusted pet sitters and dog walkers to run their own pet care businesses on Rover with the tools and security of a global company to back them.
Headquartered in Seattle, Washington, we work closely with our teams in Barcelona, London, San Antonio, Spokane and remote locations. We’ve got a reputation for being a great place to work, having been named among the 100 Best Companies to Work For in Seattle Business Magazine and Washington’s Best Workplaces in the Puget Sound Business Journal. We're an agile, fast-growing company, and our leadership comes from some of the world's most respected tech companies. 
At Rover, our furry coworkers are just as important as our human ones—and we wouldn’t have it any other way. Along with making the joys of pet parenthood more accessible, we’re committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and welcoming community of pet people—and that starts with our employees.
Data Engineering at Rover:
Data powers everything at Rover. We are a small team that works closely with all parts of the organization to ensure that the data available to the business is fresh and accurate, our application databases are healthy, and our reporting infrastructure meets the needs of everyone from analysts to the C-suite. We love fine-tuning our databases, breathe observability, and enjoy building self-serve tools that reduce time to insights for our users!Do you want to help modernize our Data Platform by contributing to our ETL platform? Perhaps you're passionate about the customer, and want to build tooling that makes machine learning model development a breeze. We touch all things data-related at Rover, which means you'll get the chance to work on exciting and impactful projects and learn a ton along the way!
Your Responsibilities:
Build tools that empower our engineers, data scientists, and analysts to quickly get key business insights. Design, develop, and test high-performance batch and stream data processing systems and tools. Modernize and monitor Rover's infrastructure and data pipelines to ensure Lights On, Doors Open!
 Required Skills:
3+ years of data engineering or relevant industry experience.Strong coding skills in both data and software engineering contexts.Experience developing ETL tools and/or managing data infrastructure.
Nice To Have:
Experience building self-service data tooling for Data Scientists and Analysts.Passionate about automated testing and delivering good quality code.Experience working with tools like Airflow or Luigi to schedule ETL jobs.Familiarity with our tech stack: Python, Redshift, MySQL, Postgres, Kafka, Spark, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform. 
Benefits Of Working At Rover:
Competitive compensation and benefits package including stock options, 401k match, flexible PTO, commuter benefits and medical, dental, and vision insuranceAlso, pet benefits! Including $1000 toward adopting your first dog or catStocked fridges, coffee, soda, and lots of treats (for humans and dogs) and free catered lunches semi-monthlyRegular team activities, including happy hours, snow tubing, game nights, and more
You must be authorized to work in Spain. We are not sponsoring at this time.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
At Data & Performance team of Schneider Electric, we are building Intel Data Store (IntelDS), a global Data Lake for enterprise data. It is a Big Data platform fully hosted on AWS and connected today to more than 40 data sources.

The job purpose is to support the big data engineering team building and improving IntelDS by:
Connecting new sources to enrich the data scope of the platform.Design and develop new features based on consumer application requests to ingest data in the different layers of IntelDS.Automate the integration and delivery of data objects and data pipelines.

What will you do?

Prepare data and make it available in an efficient and optimized format for our different data consumers, ranging from BI and analytics to data science applications. It requires to work with current technologies used by IntelDS and in particular Apache Spark Spark, Apache Presto, and RedShift on AWS environment. This includes:
Design and develop new data ingestion patterns into IntelDS Raw and/or Unified data layers based on the requirements and needs for connecting new data sources or for building new data objects. Working in ingestion patterns allow to automate the data pipelines.Participate to and apply DevSecOps practices by automating the integration and delivery of data pipelines in a cloud environment. This can include the design and implementation of end-to-end data integration tests and/or CICD pipelines.Analyse existing data models, identify and implement performance optimizations for data ingestion and data consumption. The objective is to accelerate data availability within the platform and to consumer applications.Support client applications in connecting and consuming data from the platform, and ensure they follow our guidelines and best practices.Participate in the monitoring of the platform and debugging of detected issues and bugs

What qualifications will make you successful? 
+4 years prior experience as data engineer with proven experience on Big Data and Data Lakes on a cloud environment.Proven experience working with data pipelines / ETL / BI regardless of the technology (6+ years’ experience of the full software development lifecycle on Business Intelligence).Proven experience working with AWS including at least 4 of: RedShift, S3, EMR, Cloud Formation, DynamoDB, RDS, lambda.Big Data technologies and distributed systems: one of Spark, Presto or Hive.Python language: scripting and object oriented.Expert in SQL for datawarehousing (RedShift in particular is a plus).Familiar with GIT, Linux, CI/CD pipelines is a plus.Strong systems/process orientation with demonstrated analytical thinking, organization skills and problem-solving skills.Ability to self-manage, prioritize and execute tasks in a demanding environment.Strong consultancy orientation and experience, with the ability to form collaborative, productive working relationships across diverse teams and cultures is a must.Willingness and ability to train and teach others.Ability to facilitate meetings and follow up with resulting action items.
Discover everything that we offer:

Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.

title: Quality Data Engineer
location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
description:
At Boehringer Ingelheim we develop breakthrough therapies and innovative healthcare solutions in areas of unmet medical need for both humans and animals. As a family owned company, we focus on long-term performance. We believe that, if we have talented and ambitious people who are passionate about innovation, there is no limit to what we can achieve; after all, we started with just 28 people. Now, we are powered by 50,000 employees globally who nurture a diverse, collaborative and inclusive culture.

Our innovation power wouldn’t be possible without our people. That’s why in Boehringer Ingelheim you will have the opportunity to develop your career while improving the world’s health!

If you want to take one step forward in your professional journey in a virtual, international and multicultural environment, Boehringer Ingelheim is the one for you!

Growth together with the team as a and be part of a Global Top Employer company where you will be involved in interesting projects that which will lead you to your fullest development!

The Position

We are looking for a Quality Data Engineer to work collaboratively with a team dedicated to the modernization of a traditional data warehousing environment and Apache big data environment to an API cloud-based architecture on Amazon Web Services

Duties & Responsibilities
 Performs testing, maintenance, construction and development of large-scale Datasources / AWS data ingestion pipelines, integration processes and databases.  Works with users to define existing or new system scope and objectives.  Provides analytical support and technical advice during the conceptualization, development, and implementation phases.  Assembles large, complex sets of data that meet non-functional and functional business requirements  Creates data set processes for verification, acquisition, mining and modeling.  Identifies process improvements to data extraction from SAP (Q modules), understanding of quality laboratory processes and possible updates.  Designs and implements processes for optimal extraction, transformation and loading of data from various data sources using AWS, as well as, SQL and NoSQL data technologies 
Requirements
 Bachelor´s or Master´s degree in computer science or similar experience.  At least 2 years of experience in IT Database Systems, Pipelines and Big Data Environments and able to support Demand Management Process from Demand conception to implementation.  At least 2 experience in AWS native tools set: S3, Redshift, Kinesis, Glue, Athena, Batch/Step-Functions  Experience with Data Warehousing and analytic tools such as Apache Spark, Hadoop, HIVE.  Experience in delivering solutions in an Agile/DevOps environment, using the Atlassian tool suite (Jira, Confluence) and working Experience with the AWS Code Development Kit (Big Plus)  Deep understanding/experience of workflow and data pipeline dependencies and runtime automation concepts.  Deep understanding on manufacturing standards like ISA95, ISA88 is a plus.  Experience in data extraction from SAP and experience in the quality modules is a plus  Ability to build and optimize data sets, 'big data' data pipelines and architectures, perform root cause analysis and identify opportunities for improvement. Data transformation, workload management, data structures, dependency and metadata  Desirable Knowledge of Data Streaming.  Experience working in an international and intercultural environment.  Excellent spoken and written English.  Willingness and readiness to travel.  Communicate effectively, collaboration skills and excellent analytical thinking, open mindset, thinking out-of-the-box with innovative ideas. 
#IamBoehringerIngelheim because…

With us, you can grow, collaborate, innovate and improve lives. We offer challenging work in a respectful and friendly global working environment surrounded by a world of innovation driven mindsets and practices. In addition, flexible learning and continuous development for all employees is key, because your growth is our growth.

These Are Some Examples Of How We Will Take Care Of You

We are continuously working to create a great employee experience.
 Flexible working conditions  Life and accident insurance  Health insurance at a competitive price  Investment in your learning and development  Gym membership discounts 
If you have read until here, what are you waiting to apply? We want to know more about you!

title: Junior Data Engineer
description:
Company Description

Gameloft Barcelona, the studio behind the mobile gaming hits Despicable Me Minion Rush and Asphalt 9 Legends is looking for a Junior Data Engineer to join the team.

About Gameloft

Leader in the development and publishing of mobile games, Gameloft® has established itself as one of the top innovators in its field since 2000. Gameloft creates games for all digital platforms, two of which are featured in the “Top 10 Games by All-Time Worldwide Downloads” from App Annie. Gameloft operates its own established franchises such as Asphalt®, Order & Chaos, Modern Combat and Dungeon Hunter and also partners with major rights holders including Universal, Illumination Entertainment, Disney®, Marvel®, Hasbro®, Fox Digital Entertainment, Mattel® and Ferrari®. Gameloft distributes its games in over 100 countries and employs 4,600 people worldwide. Every month, 114 million unique users can be reached by advertisers in Gameloft games with Gameloft Advertising Solutions, a leading B2B offering dedicated to brands and agencies. Gameloft is a Vivendi company.

All trademarks referenced above are owned by their respective trademark owners.

About Gameloft Advertising Solutions

With a monthly audience of more than 113 million unique players and an inventory of 2.4 billion impressions, Gameloft Advertising Solutions offers advertisers a unique level of visibility and engagement. To date, Gameloft Advertising Solutions has delivered more than 3000 campaigns for prestigious brands such as Air France, Coca-Cola®, Ford, FOX™, Kellogg’s®, McDonalds, ©Netflix, Procter & Gamble, Samsung and Unilever, in over 40 countries around the world (North America, Latin America, Middle East, Africa, Europe, Asia, etc.).

All trademarks referenced above are owned by their respective trademark owners.

Job Description

Gameloft Barcelona is searching for a skilled and self-motivated Junior Data Engineer to join our central analytics engineering team. This role will collaborate very closely with data analysts, data scientists, peer data engineers and analytical engineers to continuously improving analytics solutions for the whole company.

Responsibilities
Design data models in best practicesSupport ELT/ETL data stackCreate, maintain and optimize our internal ELT/ETL processes and data pipelinesGive support to other data practitioners

1 year of proven track record as a Data Engineer, BI Engineer or Analytical EngineerGood knowledge of SQL, mastering DML and DDL best practicesKnowledge in Data modellingKnowledge in ETL processes and toolsFamiliar with one of the programming language Python, Java or JavaScriptGood communication, you are both a team player and a self-contributorInterest for the gaming industry

Experience with Snowflake, dbt and Looker

Why Join the World of Gameloft?
Because you want to be part of an exceptional experience within a company that is constantly growing!Because you want to work with talented people who are industry pioneers!Because you want to be part of an international environment with daily contact with other countries & cultures!Or, just because you’re looking for a great place to work! 
Benefits
Permanent contract, full-time job with excellent Social Benefits.25 vacation days per yearPrivate medical health insuranceFlexible compensation with Ticket Restaurant CardFree language coursesFree coffee and fruit every morning!Free afternoon on your birthday!Merit based salary progression system and a competitive initial salary package.Career-development opportunities.Excellent local working conditions (quality of offices, geographical location of office in the centre of Barcelona).... and Thursday afterwork beers!

title: Data Engineer
description:
Description

Data Engineer, Amazon EU Ops Engineering Services

Job Description

The EU Engineering Services Team is looking for an experienced Data Engineer. As a Data Engineer, you will need to review technical design, develop and enhance data systems and pipelines supporting process optimization in reporting, planning, and controlling activities in EU Engineering Services, as well as integrate in-house data infrastructure with partner systems. You should be an expert in the architecture of data warehousing solutions, using multiple platforms and tools. In addition, you should have strong analytical skills and excel in the design, creation, management, and business use of large data sets, combining raw information from different sources. Similarly, you will be responsible for designing and implementing scalable extract, transform, and load (ETL) processes to support the rapidly growing and dynamic business demand for data, and use it to deliver the data as a service, which will have an immediate influence on day-to-day business decision making. Moreover, you will create automated alarming and dashboards to monitor data integrity. Finally yet importantly, you should have very good communication skills and ability to adjust communication to different groups of stakeholders, collaborating with architects, BI engineers, data scientists, business analysts/managers, to evaluate business needs and objectives in order to set up the best data management environment. Overall, you will be the subject matter expert for the data structures and usage, while striving for efficiency by aligning data systems with business goals.


Basic Qualifications
 Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science/Engineering, Informatics, Mathematics, or a related technical discipline 5+ years of industry experience in data engineering, data science, business intelligence or related field Knowledge of data management fundamentals and data storage principles Demonstrated strength in data modelling, ETL development, and data warehousing/lakes Database design and administration experience with various RDBMS, such as MS SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MySQL, etc. Experience architecting data solutions with AWS products including Big Data Technologies (Redshift, RDS, S3, Glue, Athena, EMR, Spark, Hive, etc.) and/or Microsoft Database Software Stack (SQL Server/SSIS/SSAS) Advanced SQL and query performance tuning skills. Experience building data products incrementally, integrating and managing large data sets from multiple sources 2+ year of coding experience with modern programming or scripting language (Python, Scala, Java, etc.).
Preferred Qualifications
 Master’s Degree in Data Engineering, Applied Data Science, Data and Web Science, or related certification Knowledge of systems engineering to optimize integration of data service/software solutions with data infrastructure Proven track record of applying data engineering for enabling business analytics (Engineering, Operations, Finance, etc.) Experience providing technical leadership and mentoring other engineers for the best practices on data engineering Experience using business intelligence reporting tools (AWS QuickSight, Power BI, Tableau, etc.) Knowledge of software engineering best practices across the development lifecycle, including agile methodologies, coding standards, code reviews, source management, build processes, testing, and operations

Company - Amazon EU SARL (Spain Branch)

Job ID: A1524972

title: Senior Analyst, Channel Data Product - EU Remote
description:
Who We Are

Vista’s Data and Analytics (DnA) organization is working to make our company one of the world’s most well-known and successful data-driven companies. The cross-functional team includes product owners, analysts, technologists, data engineers and more – all focused on providing Vista with information and tools we can use to deliver jaw-dropping customer value. DnA team members are empowered to learn new skills, communicate openly and be active problem-solvers. Find out more at https://vista.io/

What You Will Do

In the channel data product team, we use data from across the organization to support decision making for marketing optimization. We are looking for an experienced analyst to help us build channel data products that will enable Vista to win our customers’ hearts, minds, and loyalty. Join us on this journey!
 Work closely in a complementary team. You will be working with and learning from a closely integrated team of data product owners, data scientists, data engineers and other data analysts in a fast-paced, agile environment that focuses on delivering customer value early and often.  Build new or enhance existing data products. You will help develop scalable and automated data products as well as predict, implement, and measure resulting changes to our channel marketing strategy.  Build dashboards to enable decision-making. You will partner with business stakeholders to understand their questions and enable self-service decisions by building dashboards.  Data Exploration and Visualization. You will provide visibility and context for marketing performance by doing ad-hoc investigations, identifying trends and drivers, performing exploratory data analyses, and communicating views to our stakeholders.  Be curious and innovative. You will bring novel and untested ideas to the table to constantly innovate how we define and measure success of our work for customers and the business.   Your Qualifications:  

At Vista, we value the experiences that individual team members add to our culture. Please don't hesitate to apply even if you don't meet the exact qualifications, we look forward to learning more about you!
 Proficient in SQL, with 3+ years’ experience using visualization tools (preferably Looker, others include Tableau or Power BI).  Good communication skills to present and report findings effectively and engagingly to various audiences.  Excellent organizational skills, good attention to detail and ability to effectively deliver on projects supporting multiple business partners.  A resourceful and driven problem solver.   Nice to Have:  
 Proficiency in other programming languages (e.g., Python, R).  Experience with web analytic tools (i.e., Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics).  Good understanding of Channel Marketing use cases.  Strong background in statistical concepts including testing methodologies.   Why You'll Love Working Here:  

Being at Vista means that you don’t see work as just a building, a desk or a manufacturing floor. You see it as a chance to take a step forward in your career journey – and your life. We strive to give you everything you need to learn, grow, and succeed. Through innovation, collaboration, and perpetual exposure to what’s next, we’re always pushing boundaries and broadening our horizons. We embrace the chance to operate outside of our comfort zone to discover what we’re capable of. Some might call that a challenge; we just call it another great day at work.

Vista has received numerous recognitions including a perfect score of 100 on the Human Rights Campaign Foundation’s 2021 Corporate Equality Index (CEI) naming us a Best Places to Work for LGBTQ Equality. We also earned a place as one of the best remote-first workplaces in the U.S. and on the Boston Best Places to Work list from Built In. In addition, Vista’s CEO, Robert Keane, was recently honored with Comparably’s Best CEOs award, listing him among the top CEOs according to employees. Vista offers numerous support systems including Employee Resource Groups like Pride, Mosaic, and Women in Technology, and special interests communities to foster awareness, respect, and inclusion within the workplace.

We're Remote-First

In 2020, Vista adopted a Remote-First operating model and culture. We heard from our team members that having the freedom, autonomy and trust in each other to work from home and, the ability to operate when they are most productive, empowers them to be their best. Vista also provides collaboration spaces for team members to work physically together when it's safe to do so and when in-person collaboration will deliver the best results. Currently we are enabled to hire remote team members in over 30 US States as well as several countries in Europe, including Spain, Germany, UK, Czech Republic, the Netherlands and Switzerland.

About Us

As an e-commerce powerhouse, Vista creates customer value (and delight) through accessible, cutting-edge technology. We are the marketing partner to millions of small businesses around the world. For more than 20 years, we have helped small businesses look and feel credible through high-quality marketing products and solutions that include signage, logo apparel, promotional products, face masks, flyers, postcards, business cards, websites and digital marketing. With Vista, small businesses are able to create and customize their marketing with easy-to-use digital tools and design-templates, or by receiving expert graphic design support. In 2020, Vista acquired 99designs to expand its design offering via a worldwide community of more than 150,000 talented designers to make it easy for designers and clients to work together to create designs they love. Vista is focused on making great marketing and design accessible to every small business owner, allowing them to create a cohesive brand image for use in-store, online and on-the-go.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Vista, a Cimpress company, is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national or ethnic origin, nationality, age, religion, citizenship, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender presentation, legal or preferred name, marital status, pregnancy, family structure, veteran status or any other basis protected by human rights laws or regulations. This list is not exhaustive and, in fact, in many cases, we strive to do more than the law requires.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Dear Data Engineer, welcome to our mission;



Who are we?


We are Docplanner Tech, a group of people working in Engineering, BI, & Product teams across the globe, driven by the Docplanner Groups' mission to make the healthcare experience more human for our patients, doctors, and clinics; and we do it well. We are a leader in 13 countries (and growing!), creating a SaaS tool for over 130k active doctors, who are directly connected to our marketplace which is trusted by over 80m patients, monthly.


We keep it simple and focus on what matters most. Patients easily book a visit and experience healthcare as it should be: humane. And doctors grow their office and dedicate time to help their patients, all whilst we cover the administration, so they don't have to!


Why Docplanner Tech? Because nothing feels better than working on the good side of tech. You go to bed knowing that you make the world a better place and that your talent is aligned with what you believe in. What's more? We do this with fierce passion, absorbing inspiration and radiating ideas. Defining goals, and as entrepreneurs, having the autonomy and space to experiment, we are encouraged to not be afraid to fail.


We love what we do, together. This is no joke, Docplanner Tech really is this special! If you don't believe us, check out our Glassdoor...


And why is it so important that you are a part of our mission?


Because we believe that you, as Data Engineer will be a part of the Data Platform Team where decision-making support begins. We share the experiences of data engineers, sql developers and a project manager to bring software development standards to the analytics world. We are here because we know for a fact that data is crucial to make the healthcare experience more humane.


The Data Platform Team is more than a central hub for analytical data across the company: we are responsible for ensuring that every team has the data and tools they need. We also serve analytics teams across the whole company, and we collaborate to bring the best insights to life together.


What does the role of a Data Engineer do?



 Work in the Data Platform Team and cooperate closely with engineering, product and data teams. Integrate data sources and optimise data processing. Develop our infrastructure in close cooperation with Platform & Reliability engineers. Work alongside analysts in making data experience more human. 
Requirements:

What skills and experiences do we want you to have?


 Terms such as ["data " + elem for elem in ["warehouse", "lake", "orchestration", "engineering"]] are the bread and butter of your experience. Experience with Python & SQL with good coding practices. Hands-on experience with cloud technologies and data pipelines (ie. Airflow, Luigi, dbt, NiFi). Good Docker skills and familiarity with Kubernetes. You are an excellent analytical thinker and possess problem-solving skills. Very good command of English (both spoken and written). 




Which skills are ‘bonus points'?


 Familiarity with various big data and DevOps stuff (Spark, Kafka, RabbitMQ, Hudi, Helm, Terraform). Experience in CI/CD for the data environment. Experience in testing data processing. ML models operationalisation (ie. in Docker, Kubernetes) 
Benefits:

 A competitive salary adequate to your experience and skills between 16.000 € - 82.000 € gross yearly. The range is broad so that we can accommodate our roles for all levels of experience, but we will show you the career ladder to decide, together, what your skills are and what impact you will bring. Your salary will be, now and always, 100% transparent to you  Share options plan after 6 months of working with us  Remote work or hybrid work model, with hubs in Barcelona, Warsaw, and Rome  Flexible working hours (like, for real), plus a Summer intensive schedule every day of July and August Private healthcare plan with Adeslas for you, and subsidised for your family (medical and dental), plus employee access to Docplanner Care, our premium patients portal   23 paid holidays, exchangeable local bank holidays, plus an additional paid holiday on your birthday or work anniversary Relocation support to either Spain or Poland (we handle the bureaucracy so you don't have to!) Free English and Spanish classes Access to hundreds of gyms for a symbolic fee in partnership for you and your family with Andjoy  Flexible remuneration and benefits system via Flexoh which includes: restaurant card, transportation card, kindergarten, and training tax savings  20% time rule, enabling you to spend 20% of your working hours on your own development  
If you are applying for one of our positions outside our office locations and wish to work remotely within your permanent residence CET +/- 2, you will be hired via our Global Employer, Remote.com. Remote.com works with local benefits providers to build our packages; but you can expect the same salary range and the majority of benefits that we have in Spain, Poland, and Italy, plus a budget for travel and integration

 We are committed to promoting equal opportunities in employment. All job applicants will receive equal treatment regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation. Please let us know if you will require any additional support in your recruitment process.


Important: Docplanner Tech is an international English-first company. Therefore, please be sure to send your CV in English 

 Your buddy for this Recruitment Process will be Berenika Konieczny 


Want to see how life at Docplanner Tech is and what to expect? Take a look at our pages to get a better idea:


Facebook | Docplanner Tech page | Medium | Glassdoor | Linkedin | Twitter


You can also join our community by signing up for our Newsletter.



Desired Skills and Experience
AirflowHelmHudiKafkaLuigiNiFiRabbitMQSQLSparkTerraformdbtdockerkubernetesmysqlpython

title: Data Engineer - BI (They/She/He)
description:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

We are a product-centered company, and data is at the core of product development. In this role, you'll work with key business and product leads, analysts and data scientists to understand the business domain and how data can empower them. Your day-to-day will involve engaging with fellow engineers to develop a robust and scalable platform, to make the process of producing data and deriving insights efficient. You are passionate about the quality of the data you produce and take pride in having your data drive our business.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Design, implement and maintain pipelines that produce business-critical data reliably and efficiently using cloud technologies Collect, process, and clean data from different sources using SQL, Python, or other scripting languages Improve data discovery and literacy: create exploration and visualisation interfaces in our BI tools and promote the use of these sources across the company Think big and contribute to the strategy for better data quality within Glovo Design and develop nimble dashboards to support the analytical needs of the business Collaborate with many Product, Engineering and Business teams to produce relevant data solutions that can be used across multiple use cases 
You Have
Between 2 to 3 years of experience working in business intelligence, analytics, data engineering, or a similar role Experience designing and building scalable and robust data pipelines to enable data-driven business decisions Experience in collecting requirements and creating data modeling designs Knowledge of modern data warehouses (Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery) and big data structures Experience implementing enterprise dashboarding tools Strong proficiency and experience with SQL and Python Experience working with modern BI tools like Tableau, Looker, Qlikview Good understanding of software development and agile methodologies Passion for analyzing large complex datasets and converting them into information which drives business decisions Excellent spoken and written English. 
Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan Attractive Relocation package (if applicable ;)) Comprehensive Private Health Insurance Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!) Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months! Discounted Gym memberships Flexible working environment 
What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
GAS: Driven to deliver quality results quicklyGood Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openlyStay Humble: Self-aware and open to learningCare: Uplift people and the planetGlownership: Act as proud ownersHigh Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

title: Support Data Engineer
description:
¿Te apasiona la tecnología y te gustaría formar parte de una empresa referente en el sector energético?  En Grupo DISA buscamos a una persona que se incorpore a nuestro equipo de Transformación Digital, repartido entre nuestras sedes de Tenerife, Gran Canaria y Madrid.  Este departamento se encarga de explotar los diferentes datos de la compañía con el objetivo de generar valor en los negocios del Grupo. Utilizando estrategias data-driven para generar modelos que permitan mejorar u optimizar los procesos y servicios actuales, así como buscar nuevos modelos de negocio.
¿Cuáles serían tus principales responsabilidades?- Resolución de peticiones de mejora y evolutivos en los diferentes proyectos relacionados con la plataforma de datos de la compañía.- Monitorizar, diagnosticar posibles incidencias y optimizar el rendimiento de todos los procesos de ingeniería de datos.- Subsanación de diferentes incidencias en los proyectos en producción. Requisitos:- Titulación en Informática, Física, Ingeniería, Matemáticas o similar, o FP en Informática.- Idiomas: inglés, nivel medio.- 1 año de experiencia con SQL o tecnologías similares.- 1 año de experiencia en programación orientada a objetos (Python, Java, C#...).- Experiencia en gestión de repositorios de código con Git. Se valora:- Experiencia en componentes cloud, preferiblemente Azure (Databricks, ADF, blob storage…)- Experiencia en CI/CD- Experiencia en Azure DevOps- Conocimientos en materia de protección de datos ¿Qué ofrecemos?-Incorporación inmediata.-Contrato indefinido.-Formación continua y desarrollo profesional.-Incorporación en las Políticas de sistema de teletrabajo, flexibilidad horaria y medidas de conciliación.  En nuestro departamento valoramos la motivación, la capacidad de trabajo en equipo, saber focalizarse en conseguir resultados, la proactividad y las ganas de mantenerse formado para estar siempre al día en las nuevas tecnologías.
Si crees que puedes ser un/a buen/a candidato/a para esta oferta y no cumples con alguno de los requisitos, anímate igualmente a participar añadiendo a tu CV tu carta de motivación y presentación para que podamos valorar adecuadamente tu candidatura. Las personas que concurran a los procesos de selección y evaluación serán valoradas en base a los requisitos del puesto de trabajo con objetividad, transparencia y respetando el principio de igualdad de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres.

title: Data Engineer
description:
We are looking for a Data Engineer for the core of our application. We are looking for a generalist software developer who loves learning new things and facing new challenges but we also value if you have some deep experience about specific topics such as scalability, XP practices, algorithms, web development, etc.
We work remotely but you can also work in Madrid offices. At the moment we are only seeking candidates in Europe (UTC+02:00 or similar).
If you don't have some of the requirements, but you are willing to learn, have an open mind and this job offer resonates with you, don't hesitate to contact us.
Nextail is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status
We offer
A highly innovative and fast-paced environment. As in any startup, expect to find a team with an interesting mix of business profiles (without the slides), IT geeks, data scientists, and as a fashion tech startup, a few fashion victims.
The satisfaction of delivering something new to the world that will have a strong impact both on retailers’ top line and on customer satisfaction. Contribute to the development of cutting-edge artificial intelligence & machine learning technologies that will build the next generation of retail systems.The opportunity to work with top client decision-makers in the fashion retail industry and sharpen your business reasoning and interpersonal skills. Learn from peers from top consulting firms and the best global business schools.Flexibility in remote work and office hours, use of some of the most advanced collaborative tools.Periodic company get-togethers to meet the rest of the team.The laptop of your choice: We want you to work with the tools that are most comfortable for youApproximate salary range: €50.000 - €60.000Bonus + €1.000 as Learning AllowanceStock Options
Who you will work with
Juan Avedillo (COO): over 18 years of experience in technological transformation and innovation environments back him. He went through several different roles, industries, and countries as a consultant in McKinsey & Company for 9 years. He also worked in The Cocktail as the technical practices lead.Beatriz Domínguez (Head of People & Process Engineering): She has been working for years with teams from different backgrounds and cares about their growth and performance. What she enjoys most about her job is helping people to be successful. Bea is currently playing a key role in Nextail's growth phase.Miguel Garcia Lorenzo (Head of Engineering): With more than 10 years of experience leading technical teams in high-performance and real-time environments. He has worked in companies like Inditex, Oracle, among others. He is a believer in work based on three fundamental principles: team, architecture and automation. He enjoys sharing his knowledge through articles and conferences.
Job Requirements
First of all, we are looking for a good workmate to join the team. We value working in a safe and constructive environment where everybody can thrive over any specific technical skill.In our team, you will also find people focused on generating an impact in the company, rather than just taking on a new tasks to develop. We expect that the person who joins us is as excited about this bias towards impact and action as we are.
You will:Take ownership of features from design to operationIncrease the reliability of our software continuouslyParticipate in the development, deployment, and maintenance of multiple Data Pipelines.Work in a full cloud environment and with the top technologies.Implement KPIs and metrics to measure the performance and the impact our solutions have on the business.Encourage good technical practices in the squad.Participate in the decision-making process of your product together with the Product Manager.You bring:Practical experience with complex ETL processes and KPIsExperience scaling data pipelined algorithms.Professional experience with AWS or Google Cloud or Azure.Strong experience with large analytical and transactional databases.Experience with software monitoring tools.Big data framework (Hadoop, Spark, Flink, Dbt, Apache Kafka)Container technologies (Docker, schedulers, orchestration, repositories)XP practicesCI and CD practicesAnother backend / systems language (Pyhton, Java)

title: Online Marketing Data Engineer
description:
We are building a world-class Online Marketing Technology organization and we are seeking a highly motivated and driven back end Online Marketing data engineer to design, implement and maintain data pipelines along with building the backend of applications and services to automate, simplify and de-risk processes currently manually executed. This will help marketers to spend less time on repetitive tasks and to better measure the impact of marketing spend.

Data and automating processes is at the core of our online marketing campaigns and in this role, you'll work with key marketing leaders to understand their business domain (search engine marketing, app marketing, display advertising, retargeting) and how data and technology can empower them.

You will work along with other Analysts, Data Scientists and SW developers and will drive automation and insights for the eDreams Odigeo internal marketing teams, which are among the top Google, Microsoft Bing, Facebook and Criteo customers by spending in Europe.

The Online Marketing Technology team members are passionate about data, automation, statistical models, technology and innovation and love to work in a collaborative and agile environment. Team members are eager to learn and grow, to deep dive into things, to share constructive feedback and they welcome feedback from other team members. They also love challenging the status quo and are constantly thinking of new ways of doing things. You will be spending most of the time on data manipulation (pulling and merging data from external data sources through API’s or internal cloud) with the end goal to build software and algorithms for intelligent task automation. This position will report directly to the Marketing Measurement and Technology lead. Join us and help us reach our ambitious goal of becoming the global leader in online travel!

Job Responsibilities
 Collect, process, and clean data from different sources using SQL, Python, or other scripting languages;  Build applications that help analysts and marketers to work more efficiently;  Automate Online Marketing tasks, processes and best practices (also through browser automation) by building Python algorithms;  Help the team to create a best in class data & automation vision and strategy;  Assist in designing the architecture of the applications in order to minimize the development time and ensure we don’t build what can be already found in the market;  Investigate and diagnose problems, carry outcode and deployment fixes, and keep documents up to date;  Collaborate in a fast-paced, agile environment that focuses on delivering value to our customers early and often;  Help the broader team to improve the way of working and make suggestions to improve it;  Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team. 

Required Qualifications
 Degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science, etc.), a PhD is a plus;  Strong working knowledge of Python - ideally at least 4 years of experience. Having worked in the online marketing domain is a plus;  Experience using SQL or other database languages;  Some experience in designing the architecture of an application from start to finish;  Experience with cloud technologies (ideally Google Cloud);  Good communication & collaboration skills, able to give and receiving constructive feedback;  Good written and verbal communication skills in English;  Positive reviews as a team player with strong positive attitude;  Ability to research using internal knowledge bases and public facing documentation (Google Cloud Platform documentation, StackOverflow, etc). 

 What can make you stand out: 
 Experience working with Agile Methodology (Kanban highly valued);  Experience with Google Analytics / website analytics platforms is a plus;  Experience with Google, and/or Microsoft Bing and/or Facebook API a plus;  Familiarity with modern API technologies (OAuth, RESTful APIs)  Good analytical skills;  Knowledge of digital marketing & advertising technology ecosystem;  Knowledge of any other programming language is a plus. 

 What do we offer? 
 We support a phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance with our flexible hours and flexible remote work policy.  Fun at work: At eDreams ODIGEO, work and fun go hand in hand!  Excellent environment for continuous growth and learning: you will have access to internal soft skills and technical skills training as well as language lessons  A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels  We support a phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance (e.g. half-day Fridays, team building activities, flexible hours)  Flexible benefits scheme: Ticket Restaurant, transport, private health insurance, etc.  Free subscription to O'ReillyOnline Learning  We like our eDOers happy and healthy! Free fresh fruit and coffee for all and a significant Andjoy discount!  Special discounts in other local venues, such as gyms, restaurants, shops, etc.  Amazing offices in the heart of Barcelona with a beautiful terrace to have a break and enjoy the views. 

… And the opportunity to work on a dynamic, dedicated, fun, and passionate team of professionals.   We journey together! 

Come fly with us and join us now.

eDreams ODIGEO under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo –is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

title: Data Engineer - BI (They/She/He)
description:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

We are a product-centered company, and data is at the core of product development. In this role, you'll work with key business and product leads, analysts and data scientists to understand the business domain and how data can empower them. Your day-to-day will involve engaging with fellow engineers to develop a robust and scalable platform, to make the process of producing data and deriving insights efficient. You are passionate about the quality of the data you produce and take pride in having your data drive our business.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will

You Have
Between 2 to 3 years of experience working in business intelligence, analytics, data engineering, or a similar role Experience designing and building scalable and robust data pipelines to enable data-driven business decisions Experience in collecting requirements and creating data modeling designs Knowledge of modern data warehouses (Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery) and big data structures Experience implementing enterprise dashboarding tools Strong proficiency and experience with SQL and Python Experience working with modern BI tools like Tableau, Looker, Qlikview Good understanding of software development and agile methodologies Passion for analyzing large complex datasets and converting them into information which drives business decisions Excellent spoken and written English. 
Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan Attractive Relocation package (if applicable ;)) Comprehensive Private Health Insurance Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!) Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months! Discounted Gym memberships Flexible working environment 
What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
GAS: Driven to deliver quality results quicklyGood Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openlyStay Humble: Self-aware and open to learningCare: Uplift people and the planetGlownership: Act as proud ownersHigh Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of September 30, 2019, we’re currently present in more than 26 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.
