title: Lead Data Engineer
description:
About the Fintech They are a social network for investors, they help everyone not only to manage their investments but also make informed financial decisions. Their app allows people to exchange ideas with friends, family, and financial experts on topics related to investing.
Who they areThey have a multicultural team of professionals with years of experience in hyper-growth startups, consulting, agencies, and investment banking. They share an entrepreneurial mindset and are not afraid to think big - just like our investors. Now they operate in over 6 countries and will be expanding globally in the coming months.
Your workYou will be the first person in our data department, and you will design and build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a variety of data sources using AWS or google cloud.Working hands-on, you create new events and implement data pipelines and data integration solutions with Python.Digging deep - You debug, troubleshoot, and improve cloud-based applications and suggest improvements to our current data architecture.You work with stakeholders to align solutions and data integration with business objectives.If necessary, you help with analyzing and interpreting the data.
What you get from themYou will have the freedom to drive your topics forward on your own initiative and follow a steep learning curve.We are an international, highly motivated, and fast-growing team, where working together is simply fun.Short and fast decision-making processes allow you to give free rein to your creativityA modern office in the heart of BerlinA healthy mix of home office and office days - they like to be together as a team, but also understand that everyone has their own rhythm, family, and lifestyleReasonable compensation and the opportunity to get a stake in the company round out our offer to you
Your skillsYou have several years of experience in a comparable position or as a consultant.We are growing quickly - Your professional experience in a fast-moving environment (e.g. successful start-up) means that nothing can get you out of control in a hurry.With your strong skills in database development, data integration, data-gathering methodologies, and APIs, you are the go-to person when it comes to making things measurable.Your demonstrated ability to understand requirements and deliver accurate results according to scope will make your stakeholder management easy.Knowledge is power! - This is why you have a strong command of python and any modern cloud-based data stack, as well as experience with AWS services and Service-Oriented Architecture.You speak English fluently (German is an advantage)
🌎 Hybrid (Berlin) or remote (EU)
📧 Interested in applying? Please click on the ‘Easy Apply’ buttonAlternatively, send your resume to antonella.balmaceda@storm2.com for more info or to have a confidential conversation.
⚡ Storm2 is a specialist FinTech recruitment firm with clients across Europe, APAC, and North America. To discuss open opportunities or career options, please visit our website at storm2.com and follow the Storm2 LinkedIn page for the latest jobs and intel.

title: Data Engineer
description:
¿Eres un apasionad@ de la programación y del procesamiento de datos? ¿Te gusta el procesamiento en streaming? ¿Eres inquiet@ y siempre buscas mejorar?En idealista estamos buscando un ingenier@ de datos para nuestro equipo de tecnología.Si te gusta estar rodead@ de buen@s compañer@s, trabajar con buen rollo y en un ambiente colaborativo ¡sigue leyendo! Seguro que idealista te va a gustar ;)
¿Qué harás?• Trabajar junto a tus compañer@s del equipo haciendo crecer la infraestructura de datos• Desarrollar con Apache Flink y Scala, entre otras tecnologías, procesos en streaming para proveer de datos al resto de equipos• Trabajar codo con codo con el equipo de plataforma y el resto de equipos de desarrollo para desplegar componentes asegurando su escalabilidad, alta disponibilidad y correcta monitorización
¿Qué te ofrecemos?Ahí va:• Podrás ver el impacto directo de tu trabajo en una de las webs de referencia tanto en España, como en Italia y Portugal. Para los que no lo hayáis vivido ya: no sabéis el cosquilleo que da en la tripa la primera vez que ves algo que has hecho en una plataforma que utilizan millones de personas.• Oficinas en el centro de Madrid y distribuídas en entornos de trabajo colaborativos por si te apetece ir algún día a la ofi.• Somos Remote Friendly :)• Vas a aprender. Lo decimos en serio. La plataforma va evolucionando constantemente, y de ahí sacamos mogollón de charlas internas, posts, talleres… que hacen que el conocimiento fluya.• Además… patrocinamos eventos, acudimos a ellos y hacemos meetups en la oficina. ¡Es tan importante aprender como enseñar a tus compis!• Además de tu salario, podrás acogerte a un plan de retribución flexible (tarjeta de transporte, cheques gourmet, seguro médico…) del que te podrás beneficiar desde el primer día• Clases de Inglés, italiano y portugués• Fruta fresca y café siempre disponible en la cocina.• ¡También tenemos fisio, servicio de piscología, clases de yoga en la oficina… porque para nosotros lo más importante es cuidar de nuestros idealistas!• Además de trabajar, nos gusta pasarlo bien, por eso que si te unes a nuestras familia, cada mes celebrarás algo…Halloween, San Valentín, Navidad,…¡Te lo vas a pasar muy bien!• Relocation en tus primeros días en Madrid, sabemos que cambiar de casa no es una tarea sencilla
¿Qué esperamos de ti? Sobre todo que te apasione el mundo de los datos, pero además no estaría mal si:
• Tienes experiencia en el procesamiento de datos, y nos puedes hablar de ello.• Has trabajado con herramientas como Flink, Spark, Storm, Beam, Kstream...• Te has peleado alguna vez con temas de infraestructura.• No subes nada si no tiene test. Sí, todos nuestros procesos de datos como no, tienen test :P• Si no tienes ninguna experiencia en procesamiento de datos, pero eres un backend experimentado con una base sólida en “best practices”, arquitectura hexagonal, servicios, y quieres un cambio, también queremos conocerte• Nosotr@s trabajamos en equipo. El equipo son tus compañer@s; pero también lo es la gente de producto así como la gente de negocio, etc.• Te gusta este mundillo. Y te encanta saber que vas a tener que estar aprendiendo durante toda tu vida laboral. Además, eres lo suficientemente humilde como para aceptar las enseñanzas de tus compañeros, y lo suficientemente generoso como para compartir con ellos tu conocimiento :)• Tienes curiosidad e iniciativa. Al final, este trabajo va de los problemas que somos capaces de resolver y de cómo logramos hacerlo. Así que se espera de ti que seas capaz de analizar, preguntar, pedir ayuda (y ofrecerla), y saber plantear soluciones a los mismos.
¿Qué otras cosas son un plus?• Tienes conocimiento y has trabajado con eventos• Conoces y has usado bases de datos columnares• Conoces y has usado Kafka.• Te manejas bien con la programación funcional• Has participado en algún proyecto de datos desde 0
Estamos deseando conocerte y que nos conozcas.¿Aceptas el reto?

title: Data Engineer
description: Data Engineer - Work from anywhere We’ve partnered with one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance, and insurance-based risk transfer. They create and deliver ground-breaking R&D and robust technological capabilities to generate data-driven insights on existing and new risk pools and the economic context within which they operate. We're looking for a Data Engineer with extensive knowledge of distributed computing frameworks to champion the delivery of complex data assets. Who you are:You eat, sleep and breathe data engineering and are proficient in a couple of programming languages (Python preferred).You’re fluent in distributed computing frameworks, specifically PysparkYour experience in Palantir Foundry sets you apart.You’re well-versed in system design, data structures, algorithms, storage systems, and cloud infrastructure.You're an excellent communicator who thrives in Agile/Scrum teams. Your day-to-day will look like:Designing and implementing data pipelines in collaboration with data users and engineering teams.Ensuring reliability, data quality, and optimal performance of data assets.Transposing complex business and analytics requirements into high-quality data assets.Delivering high-quality code, focusing on simplicity, performance, and maintainability.Working with solution engineers, data scientists, and product owners to deliver end-to-end products. This is a fully-remote opportunity open to professionals in the EU.

title: Data Engineer
description:
At Sage, we recognize that the world of work has rapidly shifted over the last few years, particularly how we work. That is why we have committed to working in a hybrid way going forward. Human connection is an essential ingredient of the 4 principles that make up our Flexible Human Work hybrid framework and we want to be transparent in what that looks like when you join our Sage family. On one hand, our offices will continue to play an important role in our future and serve as a place for spontaneous conversations, connection, collaboration as well as focused time. On the other hand, we have learned to reimagine where and when we work and to unlock that flexibility and innovation for our colleagues offering them the opportunity to work flex across their home, Sage offices or customer sites.
As part of the Product organization, you will be part of a newly formed team that will own and manage Foundation Data and related Services that spans across products. You will play a valuable role in selecting the data stack (frameworks, tools) and driving products insights and creating new data products.
A lot of Start up spirit is required for this amazing project.
Key Tasks:Build data pipelines using data warehouses, data lakes, etc. including streaming data, batch data, sql queries, based on the use casesWorking across teams, translate solution patterns to drive the product data platform forward, developing canonical reference artifacts that can be used to increase capabilities across productsSupport software developers, architects, data analysts and others on data initiatives and ensure data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.Build, refactor and maintain data pipelines that ingest data from multiple sources, including data discoveryWork with various product teams to transform and model datasets for business use casesIdentify, design and implement internal process improvements through automation, data delivery and improve existing tools for greater scalabilityResearch and stay abreast of changes in data technologyParticipate in design discussions about new features and ensure real-time technology integrates seamlessly with other pieces of the platform
Your profile:Experience in BI and data platform engineering including data modelingComfortable with startup-mode cultureHands-on experience in building modern data pipelines from ground up and also transitioning MVP's into production systemsStrong experience in one or more data stacks: AWS, snowflake, Azure, databricksStrong SQL skills and familiarity with Hadoop ecosystem, streaming technologiesYou are passionate about data engineering including distributed systems architecture, databases (relational, nonrelational including graph dbs), data management, data modeling, programming, and data analysisB2+ in English – we work internationally, so that’s a must,Strong collaboration, communication, and organization skills – we’re a team and we want you to be a part of it!
Ready to take up this challenge? Contact us!This position is available in Spain with Flexible Home-Office option.
Why you would love to join us?*Latest technology stack;*International atmosphere;*Up to 5 days special personal leave per year for charitable work and volunteering of your choice;*Brand new office space, locates at the heart of Barcelona’s 22@tech district, with great transport links;*Brand-new high-spec equipment to work on;*Opportunity to travel and meet other teams that you cooperate with

title: Remote | Senior Data Engineer [OLX Autos]
description:
We’re looking for a Sr. Data Engineer to join OLX Autos, can be based anywhere in Spain.

About OLX

At OLX Autos we have a clear ambition: to empower millions of people across the globe by helping them connect and share their goods and services. We’re a team of 5,000 ambitious, curious people building marketplace platforms that make it super easy for anyone to buy and sell almost anything, boosting local economies. OLX Autos’s vision is to transform the way used-cars are traded worldwide. We’re a truly global team with two engineering hubs (Barcelona and Delhi) and more than 500 inspection centres across 10+ countries in the Americas, Europe and Asia, where we operate under our own as well as other well-known leading brands including CarFirst, Letgo and Webuyanycar.com.

We are looking for a:

We're looking for a talented Senior Data Engineer who will play an integral role in the technical development of critical tools and business workflows leveraging data for decision making.

As a data platform engineer you will be in charge of building, scaling and architecting one of the largest data platforms in the OLX group. You will develop services, pipelines and design data platform architectures around AWS technologies to process our data increasingly faster and more effectively. You will challenge our status quo and help us define best practices for how we work, and contribute to creating analytical layers with resulting action-oriented conclusions.

You will also have the freedom to work, prototype and research around state-of-the-art data architectures and paradigms, ensuring highly scalable, reliable and compliant data solutions.

Responsibilities:
Designing, crafting, and maintaining a cloud-based (AWS) data platform.Building robust distributed systems to process large scale data sets for high data availability and quality.implementing and automating data pipelines with high industry standards.Creating data governance frameworks and processes for regulatory compliance.Work with cross functional team to understand the data extracted from different applications
What skills are we looking for?
Lead a project independently with a high sense of ownership.Understanding of cloud-native platforms (preferably AWS) and distributed architectures.Proven experience in Python.Demonstrated strength in data modeling, pipelines development, and data warehousing.Experience using big data technologies (e.g. Hadoop, Cassandra, Spark, Hive, Kafka) and querying tools (e.g. Redshift, SparkSQL, Hive, Presto).
Nice to have skills:

Data Integration and processing. Building platforms not transformation. Large data exp. Strong skills in building data compliance. Solid Methodology
AWS data ecosystemData lake architecturesData governance applied to cloud/enterprise platformsStreaming processing (e.g. Kafka , Kinesis, Storm, Flink, Spark Streaming)JVM based languages, such as Scala and JavaRelational SQL and NoSQL databases (Cassandra, DynamoDB, and Solr/Elasticsearch)Task orchestration tools (e.g. Jenkins, Airflow, Luigi)Infrastructure-as-code tools (e.g. Terraform, Cloud formation)Machine Learning engineering solutions
While we are a technology company we hire humans and not robots. If you aren't completely confident that you fit our criteria, please reach out anyways. We would love to know you better and explore how we can work together!

What we’ll give you: 
Thrill of building and managing global products that are used daily by millions all over the world.International team of top engineers from Amazon, Google, and other top start-ups and companies across the globe learning from one another.Dedicated training budgets to allow you to keep improving your skills.Remote working and flexible working hours.Competitive salary and great benefits 
OLX Autos is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is core to our values. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Data is a key part of AXA’s journey “from Payer to Partner”, and its transformation to a Data Driven company. To succeed in this journey, AXA Partners Data Strategy has been organised around 6 pillars: Enable Business initiatives, Protect Data, Organize and Govern initiatives, Manage Data, Empower People on Data, Deliver and operate Data Platforms.

Data Engineering is therefore the cornerstone of the data transformation journey, ensuring strong IT Data capabilities foundations, implementing sustainable Data Operations with high level of service delivery and enabling any analytical initiatives, to provide at the end business value across AXA Partners.

AXA Partners has defined a decentralized operating model for data appointing data teams in BUs and geographies to be responsible for the proper deployment of data strategy closer to business owners. Whereas a Central Data Office manages the Data Platforms, Big Data & Analytics frameworks, standards and guidelines.

As a Data Engineer, part of a Data Team, your main mission is to maintain and enhance the operationality of the Data Team Assets or components at the right-level to ensure that the Data Team Strategy’s ambitions can be met and customers are served with the right level of quality.

Your second mission, as a Data Ops, is to implement and enhance the current production data flows of the Datalake (from extraction to business actionable consumption).

Your third mission, is to support, upskill and advise on processes or technical tasks, other Data Fellows of your Data Team in the achievements of their own data jobs.

You will be part of the overall Data Partners community, and a key actor of the Data Engineer Network.

Key ResponsibilitiesContribution to data road map definition, in coordination with other teams/customersInteract with data scientists, analysts and business to define data sourcing strategy regarding the use-caseManage interactions with data providers or other data engineers of other data teams for data lake project and BAU tasksSupport to other data fellows: technical demonstrations, UAT, training, expertiseShare with Central and community for data assets evolutionTake part in the strategic decisions of target data components with other of the Data FamilyDevelopment and automation of ingestion flows, data curation and access layersDefine solution urbanizations and take part in the development and deployment of applications following central standard and guidelinesContribute to the improvement of standards and datalake processes for the Data FamilyDesign, develop, test, promote and industrialize data ingestion flows, datamarts and core jar of target data componentsImplement tools and end-to-end monitoring to ensure high availability of production data processing, data quality and reliabilityMaintenance of data treatments in the LakePerform BAU and report regularly on this activitySolve issues and problemsSupport other technical data experts of your data team (data analysts etc.) or data end users in the use of data lake, applications or current platform assets
Your Profile

Skills And Experience

Technical/ Functional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
You are fluent with the Big Data stack in cloud environment (ADLS, Databricks, ADF, Azure DevOps etc)You have a very good understanding of spark processesYou are fluent in multiple development languages You have a good understanding of the software development process (git, ci/cd etc.)You have first knowledge about BI systems (Spotfire, AAS, Power BI)BI skills are a plusEntrepreneurial, team and can-do spirit, able to work unsupervised and with problem-solving skills, constantly striving for effective solutions Creativity, innovation mindset and ability to correctly take into account technologies low stacksCustomer-centric with quick reactivity on issues or changing requirements to deliver high-level of serviceWorking with Agile mindset in an international, multicultural and complex environment (English is mandatory)
Experience

Education, Professional Qualifications and Experience
Master’s degree in IT development with Big Data majorMinimum of 2-year experience in production Big Data environment (build & run), with a proven expertise in data engineering/analytics projects, ideally in major and multi-cultural organizations with large-scale data.Fluent English, French is a plus (with willingness to learn)Experience in Insurance/Assistance would be appreciated
About AXA

AXA Group is the worldleader in insurance and asset management. We protect and advise our clients atevery step in their lives, by offering products and services which satisfytheir needs in the areas of insurance, personal protection, saving and assetmanagement. AXA is the leading insurance brand worldwide, with over 100 millionclients. We are transforming from payer to partner for our client, with astrong focus on risk prevention.

Our mission:Empower people to live a better life.

Our values: Customer First, Courage, Integrity and One AXA.

About The Entity

AXA Partners is an AXA transversal business unit offering a wide range of solutions in assistance services, travel insurance and credit protection.

AXA Partners’ role is also to implement innovative solutions emerging from the AXA Innovation unit.

Combining passion with advanced expertise, we design and deliver worldwide solutions for partners and communities. We protect what matters, when it matters.

What We Offer

By joining AXA Partners, youwill work in a responsible company, which offers a real culture of expertise& diversity. Our focus is on accelerating the development of everyone’sskills, whilst offering attractive and competitive compensation andopportunities for professional development and growth.

Additionally, atAXA, we work to make a real difference to people - when amazing things happenand when we create opportunities for a better life, the feeling of pride isextraordinary.

210007AB

title: Database Engineer
description:
The Role

We are seeking an experienced individual to join our Global Technology team as a Database Engineer. In this role, you work with a global engineering team to design, develop, and enhance database and ETL related code. You will support and refine database coding standards, and work with development teams to leverage them in practice. The ideal candidate would have deep technical expertise in ANSI SQL, ETL, and modelling development, possess strong organizational and collaboration skills, feel comfortable working across distributed teams worldwide.

What You’ll Do
Work across a geographically split team to deliver global data solutions.Manage development standards for database development (SQL and ETL)Collaborate with other teams in enterprise level projects and provide support / guidance as neededDevelop key components/templates for offshore teams, evangelize and educate themSupport of multiple SQL & NoSQL technologies; mainly Oracle & SQL data solutionsExamine database workloads and performance KPIs to tune and implement enhancementsBuild and improve automation for release pipelinesDetermine the most effective ways to optimize performance of existing solutionsCreate and maintain technical documentation.

What You’ll Bring
Expertise in ANSI SQL programming, particularly with SQL Server and OracleExpertise in ETL design and development, SSIS and Informatica are keyPerformance tuning experienceExposure to NoSQL and Graph programmingStrong attention to detailChampion team success over individual accomplishmentPassionate about learning and continuous improvementBachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field required3+ years of prior technology leadership and development experienceExcellent communication and problem-solving abilities.Ability to multitasking and quick learning.Commitment to satisfying internal and external customersStrong desire to winIntellectual curiosity, and a can-do attitude

title: Data Engineer - Remote
description:
Mattermost is an open source platform for secure collaboration across the entire software development lifecycle. Hundreds of thousands of developers around the globe trust Mattermost to increase their productivity by bringing together team communication, task and project management, and workflow orchestration into a unified platform for agile software development.

Founded in 2016, Mattermost’s open source platform powers over 800,000 workspaces worldwide with the support of over 4,000 contributors from across the developer community. The company serves over 800 customers, including European Parliament, NASA, Nasdaq, Samsung, SAP, United States Air Force and Wealthfront, and is backed by world-class investors including Battery Ventures, Redpoint, S28 Capital, YC Continuity. To learn more, visit www.mattermost.com .

We value high impact work, ownership, self-awareness and being focused on customer success. If these values match who you are, we hope you'll learn more about working at Mattermost and apply!

Mattermost is a data-driven organization, and we are looking for a best-in-class Data Analytics Engineer to operate, maintain and enhance our internal self-service data warehouse. You will be responsible for managing our Snowflake data warehouse, building and maintaining ETL and data ingestion processes, and providing assistance to other teams within the company who input data into the warehouse and carry out analytics with the data it holds.

Responsibilities
Design, deploy, own and maintain best-in-class data infrastructure (Snowflake, Airflow, dbt, EKS, etc.)Manage the development and operation of high-volume data pipelines to enable the business to make data-driven decisions.Partner with the Analytics team to build data models that are actionable for the businessDrive strategic and architectural decisions around the evolution of our data warehouse and pipelines.Write complex SQL queries and ETL pipelines.Collaborate with Product and Engineering teams to ensure that new products and features are instrumented to capture product usage data/telemetryProvide assistance to other teams within the company supplying data to the warehouse or consuming it for analytics.Design schemas and guide usage of the data warehouse to maintain it as a high quality source of insights.
Required Background/Skills
3+ years experience as a Data Engineer3+ years experience using PythonStrong SQL SkillsExperience building and managing a data lake in an enterprise settingExperience applying Software Engineering best practices to Data Analytics, including CI/CD, version control, infrastructure as code, etc.Experience in Schema Design, Data Modelling and Metadata managementComfortable working with a variety of different tools and scripting languages and flexible in your choice of key technologies in the data analytics stack.Ability to work independently in a small, globally-distributed remote team.Strong written and verbal communication skills and a proven ability to work with engineers, data analysts and non-technical stakeholders across all departments of an organization.
Nice To Haves
Experience developing software and scripts in Go and Javascript.Experience with Snowflake, Apache Airflow, dbt and Rudderstack.Experience with data visualisation tools such as Looker.Experience working in open source communities.
We Are Currently Hiring Staff In These Countries/regions

Mattermost is a remote-first company with staff living and working across the globe.

Australia - Bangladesh - Belarus - Brazil - Bulgaria - Canada - Chile - Colombia - Finland - Georgia - Germany - Greece - India - Ireland - Mauritius - Mexico - Norway - Pakistan - Philippines - Poland - Portugal - Spain - South Korea - Suriname - Turkey - Uganda - Ukraine - United Kingdom - United States

We are constantly working towards adding more countries/regions to this list, but first we need to make sure we are compliant with local laws and regulations, which takes time.

Mattermost is made up of people from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people from all walks of life. We don't discriminate against staff or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate!

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
About Us

Do you want to be part of a worldwide mobile games leader? We are an international team of more than 330 talented Socialpointers, based in sunny and cosmopolitan Barcelona. We create amazing games, positioned in the top rankings of both iOS and Android, that are played and loved by millions of fans all over the world. Join us and help us make this year the breakout year in mobile social gaming.

What will you do?

As a  Data Engineer you will help build the architecture that drives our business.

You will design and implement scalable systems that can handle 100K events per second and work with databases with over 150 TB of compressed data.

You will design Socialpoint’s Data Warehouse and ensure the highest level of data integrity and robustness. Finally, you will make all this data available to the different teams using cutting-edge visualization tools.

To achieve all of this you will work closely with awesome developers and data scientists to make Social Point’s BI tools and architecture the best in the industry.

This is you
 3+ years of programming or scripting experience (Python, Scala, Java, PHP...)  2+ years experience designing and implementing architectural components of a Data Warehouse in TBs scale. Preferably using Big Data/Column store DBs (Redshift, Snowflake, Vertica, BigQuery …).  2+ years experience implementing large scale ETL architecture, supporting multiple data sources (internal and external) and multiple use cases (product analytics, marketing, statistical modeling, executive dashboards).  Excellent SQL skills, you can optimize a query for a specific database and understand the different capabilities of open source DBs and vendor DBs.  You have strong dimensional modeling skills, you know how to design the best data model for each type of use case.  You work fast and can pivot quickly, know how to work in a startup environment and balance quality code with fast results.  You love to learn new technology and solve new challenges.  And you are also
 Professional, passionate about video games and analytics, problem solver, proactive, team worker, rigorous and data oriented.  You are smart, creative and pragmatic. You love researching the newest advances and finding practical ways to integrate them into your work.  You work fast without forgetting quality, quickly understand existing code and learn new concepts easily.  You understand Data Engineering is also about solving business problems, not just technical ones.  You have a good English level. 
Compensation & Benefits

Due to the COVID-19 crisis, we have employed a hybrid working from home/office system. So, what does this mean?  All we ask is that you live within commuting distance of our office in Barcelona  so you are able to come into the office for important meetings/events.
Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona (if you’re not already here).  An impressive 25 days annual leave , not including public holidays. Private medical insurance for you and your family, just in case.  Choose from the latest IOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).  Free language lessons (English, Spanish & Catalan). Spotify Premium for the first 6 months of your employment with us.  Legendary social events & parties to let off some steam.  People development is key for us: an amazing training budget just for you and internal mobility program offers real growth opportunities ! 
If you choose to work in the office some days, don’t worry - we have you covered. Check out some of our benefits tied to the office;
 State of the art gym facilities so you can level up your fitness game.  Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist .  Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet). 
Intrigued? We’d love to hear from you. Please click “apply” to level up and submit your application in English.

Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You’re welcome on the team no matter where you’re from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It’s a trick question – mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

title: Data Analyst Intern - Operations (They/She/He)
description:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, you’ll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives… all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo is looking for a Data Analyst Intern to join the Operations team. Would you rather read numbers than books? Are you looking for a challenging experience in one of Barcelona’s fastest growing Startups – helping build a product that will disrupt the on-demand market? If your answer is YES, we are looking forward to meeting you.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Be the main point of contact related to Data Analyze in detail the operations and logistics in the cities where we operate so as to extract local peculiarities that the system should consider Identify new strategic opportunities after interpreting trends or patterns in data sets Work within the Legal team, very close with the Data Analysts, Operations teams and other engineering teams, in a diverse and talented team Automate processes and propose solutions Follow up on action plans regarding legal KPIs Actively collaborate with your colleagues and learn from each other in a supportive environment that allows you to grow, develop and make a difference 
You Have
Degree in STEM-related fields or Business AdministrationExperience in data and analytics, with SQL and/or deep Excel understandingOther programming languages are a plus Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize and analyze significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracyProblem-solving skills, with the ability to transform complex requirements into simple solutions and decisionsProactive and organizedEasy-going and ready to adapt to a fast pace of workGreat verbal and written English communication skills, as you will need to be able to translate complex numbers into simple wordsAn empathetic, inclusive and curious attitude
We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!

Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Monthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products and zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders! Flexible time off (take the time you need) and hybrid working model (own your time) Online therapy and wellbeing benefit Discounted gym memberships Paid internship 
What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quickly Good Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openlyStay Humble: Self-aware and open to learningCare: Uplift people and the planetGlownership: Act as proud ownersHigh Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

title: Senior Data Analytics Engineer (she/he/they)
description:
About TrafileaTrafilea is a global company that builds communities and transformative brands. We own the brands and take care of the entire customer journey, to deliver wow-worthy experiences that influence and empower millions of people globally.Our culture is fast-paced and dynamic. We are data-driven enthusiasts, passionate about marketing, exponential technologies, and innovation.We have over 300 hundred employees working around the world, connected by the same purpose and core values. Our support for this new way of working has led to being featured in Forbes and FlexJobs as one of the Top 25 Companies for Remote Workers.We are looking for dynamic, dedicated, and committed individuals with a strong desire to grow, that can drive the brand forward on its truly exciting journey.Do you want to know more about our Brands? Shapermint, Truekind & Empetua
We’re looking for a methodical Senior analytics engineer / Senior BI Data Analyst to provide appropriate and accurate information required by business areas for their operations for our fast-growing shapewear online store, Shapermint.
Be a part of a team where you will:Analysis, Design, implementation, and maintenance dashboards, stories, and ad-hoc reports that produce business-critical data reliably and efficiently using cloud technologies.Collaborate with different teams and stakeholders to enable data-driven decision-making in the company.Collect & process data from different sources using SQL & Tableau.Analyze key metrics history and trends to find insights to improve operational work.Optimize current dashboard performance and data accuracy.Propose and define data validation controls to ensure data accuracy.Control and review periodically BI alerts.When an alert is triggered, review the data to find and solve the issues.Assess and communicate effectively the effort for required developments.Discover new data sources to improve new and existing data pipelines. Be in charge of building and maintaining data pipelines and data models for new and existing projects.Maintain detailed documentation of your work and changes to support data quality and governance.Provide feedback and expert points of view as needed to help thrive all data initiatives in the company.
Job requirementsBetween 2 to 3 years of experience working in business intelligence, analytics, data engineering, or a similar role.Strong knowledge in SQL and Tableau.Strong experience using source control management and CI/CD (GitHub actions/Gitlab pipelines).Highly analytical and quantitative, with strong attention to detail.Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively and great negotiation skills.Proactive in taking ownership of projects and issues.Capability to manage several projects and areas.Nice to have: Experience with the AWS data ecosystem (S3, Glue, Athena, Redshift, Lambda, EC2, RDS ...)Nice to have: Experience creating data pipelines and ETL processes in modern technologies using Apache Airflow as the main workflow management tool.Nice to have: Experience with DBT
What We Have to Offer:Proximity doesn’t influence productivity. As a globally distributed team, you can live and work wherever you want.A rich experience including the opportunity to collaborate with world-class talents. Encouraging transparency and open communication to all.A data-driven, dynamic, energetic work environment, full of talented, goal-oriented, and empathetic people working together to grow and develop both as professionals and human beings.A safe space to be who you truly are. We embrace and support diversity, equity and work hard every day to keep becoming more inclusive.Openness to new ideas and initiatives: You can always join a squad, tribe, or committee, start new ones. Bring your hobbies and passions and transform them into projects!
For more benefits please visit our Trafilea web Site.
Are you ready? Apply for this position today and join the fastest-growing startup in the world!

title: Data Engineer
description:
The Role

We are seeking an experienced individual to join our Global Technology team as a Database Engineer. In this role, you work with a global engineering team to design, develop, and enhance database and ETL related code. You will support and refine database coding standards, and work with development teams to leverage them in practice. The ideal candidate would have deep technical expertise in ANSI SQL, ETL, and modelling development, possess strong organizational and collaboration skills, feel comfortable working across distributed teams worldwide.

What You’ll Do
Work across a geographically split team to deliver global data solutions.Manage development standards for database development (SQL and ETL)Collaborate with other teams in enterprise level projects and provide support / guidance as neededDevelop key components/templates for offshore teams, evangelize and educate themSupport of multiple SQL & NoSQL technologies; mainly Oracle & SQL data solutionsExamine database workloads and performance KPIs to tune and implement enhancementsBuild and improve automation for release pipelinesDetermine the most effective ways to optimize performance of existing solutionsCreate and maintain technical documentation.

What You’ll Bring
Expertise in ANSI SQL programming, particularly with SQL Server and OracleExpertise in ETL design and development, SSIS and Informatica are keyPerformance tuning experienceExposure to NoSQL and Graph programmingStrong attention to detailChampion team success over individual accomplishmentPassionate about learning and continuous improvementBachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field required3+ years of prior technology leadership and development experienceExcellent communication and problem-solving abilities.Ability to multitasking and quick learning.Commitment to satisfying internal and external customersStrong desire to win

title: Data Engineer
description:
NOTICE: ONLINE RECRUITMENT PROCESS
LOCATION: BARCELONA OR REMOTELY FROM SPAIN SALARY: 13 000 - 22 000 PLN GROSS / NET 
There are more than 350 million reasons to join Brainly — one for every student you’ll help go from questioning to understanding. Team up with us as we build and continue improving one of the most popular ed-tech products on the planet. In a world of questions and uncertainty, you can be part of the answer as we shape the future of learning and change lives, one student at a time. If this excites you, you know what to do next.
Let’s get to know each other. And get ready to make a difference! 
ROLE OVERVIEW 
Brainly’s Community Q&A product is powered by hundreds of millions of contributors every month. To protect Brainly’s community and deliver a quality experience to all users, we rely on a combination of internal and external tools to help educate users, enforce our community guidelines, and moderate reports from users. As we grow and expand our tool set, we are additionally integrating with third-party tools to enhance our moderation capabilities and exploring additional technologies like machine learning and AI to further improve our behavioral feedback systems. 
As the person joining the Community Product team as a Data Engineer you will play a key role in developing the data infrastructure of the new generation of Brainly tools by creating efficient pipelines combining several sources of content to review/moderate as well as enabling effective data analysis of progress on performance and health of our Community.Ideally, if you are comfortable with backend development and infrastructure in order to research and guide the implementation of operational solutions for most optimal data processing.
Are you a goal-driven team player? Do you like tackling new challenges using leading-edge industry tools? Can you adapt to rapidly changing conditions while learning and bettering yourself? Are you a detail-oriented expert who loves focusing on quality? If you answered yes to these questions, you might just be the perfect candidate for this role! 
WHAT YOU'LL DODesigning, developing and owning operational data solutions for gathering and preparing data sets for further usage by moderating toolsDesigning, developing and owning reporting data solutions for further understanding and optimizing processesTaking care of the common Q/A data which is broadly used by the organizationDealing with data systems of different purposes: reporting, moderation, spam filtering with machine learning modelsWorking closely with stakeholders and engineers to understand needs and propose the best solution 
WHAT MAKES YOU THE PERFECT CANDIDATE3+ years in a similar position or related fieldWorking experience with backend architecture and developmentDeep understanding of data modelling concepts for both data warehousing and operational databasesWorking experience in implementing pipelines for both operational and analytical processesWorking experience in cloud infrastructureExperience in bash, shell scripting 
WHAT WILL BLOW OUR MINDSKnowledge of AWS and GCPExperience with data lakeKnowledge of MatillionETL, FivetranWorking experience with CMS toolsWorking experience with machine learning models deployment 
WHAT YOU GET BY JOINING BRAINLYWe want to see you grow along with us - you will have 800$ per year for personal development, extra time for attending conferences and workshops, and unlimited access to an online learning platform (courses from Coursera, Udacity, Udemy, Harvard ManageMentor, and many others!)Health is important, which is why at Brainly, we fully cover private health & dental care packages for you and your family and provide you with a sport card (Multisport Plus in Poland, Andjoy in Spain) You will also get an access to online individual psychological consultations with professionals in English & Polish via the Mental Health HelplineFlexible working hours - working requires communication, so we work within the European business hours, but we also know that life may be unpredictable, so if you need to jump out of work (doctor’s appointment, emergency, anything) - no problem!Your personal concierge AskHenry will support you in your daily duties, eg. planning your dream vacationWe will provide you with all the necessary equipment & tools, including an additional budget for accessories which will make your remote setup even more comfortable.You can join internal communities and contribute to charity, diversity and inclusion initiatives, take part in great internal events or represent Brainly at conferences or meet-ups. 
WHAT IS BRAINLY?
Brainly is the online learning platform where over 350 million students and parents go from questioning to understanding. With their smartphones, users can snap a photo to instantly solve any problem or homework question and be matched with a Brainly product such as Community Q&A, Brainly Tutor, Math Solver or Textbook Detective. 
Brainly is built to provide students, parents, experts, and teachers with a collaborative platform and tools needed to succeed in any educational environment. Based in Kraków, Poland, with U.S. headquarters in New York City, Brainly apps and websites are visited by users from over 35 countries.
Backed by Prosus, Point Nine Capital, General Catalyst, Runa Capital, Learn Capital and Kulczyk Investments. Learn more about Brainly at www.brainly.com. 
By sending us your application, you agree that Brainly sp. z o.o. with its seats in Krakow, will process your data contained in the form below and in the documents you attach in to participate in recruitment. In connection with this, you have the right to withdraw your consents, the right to access to your data, the right to obtain their copy, rectify them, erase, limit their usage and also data portability right and object to their use by Brainly, as well as to lodge a complaint with the President of the UODO. If you have any questions regarding the use of information about you and exercising your rights related to this use, please contact our DPO - privacy@brainly.com. If you want get to know more about how Brainly uses and process your personal data [https://brainly.com/careers/data-protection.html].
https://brainly.co/

description:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, you’ll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city.
